jB4VvLSI26d5394jDkpakQ.text: I'm in love. Evo's got a good thing going here, and if you haven't been yet then you need to go! Chef Chops cooked my girl friends and I such an amazing feast.   We began with the most beautiful charcuterie board, with cheeses, meats, spreads, and a bunch of yummy pickled items. Then we moved on to a delicious creamy burrata appetizer, followed by some arancini (fried risotto balls with a meat sauce), and house meatballs in a red sauce.   In between all these carbs and heavy-ish items, we sampled a beet salad as well as a broccoli stalk prepared with some pine nuts and I think a lemon sauce.   We also shared the fungi pizza, the roasted chicken entree, and one of the pasta dishes which sadly I can't remember the name of. Honestly everything was so good, there was nothing I didn't like. You can tell the staff has pride in their jobs and their products. Our server was a doll too.   If you check in on yelp you get a shot of Fireball for a penny. Which is awesome.

JLt7tVcBNuOCwIrtXYDl4A.text: We had an excellent dinner Friday night at this little gem of a restaurant. We arrived at 7:15, and were surprised to not find this place packed. We sat at the bar and had drinks while waiting for our friends to arrive. The bartender was friendly and efficient, and the drinks were delicious.   We moved to the dining area for dinner, and were greeted by our waiter. He provided us with the specials and grabbed us more drinks. We ordered the kale salad to start, and it was incredible. The dressing was a house balsamic, and the vegetable mix was perfect. Extremely impressed.   Dinner arrived shortly after, and it was incredible. We ordered the bolognese bad the chili shrimp pasta. Both were delicious.  This restaurant had a very hip atmosphere, attentive service, and the manager ensured we were enjoying our evening. We will definitely be back.

_gsNjkr9CfAfkdtpho9u3g.text: I tried this restaurant for the first time this weekend. What a hidden gem! The focaccia appetizer was probably one of the best things I've ever eaten. Perfect combination of savory and sweet. I love that the menu had a few traditional classics on it, but also some items that I would never think to try (but did) that were delicious. Our server was very attentive. This place would have gotten five stars if the food wasn't so expensive. I suppose it makes sense for the area though! I will absolutely be back!

STcViC_ZevpgljZpY5Ockg.text: The hostess was so rude I couldn't even stay and order. Go somewhere else that they treat you like a normal human being not someone beneath them.

UpjNnBcrkeu5hMUXoLR0nw.text: Decided to try this place since it was within walking distance of the hotel I was staying at during my trip to Scottsdale.  On first impression, it seemed trendy but it's actually really casual. A little dark inside but comfortable.  Cocktails were great, and so were the pastas. My lobster pasta was strong and the homemade pasta was clearly homemade. Very fresh and had the right texture and that "pasta" taste that so few restaurants get right.  Service was good, and prices were reasonable. Spent around $40 per person with drinks and tax/tip.

H947YX1KJh2tPHxivZMXZw.text: About a month ago, I arrived during Happy Hour time and sat at the bar. The bartender was in the process of making a drink only to find out it was the wrong one that someone else had ordered and set it aside.... I ordered the  Grapefruit Basil Martini about 10 min. later and low and behold, guess which drink he handed me..... yep, the one pushed to the side.  Really can't believe he did that knowing I was sitting there when the mistake occurred and that I overheard everything. Thanks, I'll pass... So, I ordered something else only to get Half a drink in a small squatty goblet type glass they use. Needless to say, not a great start.  I ordered the caesar salad... The dressing seemed really "light" or possibly watered down... the flavor was almost non-existent.  Next, ordered the Heirloom Tomato pasta.... That was very good, however, it was described as cappellini and it was actually a wider pasta like fettuccine.

4OEeMwudctku9RyobprjwQ.text: my wife and I joined EVO this past Saturday evening at Happy Hour and stayed on for dinner.  Very pleasant experience.  We ordered the Arancini, meatballs and charred octopus for appetizers and all were magnificent.  The meatballs were probably the best I have ever eaten.  We split a Caesar and my wife ordered a small pepperoni pizza and I had the pasta Bolonese for entrees.  All menu items were done to perfection.  Service was excellent and the House Cabernet was very drinkable unlike House wines served in many restaurants.  I was surprised by the reasonable pricing on food this good.  atmosphere is dark and romantic.  Leave the kids at home.  Have told all of our friends and will come back soon.  One minor item unrelated to food is that the like fixtures and chandeliers are in need of cleaning.  Thanks for a great evening

VBxr3Yedpam9WanycjdOMQ.text: I came here with two other gals to celebrate my coworker's big 2-9. She'd heard good things about EVO and scooped up a Local Dines deal so we were ready and excited to try the place out.  We walked in a tad late (sorry!) for our 8:00 reso on a Saturday night. The place wasn't PACKED, but had a healthy amount of tables. A bachelorette party, a large birthday gathering, a few couples at two-tops and a few other girl groups filled about half the dining room.  Service was a little confused at first. I'm not sure if they have sections or if one server was in the weeds or what, but we had both a guy and girl start off greeting us, then the girl took our drink order, then the guy came back for our drink order. It was figured out though, and we perused the short and sweet menu. We looked at the appetizer section but they all seemed a little too heavy. In other reviews it seems like they got bread/olive oil before their meals came? We didn't get that.  I opted for the vegetable risotto, which was completely delicious. It wasn't a bogged down risotto (I mean, it was as "light" as a risotto can be), with ample amounts of veggies dispersed throughout the dish. It was perfect for spring. The two other girls I was with got the Alfredo with chicken, which also didn't look too heavy or drowning in white sauce either. That's a nice touch with Italian food.  I felt like our server wanted to strangle us when we ordered a 2nd bottle of bubbly--maybe that's just my years of service industry talking but it just seemed like she didn't. wanna. be there. Hey, we were celebrating a birthday! When we were ready to leave, splitting the check and putting on the Local Dines deal was no problem, so that was nice.  All in all, I'd definitely go back to EVO; the food was really delicious. I just won't go RUNNING back.

V6KymKHYI3do0IL41XxkVg.text: Went here last night for the first time. Almost didn't bother to go in; the restaurant side only had one couple in it. Not a good sign for a good restaurant.  Bar had a dozen or so, though.   Caesar salad was bad. Extremely salty! Lettuce was limp. Must have been made hours early.   Had heirloom tomato pasta dish for entree. Pasta was a little on the heavy side. Maybe whole wheat? Overall, an ok dish. Not great, but not bad.   A little too dark for my taste. Needed phone to read the menu.   Serve was very good. Checked in regularly and took care of everything (water refill, second glass of wine, etc. ) himself.

z1KKfIxftwRGOBvR4dMjHw.text: So writing this is awkward.. but what was even more awkward was our dining experience the other night. On a serious note: if I wouldn't have been so happy to be with my friends (one of whom was visiting from SF) I think I would have flipped a tit at this experience in its entirety!  Lets start from the beginning - EVO is a nice restaurant. I have never been blown out of my mind, but I have never been disappointed either... until now.  We arrived at 7 and got seated right away--things started off ok. I am not sure if our server ever told us his name but either way, he got us some water and got our drink order. It took a little long for the wine to come out but whatever-- things happen, who cares. Us girls hadn't seen each other in quite sometime so we had immediately started talking and got caught up telling stories. Our server came back and asked "what he could get us." We had a few apps picked out and he also recommended another one. We were all STARVED so we thought the more the merrier! - Check - got the apps ordered.   He started to walk away, leaving me confused over my empty wine glass... he didn't ask if I wanted another. "Ah excuse me sir may I have another glass of wine... thanks." Wine came out (great) we get back to our conversation, intense gossip stories :). These stories were going and going and then I started to think...(This is where it gets awkward,) 'we ordered our apps like 30 minutes ago where are they?' I was not the only one in out group to take note of the incessant delay either. I was so very in to this story thought so I thought I would let it go, and maybe 15 minutes later they finally came out. We all noted how annoying it was but got over it, who cares, we're hungry, lets eat! So start eating our "APPETIZERS" and continued conversation only, fifteen minutes later....where did our server go?? Crickets... Bueller?? Bueller?? Oh there you are, and thanks for stopping by to drop a few ice cubes in the water glass, where is the water though? This is where it gets good...  (30 minutes later..) Server comes back...  "So, could I offer you dessert?"  Our reply... "ummm we haven't even ordered our dinneryet, can we maybe do that and also get some butter cake if we are doing this all at once?" Salads and desserts came out at the same time. At this point we don't even care so we eat it all at once. Finish that.. HELLO where are you now!!! CHECK PLEASE, hello??? 20 minutes later got the check and pay.  By far, this was the most awkward restaurant experience I have ever had and I hope to God if I ever end up back at this restaurant that this sever is no longer employed. I guess not everyone fits the bill.  XOXO

Xh3vNevoaxwppbJP6ZMN-g.text: This place is truly a diamond in the rough and I'm so glad I tried it out with a friend the other day. We caught the tail end of happy hour and got two appetizers. Bruschetta and the balls with pasta inside (can't remember what they are called). Every single thing we tried was fantastic! We got the lobster risotto, so amazing! We also splurged and got dessert-- the butter cake--to die for. It would be worth it to go here for the dessert alone. To sum up, there aren't a ton of places in Scottsdale that I can say the food is amazing. Lots of awesome spots for ambiance, drinks, etc. but this place is a great atmosphere and truly delicious. Check it out!

OcIf4GzhK0RVdiIoeFY9tg.text: Cute restaurant, food is delicious, though not amazing. Great for a quick bite. Southern Italian cooking. Dessert menu very small. They do feature an item from the NFL Chefs - Taste of the NFL Hunger Challenge, which is really cool!! Atmosphere okay. Plenty of parking.

OyEf9YNvBp6dPY5IXP6K2Q.text: Just plain unremarkable.  Can't remember what (obviously unmemorable) failed restaurant EVO replaced in it's current location, but I came here for a late lunch and was the only customer.  In a nutshell, my "specialty" drink was boring, food was under-seasoned and bland, and service was spotty and sometimes slow.   I ordered a portobello mushroom sandwich which, when it arrived, looked like it was made with plain white bread from the '60s.  I picked up the top slice of the bread and flipped it over. It was completely burnt on the underneath side and totally untoasted on the top. The same was True for the other bottom piece of bread on the sandwich. It looked as if it was positioned that way to hide the "burntness."   Not a good experience. Maybe dinner is better. I'll never know.

pmhUpEXSaJRdW0qraWsiyA.text: This place is really good! I went here last night with my fiance and coworker and we really enjoyed it. We sat outside on the patio because we were in gym clothes and not really dressed to sit inside. I got the pepperoni pizza which was awesome. My fiance got the chicken pasta and our friend got the cheeseburger with fries (the skinny fries had a very different, but awesome taste to them as well). I got the margarita, but the one on the menu was no longer available so the bartender made me a pomegranate one ($13). It was really, really good! (I may have gotten two.) Service was great and our waitress was really cool, always refilling our waters and very attentive. We also got the butter cake for dessert which was good. It was a little too sweet for me but the others loved it. A little pricey as our meal was over $120 for the 3 of us.... but we all got at least one drink so it really wasn't bad. Great place. Will definitely be back!

_RrhQ1Vzc_31lZ1q_TT-Vg.text: What a gem!!  EVO has a chic and cozy vibe and the food is simply amazing!  We stopped in on a Saturday and were surprised to find out they have happy hour daily. The arancini balls were so decadent and the polpettine were so tender and flavorful.  Hubby and I both had pasta dishes which were also very good, but the highlight was definitely the brown butter babycake that we had for dessert. It took 20 minutes to make, but was totally worth it!!  The crust on the cake was perfectly crisp and then you bite into a creamy center complemented by whipped cream and raspberries.  To die for!!  Can't wait to go back!

wB2zP3Pa3qGqJc-jbDUvZQ.text: Horrible risotto balls. No flavor at all. Sevice was sterile.   Dead flowers on the table. Why?  Pizza was odd tasting and chewy.   All the good table were open and they said they were all "reserved". Lame to say that to a customer at 4:30pm on a Friday. By the time we left, all those tables were still open.   This earned them a 1 star. You have to learn how to treat people!!

hRTZfAT1DjJApuMkM8oQHw.text: Wow! Amazing food and love their cocktail menu. I especially loved their use of basil in cocktails. My girlfriend ordered the Grapefruit Basil and I had the Controversy. The basil leaves were full and flavorful - they added a unique, fresh finish to the drinks. The restaurant pays special attention to detail and only uses high quality ingredients. I highly recommend this place!

B-NOyfCOBtMpmEGAGJ1OvQ.text: Went with a group and had great food and great service!  Very accommodating and the we all thought the food was delicious. They have great happy hour prices and wine on tap! Yummy!!

fTCe8r7bTUF44dtT35G6BQ.text: I hardly ever can give a 5 star for a restaurant that's very good to great ... As this one can be.  I've been to True 5 stars and they're sublime. And expensive. This is neither. And I love it!  Homemade pasta is excellent, as well as their drink service which includes made-in-house libations. Excellent, creative salads too.  Get a Happy Hour pizza and drink at the lively bar, and you'll feel like you scored a yearly bonus.  Local. Fresh. Authentic. Creative. At reasonable prices to boot.  SOLID 4 star.

loUxURR0AyHRYVujMr6bsw.text: Happy hour is nice & festive...the prices are right! Now that the weather is starting to cool down im going to be a bigger fan; especially of the patio!!

aBVKXtxzVsBBp8bDqXKxvg.text: One of the only places open late night. Quiet atmosphere, friendly staff. Had the pork belly. Kind of on the dry side but the bacon sauce made up for that. Great kale, chevre and Brussels sprout salad and ended with the bolognese pasta with meatballs.  Excellent dish.  Must try. Overall great experience and definitely will go back to try other dishes.

Q7iG7z1jZTI-Qxc18vwTbw.text: OMG this is a FANTASTIC spot! Amazing food and Brandon the bartender will definitely take good care of you. The EVO salad is clever and severely delicious. I ordered the chile shrimp tagliatelle and I bet any of the other housemade pastas are just as amazing. Definitely come here NOW!

R-G--J5WStoqZkzjqr68ow.text: Nice looking dining room and wonderful food. Great service and and beer selections.

Rf9YEoNFB9VSFkV522pRjQ.text: My friends and I whom are all from Scottsdale and Paradise Valley decided to check out this restaurant / bar this past Sunday as we had heard good things about it. We generally spend Sundays bouncing around to different places in oldtown trying different food and drink. As we entered we were greeted with a very friendly hello and welcome to Evo and we indicated we were simply going to the bar.  It is a very nice atmosphere and somewhat different from most of what Scottsdale has to offer.  Not that Scottsdale doesn't have many very nice and interesting places this just seem to have a different atmosphere.  We were there to take advantage of the happy hour pricing, enjoy a drink and to check the place out so we moved up to the bar.   The individual behind the bar looked to be a very happy individual however to get their attention as we were the only four people sitting at the bar one would think it shouldn't take too much effort, but it did.  They were busy taking inventory and that seemed to be more important than greeting us and  engaging us in general banter and conversation again since we were the only four there.  I must say as a disclaimer I am not certain what the bar puts more priority on, the customers or the inventory again as it was our first time there.  When I paid my tab it did not seem as though we were given the happy hour pricing but I didn't mind so much as it was a good and different drink.  I will perhaps check this place out again as I never make my final opinion on first experience however if 2nd time going is like the first I won't return.  I cannot and will not speak for the other members in my party this is simply my opinion. P.S. the food menu looked good.

yOSJw84Cl8F8nErwyheNeA.text: The food here is absolutely unacceptable. The pasta was undercooked, our cheese board, our other apps, and the pizza were completely bland. Our drinks just didn't taste good; we tried 6 of them. It was definitely a below average experience. The only bright side was our very nice server. He was very sweet I wish I remembered his name. He had a beard and dark hair . Good guy! Please fix the food.

ZMRCbN4eAiiJlaE2YhoxXA.text: Incredible job Evo!! The food is divine, I am in love with the brussel sprouts, which, by the way, I have NEVER liked. Presentation of food was grand, I also had a homemade pasta with chicken, AMAZING flavor, and I've tried the tenderloin brushetta, like, um 6 times. Addicting!! Reminds me a lot of the old Furio - trendy feel, warm inviting atmosphere, servers and bartenders that remember you AND your drinks, and just an all over outstanding restaurant and feel. Perfect for date nights, happy hour, group dinners, I love it!! They had live music last Sunday, acoustic amazing-ness lol. So many wines to choose from, I really liked the variety of reds. Fireball on tap!!!?? Wow, thats different and exciting for you whiskey drinkers!! Great spot, and if the rest of the menu is anything near as wonderful as what I've had, well - I can't wait to try it all!!!

GkJPCMMtgpM8OiIfIqTrCw.text: Fun atmosphere and good food, overall.   Not a "can't miss" type place, but solid.

AGmpYwCwsbII8O8KD80zpQ.text: Really loved the atmosphere here but I'm sad to say the food just wasn't that great. It wasn't bad, but not as good as we hoped it would be either.

YriaQ-RkOZbDp-j7wAbsyQ.text: I heard good things about this place and tried it for the first time.  It's unfortunately the last time with the service we received.  The food was good and wanted recommendations from our server to order more.  Our server, Jharnys (from our receipt) was rude and annoyed when asked for his opinion.  It ruined the whole experience that dessert wasn't ordered.  I will definitely say yes to the food but no to the service, thanks to our server the restaurant gets 2 stars.  I will most likely not return and will not recommend it to fellow friends and colleagues that live or visit the city.

XoFPbyNhK9EYVy5UzSTrdg.text: This is a great place for a relaxing, comfortable atmosphere with great happy hour deals. The arancini mozzarella balls are to die for! Great place for a date night! Definitely try the wine on tap and Dominic and Jake make a great cocktail!

vBhhi3OLDXi7EX8TWoj64g.text: Had a great first experience there, the staff was polite and attentive.  The food was prepared great and portions I felt were just right. Plus they have my favorite dessert on the menu, the Adult Float :)

wHeP2SVmyLAhA0_Aw4q3gw.text: This place is no longer a hidden gem, but more like a neighborhood favorite! Nick and Chops have some amazing creativity and the hospitality is second to none.  The goat cheese and pancetta  pizza is fantastic!

aHPzlQZNxuUB7aqwHNxbBg.text: The food and service was amazing! Such fun drinks and the best salad - get the EVO salad it has kale and brussels sprouts and it was sooo delicious. One of my girlfriends had the pasta bolognese and it was to die for so I will definitely be back to sample up some more yummy food!

lZEzZxB_rzZJHxTrAMq96A.text: Jason is a great bartender! The best ever. He's awesomeness :)!!!! He's fast and kind and really cool

9iE3vUT234MRBd72Jtkq1w.text: Great homemade pasta and ambiance. I highly recommend. Try the Chili Shrimp or the happy hour pizza for $7.00 is amazing

6X5Q0MdrNJDaDRV8BWsy1Q.text: Want to support this local innovative restaurant.  Started out at the bar while waiting for our friend.  Fabulous bartender offered up sample of blueberry vodka.  We tried several of their creative drinks which were delicious.  Would definitely go back for Happy Hour.  Once we were sat with our friends for dinner, the service was not as attentive.  The server also seemed inexperienced and didn't handle our order properly.  The EVO salad was fantastic.  We tried the salmon dish, the lobster risotto and the steak. The dinner was not very exciting.  We will go back for Happy Hour and hope that they tweak their dinner menu and service.

26h2PJs2Gz2geoOJ_bdXwg.text: We had a good experience here.  The ambiance was great, and the servers were very friendly and attentive.  Our only complaint was that the lobster risotto was VERY bland, and for a $24 dish, we expected a bit more.  However, the penny shots of Fireball, thanks to out Yelp checkin, more than made up for it.  Overall, I'd give EVO a .

lDOlvSCuUslZu0XpzUItXw.text: Great atmosphere and decor..a welcome change from the chains and anchor restaurants in the area that all feel the same. My wife could not stop raving about the EVO salad so safe to recommend that along with my Caesar. Only slight complaint is how fast our food came... Would've have liked things slowed down a bit more since the place is so inviting. We will be back.

Px1s_OYNm8FlePKBKwiHjQ.text: They have a great pizza!! The environment is really great! Dim lighting, candles, good music, tables aren't to close. You can enjoy a peaceful dinner.

a7hkDL9zC_MOInoeTCV2Pg.text: Without a doubt best new restaurant in old town. Late night food, great service, amazing atmosphere! What more can you ask for! Ask for Jessie she is great!

FR5zkivWvw_wWDRUb7YUyQ.text: We love this place. My girlfriend and I love the food, drinks, and atmosphere. The best part is Dom and Jake behind the bar. They always take our music requests and make us feel so at home. Best weekly spot!

kXFqFFzi--N3KiXMcz49WA.text: Really liked it Ambiance is comfortable, service was good, had the warm cake to end the meal and it was excellent. Enjoyable experience

1fccSVP1EmXkw2b6eobi4A.text: We came there as a part of Scottsdale Culinary Week experience, and it was quite unremarkable. There were six of us ordering appetizers, main dishes, and deserts - one salad and one main dish were sent back to the kitchen.  Eggplant was undercooked, absolutely raw and flavorless inside, beet salad consisted of a truck load of arugula with few slices of beet (served on a cheese board, not in a plate - super inconvenient to eat), pizza was not baked through, steak came with overcooked boiled potatoes on a side, gelato should have been served under the name of a milk shake - it came completely melted.   The wine was good and our waiter was very nice, but it does not make up for the sloppy cooking.

t-gY-9R1AIyhImqg5SKsTA.text: We have been to EVO a dozen of times. Loved it. Tonight was just awful. First the hostess didn't even know about restaurant week . Our waiter fabulous. Our drinks great . The food unfortunately not good . Ordered the dumplings with truffle oil, no truffle oil no taste.  I have ordered the shrimp chili pasta and it has been great . Tonight tasted like chili peppers and water on pasta . Order the Cacio E Pepe it's suppose to be cheesy and creamy. NO it was pasta that was cooked unevenly not creamy not cheesy no flavor at all. Thank goodness to end with the butter cake it was divine. The rest of the food missing flavor and salt. Such a waste of money.

KjqXo2GtiwvfLPQ2axIq3g.text: I've been dining in this establishment regularly for a couple of years, and I've never had a bad experience. The food, ambiance, and wine selection is great, but the service is what keeps me coming back. I know I will be taken care of every time, especially by Dom and Jake!

amI9vaCR9eFWAQuH0IzHYQ.text: We went to celebrate Valentine's Day (the day before with our 1 year old). Friendly staff, cool ambience, food was delicious, and we got some happy hour offers to make it even better!

kWQwX6IquIV_Czzzsr8ipA.text: Incredible food, probably one of my favorite restaurants in Scottsdale, definitely one of my favorites for Italian. Their meatballs may have been the best meatballs i have ever had in my life!!! And their other appetizers and pastas are great as well. While i didn't have any pizza, other people's looked great. This place has great vibes and a great menu (a great happy hour menu too). The staff was also very accommodating and friendly. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meatballs (best meatballs EVER)
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta (one with salami and one with tomato and mozzarella)

wuADpg9rvmghsrykrW3L0w.text: Just another wonderful meal and service last night at EVO. This is a real foodie place and the waitress, hostesses were outstanding and big fans of their own food at the restaurant and it was very evident. Could not be a better Italian.

IdHtuzEslfZ2Mq2-Hu9Wag.text: They always have great, knowledgeable servers and bartenders and their food is amazing - not to mention their drinks and wine selection!

lU0ltsH61KfMR2gSS0xUJw.text: I was very impressed with EVO. We went to meet up with a group of my moms friends for happy hour. When I walked in i expected it to be a little more snooty. Shame on me for thinking such a thing. Our server was very attentive to the number of people we had. He brought over a few chairs to ensure that everyone was comfortable. We must have had a minimum of 6 checks and he did spectacular at not mixing them up. The sangria is where it was at for me. Additionally the pizza I had was delicious as was the bruschetta.   I had expected it to be a little more costly than it was but for as much food and beverage that I had it wasn't too bad at all.  The location is a little hidden and the parking lot may be difficult during busy hours however, I believe we got the just in time. Anyhow, the staff was friendly and the food and drinks were good. I would certainly go back at another time of day to check it out on our own.

0sKLbmqSnK5guuyWsVM9LA.text: Loved this place! Great service! Awesome pizza and a bottle of wine deal on Wednesday nights!! We also had the meatballs and bruschetta, both were amazing! Great sauce and toppings. I will be back!! The only compliant is the noise level. It was very loud.

qtZkeUwMyGJdxVuTl3gRCA.text: Evo is a great place for happy hour! I've been here a few times and every time I am not disappointed. I'd suggest the fungi pizza and the heirloom tomato pasta. The pasta is homemade and you can taste the difference.

5d8YnV5ZPc1e8y7SHBYDuw.text: Recently had the chance to grab brunch at EVO with my wife. Well -- when we had brunch she was my fiance, now she's my wife.  EVO was THAT GREAT!   OK, well, even if it wasn't EVO that did the trick, it was none the less awesome food.     I had the Pork Belly Quiche, and it was delicious.  Even with pork belly, I feel like it was a relatively healthy dish.  If you like quiche and you like bacon, you absolutely cannot go wrong with this.   My wife had the Mascarpone Waffles and they, too, were delectable.   She reported that they were so good they didn't need syrup.   When's the last time you had a waffle that good?   It was quite difficult to actually make decisions on the brunch menu -- everything sounded appealing.  It would have been great to have tried it all, but we'll just have more to be excited about when we return for future brunches.    Presentation was nice on all counts as well -- great food with a great look!    Do you like mimosas with your brunch?  They do a great job of that.  I happen to have a Bloody Mary obsession, however, so was very happy to find that EVO has a little bloody mary bar set up.   They'll bring you a generous pour of your choice of vodkas then you saunter over and load up on all the goodies you want including their house made bloody mix (yum!) various spices, sauces and garnishes, including the beloved bacon garnish.  Just as nice for those who like a good bloody mary but aren't interested in the whole DIY thing -- the server will make your drink for you if you like.  Just say so.   Of course they do have a full bar so your options aren't just limited to mimosas and bloodies.    Finally, loved the decor.  Warm, inviting, upscale, yet laid back spot in a great location.   Walking distance to a lot of other retail and entertainment.   Talked with one of the gracious owners while there as well and learned that as of the time of our meal, this was a brand new brunch menu.  Cheers to keeping it fresh!     Very much looking forward to doing brunch at EVO again and I have a feeling it will be like a gateway drug, with dinner being the eventual next step. If the dinner menu is as creative and tasty as the brunch menu, EVO is an all around winner!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. EVO Bloody Mary Bar! Turns out that their house mix garnished with Sriracha and bacon make to a darn fine Bloody Mary!

bTEoso-xdnroinqtSE6HLA.text: Stretching. We went as a group the week of thanksgiving. It was a Tue and it was pretty empty, so that was nice. Service was a little off. We had a good time. I had black squid ink pasta which was delicious. There were not a lot of options for people who eat limited carbs and dairy (like myself). I ate way too much because it was so good, hence the need for stretching thereafter.

nEhDSuokJUs5wjMS6NIKBw.text: Everything was so good. From service to food to drinks. Loved loved the beets appetizer.

UPi1OuRhGFCIRJMEgkqkdQ.text: Such a disappointment.... We booked a reservation for the place we had our first date 4 years ago. From the time our server walked up I could tell he wasn't having a great day. The server's "wet blanket" attitude would be the least of our worries. I ordered a kettle one martini shaken hard with a sugar rim, which I don't mind paying $15 dollars for if it's made right,but it wasn't.   Came warm with no sugar rim and tasted like little effort was put into making it. Long story short the food was awful, so salty we couldn't even eat our lobster carbonara. Which the server didn't seem to care all our pasta was untouched. Drinks sat empty and my husbands ice tea was never refilled the whole dinner. We were overcharged on our bill and left hugely disappointed.

JRy6shoD8i-ov6Imsu4F8Q.text: Came in for dinner on Saturday night. Appears to be a slow night. Food is good but service and presentation needs to improve. I find it odd that 4-5 servers were huddled up at a table chatting like they are guests. Sounds like someone's friend is visiting and the ladies were all chatting away. Our server was not included in that group but service was still really slow.

pP6zuSwk-g1JlW4DQtL_iA.text: Amazing customer service, food, and swanky ambiance! First, they were able to kindly accommodate my last minute reservation change on a busy Saturday night. When I made the original reservation, I put it under my name, but noted we were going for my sister's bachelorette party. When my sister arrived in her "bride to be" tiara, the hostesses excitedly asked if she was the bachelorette - which made her feel special. We were seated at a large high top near the bar. With a daily happy hour from 4-7 (rare in Scottsdale), we were able to get $5 glasses of wine - that didn't taste cheap, along with $5 well drinks. Already incredible value. We then split the HH Bolognese fries - their bolo is SO flavorful, and the warm Brie and honey "Focatccia rustica" per our server's recommendation, which were both to die for and great for sharing. We all got incredible meals, without a complaint. I personally loved my pappardelle bolognese so much, I ate the whole large portion. I heard great things from the table about the Lobster carbonara gnocchi - worth the price. The server asked us if we'd like to keep one of the menus, as they had printed a special copy, congratulating my sister on her engagement at the top. Incredible extra touch. After our meals, a bartender brought my sister a complimentary "blowjob shot" and allowed us to make a scene as we taped her taking the shot. We then joined in for a few more rounds of shots. Lastly, the head manager/owner (I'm not sure) came by to ensure we were enjoying our night, which we were. The line of hungry patrons was growing quickly, so after due time, we gave up our spot - but would have stayed forever if not. Will definitely be coming back, and would recommend it to anyone planning a special event. EVO really goes above and beyond!!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Personalized message at the top of their menu - without asking!
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lobster carbonara
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lobster carbonara and one very happy bride

Eyda8z6Vbpna2E1TKm0tqg.text: Came on a Friday night around 5:45 and had a really enjoyable time dining in the bar area.  This is a quaint little spot in Old Town, one I hope to frequent!  Good wine and delicious food and hands down, some of the best and friendliest service I've had to date.  Save room for the Butter Cake..holy smokes it's one of the best things I've eaten!   No complaints here-this foodie is very satisfied!

9J8NEYEStI0NCels1DKNBw.text: Not a fan of this place idk why I went back a second time but that's on me lol. The layout is terrible, the kitchen is by the dining which it's loud and bright no matter where you sit (that's not an exaggeration). Then to top it off the food is average at best.   On the bright side our server was great, thank god for her!

sc2Omm2rySqAGKNZupOWhA.text: Old town Scottsdale has long been a haven to buy kitschy bolo ties and hear about rumored legends of Paris Hilton's time spent clubbing here.  EVO solidifies this area, along with Franco's and Marcellino's as the Valley's "Little Italy".  We welcome back the original 'Cuoco Pazzo', Chef DeRuvo and he brings back many of the dishes that we have loved at his past spots, namely the Raviolo, Arancini, and Focaccia di Recco.  The only mild disappointment was the Squid Ink Chittara which was a little too soupy and clumpy for my taste.The ambiance and bar are nice enough but the draw for me is what is being made back in the kitchen.

v80Pu51gLtdtTroHTr00KA.text: Service good.  Food was mediocre.  I had chicken marsala.   Chicken was tasteless with some pasta and  mushrooms mixed in a bowl.

EktztW70DMSC4-rDD2rYdA.text: Great, inexpensive HH!  Loved the burger & the meatballs had a lot of flavor!  Lovely atmosphere.  We were full with HH -two people with two glasses of wine - $35.  I'll def go back!

ETQQQj57EkOvLD2L1I_BBA.text: Fast and great service, and very delicious food! Just very small portions. $23 should get me more than just 4 twirls of a fork to eat my pasta.

JP6WlE2sNCKYe1RYMuEgOQ.text: Always a great go to spot in old town! Very chill and relax place to get dinner and a glass of wine. Sit at the bar and let (Dom) the bartender take great care of you! On Sunday's they have 1/2 off select bottles of wine

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 1/2 off select bottles of wine on Sunday funday

Keup3Fbl-dPcn1H0xIh2VA.text: Evo is my go-to spot in the Old Town area for dinner. There are some great happy hour deals on food, and the focaccia draws me back every damn time. I just can't say no to it. The honey and salt and cheese? Ugh. I crave it just writing this.  However, Evo can be hit and miss. The pastas I've ordered (especially the spaghetti) have sometimes been soggy or overcooked. But when they hit, they hit.  Plus, the ambiance is cool... and the service is strong. Evo's always my main option when I want to sit down and eat somewhere for dinner.

WE0yupqq0BlRJk5RrMes8g.text: The best hang out and great selection of wonderful meals!! You won't be disappointed! Also great friendly staff!!   Also try this amazing Arancini  !! Go for it!!  WhAt?? It's the best ever and greatest hang out and even nick's off duty staff is still working !!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. That&#39;s nick the best ever

CzWySF7hwQpXcN6N3ywAcQ.text: Came in for a late dinner with family and friends.  Had a great time and enjoyed the food and ambiance.  Great place in Old Town Scottsdale.  Food was fantastic.  Service matched the food.  Give it a try!

EI-KFgXD6lCgbnm1NOyWVw.text: Good happy hour prices for food and drinks  through 7:00. Excellent service from Louis.

3VM5WWbxzvTRFLFaigXlJg.text: Amazing food, one of my favorite spots in old town. Chill laid-back atmosphere and the bartender Dom was great!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak bruschetta and the grapefruit something or other... both amazing

b0QZWviQOErNwKqScdUDUQ.text: Everything about our 1st experience there was pleasurable. From the time we were greeted to the time we left we were well taken care of. We shared an appetizer and a main dish and finished with a comp dessert (birthday surprise). The food was awesome and unique. The cocktails were excellent and the wine was well selected. The atmosphere was quaint and personal with the ability to be yourself without sticking out (jeans or slacks, t shirts and fancy dresses). We have already recommended to friends. We will need to make 1 more visit to bump it to a "5" (consistency and all) but I'm sure a "5" is in their future.

MsTU3obat9yEDStlNVSD1w.text: Came here for happy hour and enjoyed the daily bruschetta (which had some pork butter that was very awesome and savory to the point where I would take the corners/pieces of the bread that had no pork butter and dip it back on the plate for the fallen drips of pork butter!), funghi pizza with various roasted mushrooms, pecorino cheese and mozzarella and sauce, and the BB&T cocktail out on the patio. The waiter was a very happy-go-lucky and hilarious guy! Had a great time and will come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Daily bruschetta with the best ingredient: pork butter!! Yummy! :)
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken sandwich with chips
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Funghi pizza

o_pCXgEnKFjFbcFQeIbSxw.text: This place is truly a 3.5. The decor is nice, the wait staff very attentive, and atmosphere    modern. The food and drinks are all good and fairly creative.   I will say that the EVO salad is probably the most unusual salad I have ever eaten. The kale and Brussel sprouts were fried crisp so the salad is warm. I definitely recommend, if you like trying something unique. It's worth the adventure.   The chili shrimp pasta was good, it just didn't wow us. Overall I have no complaints about the restaurant at all. They Yelp fireball shot is a great perk. I would go back again just can't quite give it 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The EVO salad - Kale brussel sprouts and other magic.
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grapefruit basil martini

nPLxwie6XGxOZbcTUTX0Cg.text: Tasty food with a nice atmosphere. Was there for the relatively new 'brunch'. Was good enough that I would go back to check out dinner!

93J1FMbidkY9Cjtpn1KHvg.text: The food was mediocre. They don't have a lot of options, but for the options they do have, the quality wasn't inspiring. Service was lacking. They felt understaffed and rushed.  Pizza was solid. Good crust. Rather small.   Good drink menu. Scotch options are solid if you are a scotch drinker. They have about 20 of them, including the Macallan 18/12 and Laphroaig 12.

nN0DZXzj2SS4F9zmhOoXIg.text: Best meal I had in Scottsdale/Phoenix area all week. Creative and delicious Italian food. Got there right near end of happy hour and started with bruschetta, arancini and meatballs, washings it down with a smooth Cabernet! Delicious. My sister and I split orecchiette with fennel sausage and kale. All pasta is made in house and fresh. It was spicy and flavorful. My son enjoyed a margarita pizza with an out of this world crust. Finished off with desserts-lemon sorbet, 3 Nutella cannolis and flourless chocolate torte! All amazing. Attentive service and overall a great dinner.

3iwJvlNbq4vgIY1isXS8Nw.text: We are trying to work our way through the list of 75 best dishes in the valley. Tonight we went to EVO to try the raviolo.    It was one of the best dishes that I've eaten in a while, and I've had some great food lately as you can tell from my previous reviews. The dish was rich, buttery, cheesy and the pancetta (or was it bacon) on top pushed the dish over the edge into the sublime.   We also had the crispy risotto which came in a red sauce and that dish too, was delicious.   Our server was knowledgeable and efficient. The ambiance was great, and I will be back to try some of the other dishes.

Bv__NDYxT9MIrIK7gekJFg.text: Wow. This is my first time writing a yelp review and with good reason. I came in here for a quick drink and a bite to eat after work. The service and ambiance was so great I ended up staying 3 hours. The bartenders made me feel welcomed and were very attentive. I will definitely be visiting again!!! Would recommend for anyone visiting Old Town Scottsdale.

i7HLUmY6jB7h2jIaGPtuNw.text: This is one of the best undiscovered restaurants in Old Town Scottsdale. Their pasta is hand made, the apps are unbelievably priced and they have tap wine. Have you ever had their tap wine? It. is. so. good.   Everything about EVO is delicious and it's definitely a place to get to know. They have a late night menu and crowd.

xVmlf2cbzLGOnIcfZzI27w.text: i sat at the bar and decided to have 4 or 5 of their appetizers. I like trying out new places this way because you can get a real variety from their menu. the food is incredible, there wasn't 1 item that wasn't fantastic from their signature raviolo to the meatballs and the bone marrow was in my top 3. my only negative would be their limited Italian wine selection. Other than that i have no complaints and will most definitely be back when i visit again.

4-Cgv4tgTDpY7TE4gjeUAQ.text: The happy hour specials are great!  We love coming here to try the hand crafted cocktails - they're so good, and food is yummy as well.  I definitely recommend this place for a chill night out.

JprTdKTqv2jNzuNji9MVvw.text: Food was ok, nothing to write home about.  I don't think I'll go back.  I didn't like the way the tables were set in the middle of the room.  Something seems to be missing and empty as if they did not finish decorating.

382Si0XDCeZ0gzZFXRcpvA.text: You know when you get to the end of a dish and you're sad to eat that last bite that it's time to write a Yelp review.  EVO is SERIOUSLY delish. What are a few of my favorite things?  There is a reason that everyone raves about the EVO Salad- it sounds a little bizarre when you hear "flash fried brussel sprouts," but trust me, do NOT miss this one.  It is the perfect combo of crispy and smooth, sweet and salty, hard to describe, but absolutely spot on.  I love the Gorgonzola Pizza just as much, I actually just ate my last piece as a late night snack and was wishing that I had saved a few more slices!  If you like thin crust and  blue cheese, this is for you, the honey drizzled on top really makes the dish.  Finally, I always get the Chocolate Torte, it's a chocolately, marshmellowy, deconstructed little number with a bit of crunch to keep it interesting.  Bottom line, you will love the food at this place, and the ambiance is beautiful as well.

tI98yI308unKTz25UFsZKA.text: Happy hour everyday?  How can you beat that?  Great atmosphere, excellent service, and most importantly- wonderful food.  The gorgonzola pizza was the highlight of the night.  Wish we would have ordered only pizza.  It outdid any of our other entrees.  Oh and PS check in on Yelp for the $0.01 fireball shots.  Will definitely be back.

mP6fopb4v2C8oblcTVRz0A.text: Amazing cocktails- try the basil/grapefruit concoction. The EVO salad is a must and everything was top notch. Will be back.

SjpSVZY4MkGyQCYxgPmIAw.text: First visit led to mixed feelings. We went during Restaurant Week. The place was not crowded but there were lots of problems. This is a noisy place. We asked to be moved away from the bar but that put us next to a speaker. It was hard to hear the waitress.  Fortunately we left as the live music started.   We were urged to get the meatball appetizer which we all ordered. Three minutes later we were told they were out. Food is not delivered by the waitress but rather other staff.  Each course there was confusion as there was food delivered wrong. At the last course there was a missing dessert and an extra of another dessert. When we got the bill I wasn't charged for my wine and the other couple not charged for their wine but charged in error for something else. Food was not always delivered hot. The wine pairings were good. Food quality was not high in our opinion but that might be our judgment.

y1nSfbFHPOb04JU1Vuggbg.text: Great atmosphere and attentive friendly service at the bar.  Had the kale brussel sprout salad -great flavors but a bit heavy on the sweet balsamic dressing.  Pasta was awesome - defintely a strong suit.  Had chile shrimp and also shrimp alfredo -both nicely light on sauce and perfectly prepared!  And staff was very open to our feedback -always a good sign if you're gonna make a go of it in this town!

W_hwmSCO8KoV9QoPycSG_A.text: I am not usually one to write a review for yelp. However, I was so very impressed with my experience at EVO last night I felt motivated to share. After getting off work late, (around 10pm) I was looking for a place I could eat late that wasn't typical bar food. My boyfriend recommended EVO saying it was good food and friendly service. This was an understatement. Upon arriving, I was pleased with the atmosphere. Hip, with good music, where you could still easily enjoy conversation. We sat at a beautiful bar with smiling bartenders who handed us menus without being asked and helped me find a wine I enjoyed. We were then greeted by the Chef, Chops, who knew my boyfriend but was meeting me for the first time. I was so impressed by his enthusiasm for the food and his warm, welcoming demeanor, just a great guy! He recommended a few plates including the Charcuterie, Broccoli, and EVO Salad. I was starved and could not wait to eat but was not prepared for the awesome amount of food placed in front of us. The Charcuterie was HUGE and had an incredible assortment of flavors, including a number of new surprises. The Broccoli, also a large portion, transformed a simple vegetable into an awesome meal. The EVO salad was full of new flavors as well and will become a staple for me at EVO. Overall, our experience was such that I can not wait to return, try more of the menu, and enjoy great service. Nicely Done EVO!

A5ErflCN-LhjOb4OFQ-auA.text: evo salad was awesome... Waiter was really nice and explained the menu for us, recommended some really good pastas, the cocktails were amazing.  it was a friday night and was incredibly busy so we had to sit at the bar.  make sure to make reservations! check in and you get a fireball shot!!

eUWtlj7T4gZ5oAg_Tv_zlw.text: Came out with some friends for a nice dinner and drinks. The pizza was really good with amazing crust. It was pretty busy so the bruschetta trio was forgotten and came out once the entrees were gone. The mojito is amazing with a great selection of wine. Service could of been better but the food is spot on.

3fwp8N8I9smUgKDt828YFA.text: I have nothing but good things to say about Evo!! I find myself going at least once a week because they have their happy hour until 7, which is great for me and my girlfriends because we get off work at 6 and most happy hours are over by then. And to top it off I love sitting at the bar when Dominic is bartending because he is hilarious and has amazing customer service. Also the owner Nick is a gem you can totally tell his passion is the restaurant business, always taking the time to get feedback and make sure everyone is having a great time! LAST THING- The bolognese is my favorite I get it almost every time! :)

f4VvRjH8Ltu9X8qcLwga_A.text: I'm slowly learning I shouldn't listen to servers when ordering food. I had been eyeing the eggplant ragout, but was swayed by our waitress who highly recommended the zucchini pasta. (She did mention she loves it partly because it's healthier than pasta). And if you are looking for a healthy option it definitely seems like a good choice. It's literally strips of zucchini (NOT zucchini based noodles) covered in veggies and sauce.  However, when I go out to eat I like to do it up and regretted not ordering the ragout. I noticed a lot of people around  us ordered the bruschetta and meatball plate.   We ordered butter cake for dessert and I would recommend especially if you prefer your butter cakes a little fluffy/sponge cake like. This place is pretty trendy and entices your typical Scottsdale crowd.  Tables are rather close which makes it noisy, but overall it's a great place if you're in Scottsdale and looking for Italian.

drdm_3og0iLTFzyDpg3V7w.text: I love this place ! Good atmosphere,  great bar! The food is delicious and the service is great. The kitchen is open late which is awesome ! My only suggestion would be to change the menu periodically and have seasonal items. It would also be helpful to have few light options :)  If you haven't tried it. Go! It is great!

AEarCwZzO-z-RscicaXckQ.text: Went here for restaurant week and absolutely loved everything we had! It was amazing! We had the beets salad and ricotta dumplings for appetizers and they were complementary to our meals, which were flat steak and Chile shrimp pasta!! My husband had the flat steak and I've never seen him crush food that fast . The Chile shrimp pasta had the perfect amount of kick and its sauce was creamy, tangy, and refreshing with sprigs of mint. For dessert, we had the brown butter baby cake and Belgian chocolate gelato. The brown butter baby cake was the bomb.com. I'm a huge fan of dessert and I could honestly say that it was the best dessert I've ever had!! The belgian chocolate gelato was great too!! It was perfectly creamy and had the perfect balance between sweetness and bitterness!! I would DEFINITELY recommend people coming here!! And the servers were amazing too!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qBbK2lWaFdxz7dOtRi1JWA.text: Took over 15 minutes to get any service. Drinks were okay once served. The entrees were the worst meal ive ever had..was shocked as to how terrible it was..was hoping for a better meal..i'd never go back or recommend this hole.

is3aTvPuWKEvngUfYHGPWw.text: EVO is always a great spot for delicious Italian and a fun atmosphere! The staff is knowledgeable and quick to get your order in, and we rarely have to wait for a table. I suggest starting with the calamari. The lemon butter sauce they serve with it is so light and delicious. Recently, they added a Zucchini pasta to the menu! YUM! You can get your pasta and be healthy too. I would definitely suggest trying it out. The pomodoro sauce is so rich and the noodles really do taste similar to pasta. EVO always has great daily specials. Last night if you bought a bottle of wine you got a free pizza! Woohoo If you've never been, go check it out now!

-2gpEAMj7VawdH4xbLSORg.text: Stopped by for their happy hour and was not disappointed.  We split a bruschetta board and mushroom pizza.  The pizza was awesome, mushrooms seasoned and sauteed just right!  The bill was minimal for all that we got.  Highly recommend for a great happy hour in Scottsdale!

nWVIIVqAjh8rAcL8R3hFWg.text: Have only ever had positive experiences here. They take care of industry junkies like myself. Servers always knowledgeable about flavor profiles for wine and cocktails and provide perfect recommendations. Fantastic dining experience. The food is always fresh and delicious. Plenty of vegetarian options. Margherita flatbread is heavenly. Zucchini noodles are light and flavorful.   Have been meaning to mention a spectacular experience with Audrey as our server in the main dining room. Despite having a full section, Audrey was attentive and made good conversation in addition to providing great service. I was dying to figure out a wine I tried here prior and Audrey was able to name it for me after chatting about the flavor. That being said, I highly recommend the Ionis ater primivito di manduria 2013 if it is still on their menu.

4XyOdcHcK4SwGY8CHsrcKQ.text: Why haven't I been here before?! Extensive menu with unique but welcoming options. Happy hour goes late and the staff is friendly. Can't wait to come back and try more.   Enjoyed the Bruschetta Trio (eggplant is surprisingly delicious coming from a couple of aubergine skeptics and the crust was just right - no injuries from a too hard edge)

HhOASbn7gV5_2W-zSnnJRw.text: We had reservations for a table of four at this Old Town location and I can confidently say everyone enjoyed their meals and wanted to return. Service was excellent and they had a special on a bottle of the house wine with our meal--and it wasn't a cheap wine as is often the case but a Tom Gore, which is a rather decent cab. Their happy hour lasts everyday until 7:00pm, which means your first glass for dinner as well as appetizers may be priced less. We had their calamari and meatballs (which were very good). I had the beef ribs and mashed potatoes w spinach. It was very good, although the meat was somewhat fatty although flavorful with a rich sauce. My daughter ordered the lobster dish which she loved.  The dessert was their house special that takes an extra 30 minutes to serve, so they ask that you order it early. Honestly, it tastes like a warm donut, so it was my least favorite item. However, given the ambience, service and good food, we will return and try it again. Parking was also easy in the lot right next to the restaurant.

x1FuKESxd5QigxyIi4wB4g.text: Went there for a friend's birthday dinner ! I really liked everything and I am very picky person! Will definitely go back there. I give 4 stars for waiting time.

NSSBogBeV2ClUls0Fb79GA.text: This is the home of the best pasta I've ever had. If you have the chance to try their Bolognese, do it! The noodles were cooked perfectly, and the sauce and veal made it the perfect dish. The waiter was excellent, and provided amazing recommendations (and even helped us find the best happy hour deals!). Everyone at the table enjoyed their meal, including the shared appetizer, the meatballs, which were just as yummy as everything else. Their happy hour had very reasonable prices (and they were pretty generous with their pours). The food is priced very reasonably given the quality. I would come here every day if I could!

xdLvBqCl-qQpI_g7wcodpQ.text: Loved this place. Initially, the 3 people at the hostess station seemed unfriendly, but maybe we were interrupting a teaching moment or something, I think one of them was the manager. Once inside, the vibe was fantastic, our server was exceptional. I love Italian food, and this was some of the best I've had. I highly recommend, the meatball appetizer. Huge a flavorful. I had spaghetti and the brown butter cake dessert. My pasta was perfectly cooked and the cocktails were strong. It's a little loud, but you can hear each other talk. A manager came buy and made sure we were satisfied with everything. I left with a full belly, a sweet buzz and slept like a baby. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Vnf__Qe41tjcYlueQk8BSw.text: Absolutely an excellent restaurant and open late! Great customer service, and the butter cake is amazing. Great twist on Italian food, it is a must go when in Scottsdale !

IrCs2OrUz05k8uGuMk5uVw.text: I came here for a bachelorette party, and we had the best time! The food was so good! They seriously have such a good happy hour menu. If you come during happy hour you will have a great array of food options and drinks.  The staff was so nice! When they found out we were here for a bachelorette party they comped our (delicious!) Butter cake dessert and gave us free shots! The manager came out too to congratulate our bride and make sure we were having a good time. The service was truly excellent.  For real, go to EVO and youll have a wonderful experience.

DWsgE2YQVSsGFktJKj8w5g.text: This place is great. From the first time I came in the bartenders remembered what I like to drink and always give the best service. The food is also great. I'm a huge fan of the charcuterie board, it is huge with a ton of house made jams and pickled vegetables.

FYa47ulvk490OdaZlW-u3Q.text: If someone is looking for a bar than yes maybe it's a good place .We were later of five and all find it too loud . Izzy's are ok though don't like any pasta dishes ,they were cold and bland.

3hFp98EPSZloq9gJhn5Gdg.text: Great food, Great service!  Went last night for a friends B-day!  They put her name on the menu's (so cute!)  Our server Jon was great, and when I made reservations the staff was very accommodating!  thank you for great food and service

-wYYAeoQ_HhaVb-DnvaIcQ.text: Italian in Scottsdale, yes! Try this place and order the bone marrow. That alone is worth the stop, we had the fettuccine with shrimp and the Cesar salad...fresh and delicious. We ate at the bar and the bartenders were super friendly and helpful turned us on to a new beer and overall great place to eat.

B9YV2mGBUpU7kSMQ0_NXiQ.text: Finally had dinner here!  I would have loved to give this place a 5 star review, but the evening we arrived the restaurants kitchen was not performing at it's standards and we waited longer than normal for the last ordered dining dishes to arrive.  Hope they fixed that.  The food:  I have nothing but great things to say about the food though.  Wow everything we ordered was delicious!  I'm not kidding, everything!    Started with the Crispy Pork Belly.  The chef here prides his pork and it showed with this dish.  Then cam the Foccacia Deruvo.  I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.  If you're lucky enough to try it because they do have limited availability of this dish.  Made with mascarpone, creneza, sea salt & local honey.  Yom yom yom yom.  Finished it up with a prosciutto pizza!  Dine here and experience the food.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Prosciutto pizza
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crispy pork belly
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Raviolo

pCELSfRBXSRDEaBMTlT2Yw.text: I was at Evo for happy hour with friends tonight.....my first time here...loved it! $5 wines, $3 beers along with great happy hour food!  To make it great our bartender Dominic was attentive, charming  and funny! We work down the street and will definitely be back!

_pVltcGCntSyl2VAmP76-w.text: I love this place! I'm in the industry and it's so nice to have a place to stop by after work for a late night menu and drinks . Staff is always nice !

ZbAc3L2F7jxcOFKiwOZoWQ.text: So, we had very high expectations, based off previous yelp reviews. Sadly, we were very disappointed.  Came for a birthday party and although there were 12 of us, we waited an absurd amount of time to order drinks, then the appetizers, then the food.   I ordered an evosalad, which was so terrible, that i couldn't even eat it. The main entree was a squid ink seafood pasta, again, grossly disappointing.   Will definitely not be coming back to this restaurant,  and highly recommend Marcellino's for anyone wanting excellent Italian.

wQsd5EjH58eXM0uu-6D-2Q.text: We made reservations for a booth through open table. When we got there we had to wait 30 minutes but we had no problem with that. While we waited we had drinks through the bar. When we're finally seated we ordered about $230 of drinks and food. When the check case, we went to submit our passport card, they said they no longer took it however the application still had them listed. They continued to say they would not honor it and the waiter decided to change his vibe as soon as showed him the passport.  We Are from out of state. We went to this place specifically because of the passport card. After 15 minutes of annoyance, they honored it. It is not the consumers responsibility to report to passport to remove the company.  This was totally embarrassing. We brought family here who are Arizona natives and they did consider returning to Evo but now hey are not happy with the response.

ExZ-jNmINMGbF1IYN_Xpdg.text: Wow, this restaurant is amazing! It didn't come up immediately in our yelp search, but a bartender at another restaurant recommended it for dinner. The host was so friendly and offered us options for various tables on a fairly crowded evening) and the waitress gave us her favorites dishes (which weren't just the most expensive options.)  I recommend the meatball appetizer, lasagne, and bread cake with raspberries. Side note - the dessert takes 25 minutes to make.) it's worth every minute!!!! Thank you for such a delightful evening. I can't wait to come back.

YWjZaR440sjwlpZ7AXPjYg.text: I would give this place zero stars if Yelp allowed. For an appetizer we ordered the arancini which was flavorless and slightly cold in the middle - obviously a frozen item which was reheated. The supposed handmade pasta for the carbonara and chicken marsala were tough and chewy. Not to mention both dishes were way over salted to cover up for the terrible cooking.  The only plus for this place that I can see is the ambience. But if you're looking for GOOD Italian food, go somewhere else.

meG1GtJCRRY9daj9THQXGg.text: Evo is a romantic but casual setting. Perfect place to go on a date or just go have a few drinks. My wife and I ordered the Calamari Diavalo which was amazing and has a little kick to it. I had the Seafood Cioppino was on point and the squid ink pasta was a nice addition to the dish.  My wife had the Lobster Carbonara which she says was the best lobster she has had and the pancetta helped make the dish. For desert we had and would also highly recommend the Brown Butter Babycake. It does take 25 minutes to make so make sure to order it when ordering your meal. It is well worth the wait. Would highly recommend Evo to everyone.

S9DglGKYlQzhy_7cQL4MGA.text: Had a terrific Dinner there recently.  Fun, attractive restaurant with very good Italian food. The prices and food quality are excellent.  Happy hour apps & wines were very good.  Great job. Wish it were closer to home. Our new " go to" Italian restaurant. Thanks.

vOPc-fKlGwXvyWToGNvmLg.text: EVO is gorgeous. The EVO Salad is nothing less than exceptional -- one of the best salads I have ever eaten. Warm, crispy Brussels sprouts, kale, pancetta, Bosc pears, goat cheese, pine nuts, & aged balsamic. Taste bud orgasm. I came for restaurant week: got this salad, the espresso-crusted steak, and Nutella budino. The main course and dessert were delicious, but the EVO salad was hands down the star of my entire experience! I sat at the bar so I can't speak for table service, but my experience was fantastic. They have comfortable, aesthetically pleasing bar stools, gorgeous chandeliers throughout the space, at least two large HD flat screen TV's playing the latest sports or popular show, and a nice little patio outside for anyone who can't go an hour or two without a cigarette.  EVO is a place I can see myself driving the 20 min from my house to eat/drink at, because although it's located in Scottsdale, it's blessedly not a "Scottsdale" establishment, at least not in the bar area. I found it to be filled with fellow industry folk who are intelligent, know a lot about food, wine, cocktails, etc, and don't care about appearances as much as one might expect in an establishment in this zip code. EVO is not only a beautiful establishment with outstanding food, they also have an impressive hold on the industry. I believe there are industry offerings most nights: Tuesdays offer $5 tap wines, $4 Fernet and Chartreuse!!, and discounted beers for industry associates, $20 for a bottle of wine and a pizza on Wednesdays (maybe for everybody?), etc. Although we don't need an incentive to frequent EVO, the fact that they respect their fellow servers, bartenders, and restaurant workers is one of the many ways they keep us coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Charcuterie board at EVO
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Arizona Restaurant Week menu 2015

Ab5bhtQwM8-754U7lO4vHg.text: My first experience here at EVO definitely left an impression.  I came here for my brothers girlfriends birthday dinner and was shocked by the setup arrangement.  We were sat down immediately at the reserved table and there was enough space between all 12 of us to be comfortable.  I try to make it a point to remember the waiter/waitress names in order to give them recognition, but I didn't finish this review the same night like I meant to.  However our waitress was very patient due to the amount of unorganized individuals that we were sitting with in taking our orders.  Not to mention when we received our food and drinks there were no misses!! The pizza I had, tasted home made and was very fresh.  The drink I had was very basic so I can't really elaborate on that.   I must say the main thing that stuck out, which I have never seen before was that they wished my brothers girlfriend a happy birthday on their food menu!! Completely original and awesome to me!  Felt very exclusive and personal.  I can see me coming to EVO often.  The lights were dimmed and it was very intimate, with candlelight's glowing.. great first experience!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pepperoni flat bread with extra pepperoni&#39;s.. was very delicious

HHS55PLiYMf-Vi--_xRXOQ.text: I chose Evo based on seeing them on an episode of "Check Please".  Their happy hour prices were amazing. Appetizer focaccia rustica was so tasty I wanted to lick the plate. We ordered 3 different flavors of bruschetta, pear & fig, smoked salmon and salami, all terrific. My main course was the lobster carbonara with gnocchi. It was cooked perfectly. And ummm, there were no leftovers. The brown butter cake w/raspberries & mint was the stand-out of the evening. You are doing yourself a disservice if you don't save room for this! We plan on going back when the weather permits and sit on the patio. Oh yes, service was great! Even the manager stopped by to make sure everything was as it should be. Very happy I picked Evo for my birthday celebration!

cUpn5sRO_wULBaDkdV-wng.text: This place was very nice, with a romantic atmosphere inside; cozy booths and dim lighting. We sat outside as it was still nice out, and enjoyed the patio. The service was a bit slow, but very polite.   As a group of 3 women we tried the steak bruschetta to start and it was simply delicious. The two with me had the bolognese which the server recommended and it was good. I tried the orecchiette which was a fennel sausage pasta, it was salty but good.   I would go here again and try their menu items, some looked really interesting but the service was pretty slow. Maybe it was because we sat outside.

R3rF37OqW0-9gn-mJCjxYw.text: I spent a long weekend in Scottsdale and booked a res at Evo based off reviews. This was hands down the best restaurant we ate at the whole weekend. The Evo salad is a must have and the steak bruschetta is delicious! Reasonably priced for the quality of service and food.

tzt1sSSMZKItb4nHc_Ud3Q.text: Definitely one of my favorite late night spots, being that their kitchen is open late! I've had just about everything on the menu and their heirloom tomato (add meatballs) is my go-to most of the time, but the Evosalad (crispy Brussels sprouts, kale, chevre, pear, pancetta, pine nuts and balsamic) is incredible! They recently added the Focaccia Rustica (creme de brie, mascarpone, sea salt and local honey) and it's one of the most delicious apps or antipastas I've ever had, their meatballs are some of the best in town and don't get me started on the steak bruschetta. They also have Fernet on tap, which is the best after such delicious food. I'm here twice a month on average, and would be there more if there weren't so many other delicious food options on Scottsdale.

fxvfWMkSHT-tQseA7Yq6EQ.text: Nice place but Out of Gin. Ordered 4 different bottles of wine. They had none. We left and went to another place to dine. The waitress had no idea of the inventory. Horrible

HtXD-B83jTl1qqcFQPQ-Tw.text: Benefits include: Amazing food. Capability to enjoy any and all and as much alcohol as you like. Perfect for atmosphere, as I'm over 21 but my date wasn't, and we could both enjoy this place, that also till 2 AM.  Nothing comes close to all these factors combined.

7R1Ap50lrbWbL4EztjxDcA.text: Hands down the best bloody in town! Saw Evo's Insta post advertising a unique octopus Bloody Mary and knew I had to stop in. They use a smoked salmon vodka, Reservation mix which is soooo yummy, even sports a mussel! Brunch menu is on point.. Food is always excellent here regardless the time you stop in. Hanging with Dom and Jake two of the nicest bar tenders, great convo and super friendly service! Always nice chatting it up with the owner Nick too! It's like family here! Love Evo!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Octopus Bloody Mary is on point!!

u0YI9frXcy9UhoeGa00bTg.text: 7 of us were there last night to celebrate my son's birthday.  3 of us including I ordered the squid ink chitarra and we were very disappointed. It very much lacked the oceanic flavor that made this dish great.  I dont know what happened but hope they get what they lost back on that dish.  Everything else, appetizers, Lobster carbonara, Lasagna, rib eye steak, bolognese and deserts were good.

ip2C57fNERZTO1jY9Eum_g.text: Wine on tap in perfect temp, happy hour menu that leaves little to be desired and great service!!  My first time and I will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Charcuterie... Amazballs!!! Wine on tap at perfect temp!  #AScottsdaleMust

eEIHtqxEwSrPiApP70NzrQ.text: Our dining experience was amazing last night!  We had the Polpettine meatball appetizer, house salad, Squid Ink Chitarra  and the Shrimp Fettucini.  For dessert, the Brown Butter Baby Cake with Raspberries.  Great service and excellent preparation of our food.  We will definitely be back!

6oV1VkkVuq3ss_DxBkiFQg.text: Disappointed in this restaurant. Service was bizarre and we were not impressed by the food. There are so many other restaurants that are similar- I would check those out instead.

ma69LynS3Ur1m2MOCVXILw.text: I made a reservation at EVO for my sister's bachelorette party. The food was pretty good, but our waiter with a man bun was horribly rude. When I made the reservation, I put that it was for a bachelorette party and my sister wore a white dress and sash. We were clearly there to celebrate her getting married, but instead of being polite and congratulating her, he rolled his eyes, scoffed, and gave short answers with a snarky tone to her and our group several times when we asked questions about the menu and ordered food. After we finished eating, we were waiting for probably 15 minutes until he finally brought our bill, and waited another 10 minutes for him to come back for it until we finally had to flag down another server to take our bill to him because he was too busy standing around doing nothing near the kitchen. His disrespectful demeanor was extremely noticeable. This was some of the worst service I've encountered. We were all blown away.   Edit: Let me clarify, besides that one server, I want to point out that the food was very good, the restaurant had a nice layout and design, and the other employees were friendly. After reading our initial review, the owner was kind enough to reach out and offer to rectify the experience for my sister. If she lived in Arizona, she would take him up on it.

52A5Cr2gD_nPm5ekmvWbFA.text: After the service we received I felt compelled to write a review.  Nick and his staff went above and beyond for us.  As a celiac, it can be difficult to find a safe place to eat out.  While EVO does not have a gluten free menu, Nick assured me they could provide a safe meal for me - and they did!  Upon arriving at EVO I was told they were aware of my situation.  After being seated the waitress was helpful providing information about safe options.  Then the manager came over to add even more knowledge about what food I could eat and what could be substituted to make my meal gluten free.  From beginning to end, we were made to feel welcome.  Oh and the Cab Franc we ordered with dinner was delicious!  Thank you EVO - we'll be back!

A6a3tyL9jYUGQ8AZoJWcAg.text: Went here for dinner because it was one of the only places open still serving food at midnight. I ordered the white bean stew which was under soup on the menu. It was far from soup because there was no broth, which is what I wanted because I have a cold. On top of it not really being stew, it was very tangy. Not sure what made it taste that way, but unfortunately it was not good. I also ordered Parmesan fries which I couldn't eat because they were too salty. The place was nice and the service was great but unfortunately the food was a flop.
