Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

FQU33nt7GgJ8FL8V_aByog.text: I very much like the ambience of this restaurant where it's laid out and what they've done with this space. The second thing that strikes you as the friendliness of the staff how they greet you and how well they remember some of your preferences and make suggestions. I really think the food is outstanding as it honors Italian tradition but is still innovative and uses dishes and Inspirations from all the different parts of Italy!

RyPRSUmbLJy-htU2vSremg.text: We had an amazing time and the food was awesome and Cinque, the manager gave us a free bottle of champagne for a birthday we were celebrating! They really take care of you and made it such a special night on top of such amazing service from Maura! This place is great!!!

LedWNR9RKlHCmcXBqophUA.text: Monday nights are the time to go.  Happy hour specials, excellent It add Italian food.  Very attentive service from a friendly staff that is not rushed.  The drink choices are very good with a wide range of wines.

hiRzsKKh7nXwGfqgxXjA6A.text: I went to EVO a couple weeks ago and everything was spectacular!! We started with the mussels. The sauce was so great I asked for extra bread to dip. The mussels were large and perfectly cooked. We then went on to the lasagna and lobster carbonara. The lasagna was so cheesy I couldn't get enough! The presentation of the lobster carbonara was super creative and the gnocchi themselves were super soft. I couldn't stop eating!! Dessert was the brown butter cake - the perfect finish to a fantastic meal!! I'll definitely be back to try more of this amazing menu!! Thanks to Chloe for the prompt and knowledgeable service!! Kudos to the whole team!

zYLeo-N68KzuoPjBKZ8UBg.text: Came here for Paint Nite a few days ago. Arrived early to save seats for my friends and we ordered from their happy hour menu, although it was only 2pm. I got the roasted mushroom pizza and my friend ordered the poppers. Both came out fairly quickly (10 min or so) and the waiter was nice and gave us water before we began painting. I loved the pizza! Delicious sauce and great overall. It was fun trying to eat the pizza with the melted cheese with one hand and painting with the other. Their menu items do seem pricey, so happy hour is the way to go.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roasted mushroom pizza

AagjBhtSjePNdBV0Krsylg.text: Happy hour menu alone is worth a visit, order lasagne and you won't regret it!  Good spot and definitely going to be back.

Z7WbA_v8wqy9PW-6R31X0g.text: Had dinner with a group of 8 this past Saturday night. Our reservation was for 8:30 but I arrived with my friend at 7:45 and they sat us down right away. Our server was good, not great but the food was awesome. The Focaccia Rustica is a MUST! The meatballs were delicious as well. Others had pizza which they finished so it must have been good! My friend had the tenderloin ordered medium rare and it was definitely more rare but hey, that happens! The mules came out in regular glass and not a copper mug which bothers me (because it just doesn't taste the same!) but not others so no biggie.   Overall we had a great time, great drinks, and great food!

1-neYdJjq1d3xJ55obHVqA.text: I give this place a solid 3 stars. And here's why...  We had purchased Paint Nite Groupons and it just so happened that the picture we chose was at Evo. We arrived around 1:30 pm (painting started at 2 pm) and grabbed a few seats at the bar. While the ambiance was nice the female bartender was not. She brought two of the ladies in my party their drinks and when asking what I wanted, she walked off while I commenced to responding. No bueno.  Because it was Restaurant Week, many of the items on the HH menu were not available. Suggestion: If you're participating in a special promotion perhaps you should not offer guests the regular HH menu. Creating a menu for the promotion may better suit both the customer and the venue. No one wants to be disappointed when they ask for something and get shot down with, "thats not on the menu this week" or "neither is that, it's Restaurant Week".  The female bartender was extremely slow...this was waaaay before the Paint Nite guests started to arrive. Them showing up made her slower. Tony, the male server, tended to the PN crowd. He too was slow. But, in his defense, he appeared to be the only one serving 20+ ppl. Said female bartender was still slow and appeared to be of no assistance.  We ordered a pizza at 3:10 pm. By the time PN was over at 4, the pizza still hadn't arrived. The intention was to eat, drink and paint. We ended up canceling the order.   With two functions occurring simultaneously (PN and Restaurant Week) there should've been adequate staff to accommodate the crowd. Upon walking into Evo I really wanted to like this place and try it another time. But, with how things turned out today. I doubt it.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Italian Margarita!

ZDp4mbVtLsgLoUnsgLgDlA.text: The desert was very good, we shared this fried dough ball. It took 25 mins to make but was worth the wait. The staff was very helpful and attentive.

fQjVpO1RFiEYEjdEVIV2Qg.text: We took my parents here for their 50th Anniversary. I did a lot of research as my mother is Italian and likes real, authentic Italian food. I loved everything about this place! The atmosphere was modern and cozy, our waitress was amazing and the food was so very good! The manager Sinque came and talked to us after our meal and couldn't have been friendlier. We will definitely be back!

kXAVjP1R87nEDCaehfk7Vg.text: Went on a Friday night and it was extremely busy but we were earlier than our reservation and they were able to seat us very quickly which was wonderful. Our server- terrible, but cannot recall her name- was great and super attentive despite how busy she was.   The food was DELICIOUS. The food is a bit pricier than where I normally eat but the Arancini was the best I have had in a long time! The lasanga was delicious and I love that almost all the pastas are made in house.

bEuwwMpFjlRQQA2nUyJBGw.text: Fireball shots for a penny, make sure you check in.  Now that makes me happy!!!  I would give this place a solid 4 but...... read on.  EVO is interesting, kind of Euro-Italian trendy joint.  They say they are Italian but I don't think so and the menu is very limited.   Very dark with really bad music.  No idea what was playing or what's going on with that.......    Anyway, I went with two European guys who had Spagetti and Acquerello Risotto.   They both bitched like hell, said it was terrible and did not finish their plates.  As for me, mine was to die for.........I had the Hanger Scallops (I think that was the name).  Four or five big ass scallops sauteed over garlic mashed potatoes.  The best part is that I switched out the cabbage for asparagus.  The broccoli and asparagus were like the Charred Broccoli on the app menu.  It was out of this world, I was very impressed.  Also, we were out on the patio, which had a nice vibe.....  I scoped out the bar - which was full and alive with energy.  A few people were eating what looked like very good pizza.  Edit - The management has contacted me via email and made some comments.  He had genuine concern.  The above Euro guys are hard to please.  Just to be clear, this place was excellent from my point of view.  Thank you EVO for supporting the Yelp community.

cI0mmImcDn2ZUraJ3cyKEA.text: Food: 5 stars Service: 3 stars Averages to 4 stars  I love, love, love the food here, and I REALLY want to give this more stars, but the service just  leaves something to be desired.   We came in on a Saturday night during happy hour (which the server/bartender said was their strength) and sat at a high top near the bar. We had two different servers/bartenders taking our order and several different food runners bringing our food. The servers were helpful and had great recommendations for drinks and food. But then forgot to put in part of our order. We received all of our food but one dish and had already finished eating when we asked about the missing dish. He ended up not charging us for it and brought it out late, but I always get a little bit (justifiably?) upset when a server takes my order without writing anything down and then makes an error or doesn't place my order.   If I give it another try and find service to be improved, I'll be sure to update my review.

tKDsspvIKoh1YHBDKcjM7g.text: So delicious!!! And fantastic service too!! Best Date night ever!!!Chloe is amazing!!!!

YdWgR6qd02CBJWULUgWgPw.text: Our first visit to EVO - we wish we had tried it sooner. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The manager Donny visited our table to check on things. Our server Chloe was excellent. Do try the meatball appetizer- the best meatballs ever. Definitely order the brown butter cake. It takes a while so order ahead. The pasta was also delicious. We will return!

tpfLCFtwVxbYCCFv-raxUg.text: Dominick is the BEST! He is an expert on all things Evo! This is truly the very best Italian food in Scottsdale. When you come in; do yourself a favor and sit at the bar...Dominick is worth it!

EUYH5o8-IKKr8fQ7hPDJMQ.text: EVO is a fun and hip dinner option on Goldwater, near Old Town Scottsdale.   We arrived after our movie around 5:30 on a Saturday night. Things were mellow when we arrived, with only a few patrons in the bar area. That changed very quickly though. We had a booth situated between two  HDTVs of the losing Nebraska game and the start of the Cubs game at Dodgers Stadium. Nice!  We were immediately greeted by Tayler, our server with two glasses of water. She was our companion throughout the evening and very friendly. Doubly nice!  After perusing the menu, we decided to play it by ear and just order some appetizers to start. We chose the Bruschetta and the Truffle French Fries off the Happy Hour menu, only $5 and $4 respectively. HH runs until 7 pm at EVO, even on Saturday's.  After sitting back for about half hour, we ordered dinner. I chose the Bolognese Pasta; while my better half went the the Santa Margherita (photos) pizza. I added a meatball and some fennel sausage, which complemented the Bolognese nicely.   Over the years, various restauranteurs have tried to talk me out of my preference of thin pasta.  I guess I've finally learned. Bolognese is meant to coat a thicker/ wider pasta to bring out it's favor; whereas my favorite Angel Hair, gets overwhelmed and all you taste is the sauce, or gravy if you will.   Okay I give up, thicker pasta like Tagliatelle or Pappardelle is better for the Bolognese. If you have your doubts, think left over pot roast with spaghetti instead of egg noodles. I rest my case.   Our entrees were very good, tasty with a slight salty flavor, which we didn't mind. For dessert we shared the Flourless Chocolate Torte ($8.00) and some Gelato ($7.00). The Torte (photo) came with small dollops of Goats Cheese, which was a brilliant idea and really, really worked.   Now because we were here for HH everything was marked down. We also had a twenty percent off coupon which was nice. There was also a Yelp tie-in for $0.01 for a Limoncello Cordial, which will be saved for next time.   Yes, there will be a next time because we really liked EVO and enjoyed ourselves.   The tab ran us $80.00 exactly, or $64.77 after discounts, but before gratuities.  Tayler was the best, so we didn't forget her. Ask to sit in her section, you won't be disappointed by her attentive service. Promise.   Enjoy!

Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yelp coupon for Limencello

VqWDBc9jpjHXfjric3MQyg.text: My husband and I came for dinner and each ordered a pizza .. neither blew us away we found them to be too salty ..but we would would come back and try something else.  We are also very picky when it comes to pizza...

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PsPzMhJFpt6vf9vN3BUIVw.text: Joined family for dinner. There was a group of seven of us. Every plate was prepared and presented incredibly well.   We will certainly return.

jhsC4nyt1Ti7uqgspQEvPA.text: We were looking for a nice but not overly expensive restaurant to celebrate our anniversary.  Found this gem using Yelp.  Everything was amazing.  We started with the pate appetizer.  Very flavorful.  Loved that the bread served with it is grilled.  We had the lobster carbonara.  It was amazing.  They give you a whole lobster tail with it.  Gnocchi was cooked perfectly and the sauce has a perfect spice to compliment, not overpower the lobster.  The waitress gave us  a free butter cake dessert because it was our anniversary.  So yummy!  Only regret is I was too full from dinner to eat it all.  Our waitress was attentive but did not hover.   Pricing was more than reasonable considering the quality and quantity of food.

O5ysJGGCNY6JWlIKXTB6kA.text: Ugh.  The transactional, uninterested service (something I usually can overlook) really undermined the truly solid food to three stars... until my wife came back from the restroom. A four-on-the-floor puker in one stall and a separate drunk trying to start a girl power club - what is happening at this place at 9p on a Sunday?!  The basic issues: the staff is too young and amazingly disinterested. The food is too good for what looked like a young person's hangout bar on one side and a sit down place on the other. The hostess doesn't know to not seat people in the corner booth next to the booster seats and boxes of wine stacked up (we and two other couples moved from that spot in the hour we were there).   Get that chef the staff an environment s/he deserves! The food is the saving grace of Evo...

6LIyoaWSt_gYBlQVT_QVbA.text: The focaccia rustico was one of the best things both me and my wife have ever had. Definitely recommend that. The pasta was clearly freshly handmade and tasty. Don't forget the one cent shots for checking in on yelp!

Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Part of the Focaccia Rustico
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Mojc7LcQWeSVMp9eWVPttw.text: Came here at night and so didn't really experience the restaurant, just the bar/club area. It was fun. A lovely early December evening. Was in town for work and then stayed the weekend and my BFF flew in for her Bday so we could celebrate.   The place looks nice. Dim lighting, comfy booth seating in the bar. 80's music was playing - perfect for me and my friend. They have a check in offer for a free, or I should say for a penny, lemoncello drink, so my friend and I each ordered one of those. They arrived and I could tell right away that it was not lemoncello but by the strong smell, it was Fireball. LOL. The server said they were out of the lemoncello but figured we'd like this. Alrighty then. I actually don't care for Fireball, but what the heck, down it went. I then ordered a hard cider and we ordered a pizza or flatbread to share. It was very good. You could tell it was done in a wood fired pizza oven. Some parts nice and charred and crispy. Great flavors.  The crowd was cool. It wasn't packed, and most people were in their 40's. Perfect for me. We did have some fun entertainment, a few guys being friendly with us, chatting. You could tell they had quite a bit to drink but were not rude or anything. The server was good and not over serving them and cut them off, which of course, they didn't like and soon left. But it was still great entertainment. Would definitely come back, hopefully for dinner.

IdTAmiX0vGPSfkLrSA2MbA.text: It's a shame the food is so good here but our service was horrendous. Went on a Thursday night around 10pm. Place was relatively dead with a few customers. Decided to go to the bar for quicker service. Bartender started off good, answering questions about the menu and giving suggestions. The menu has a great mixture and traditional dishes and the not so common. Decided to go with the grilled octopus for the appetizer and squid ink chatarra for the entree. Grilled octopus took about 20 minutes to come out, surprising given the lack of traffic in the restaurant and bar. It was good! The octopus had a beautiful char and the chopped chorizo complimented it beautifully. Waited at least another 30 minutes for the entree. Once again extremely surprising since the restaurant was practically empty so the kitchen must not have been slammed. I don't mind waiting if the dish takes a while to make, (not sure if this was the case here) but that's something that should be stated. Meanwhile the bartender has not checked in on us, at all during this extensive wait. The dish itself was beautiful and delightful. The pasta and the shrimp were cooked perfectly. The dish had a sauce that was just the right amount of kick and spice. When I ask the bartender for the check, I asked it to be split. He goes to get the check but forgets to split it. I ask him to split it again, and does it correctly this time. We instantly go to put our credit cards down and wait another 5 minutes for him to finish his conversation with another customer, who was not his customer by the way. I'm thinking he's about to come get the check.... nope... he starts to leave the bar area. I have to ask him to charge the cards, before he leaves. Like I said the food was outstanding but the service and wait was horrendous.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dark lighting but this is the Squid Ink Chitarra

0tPAOFJ2hdI8B2Bk9G04eA.text: I was skeptically of this restaurant given the highly rated Yelp restaurant reviews I visited yesterday, which was a disappointment. From the hostess at the front door to my waitress, Chloe, customer service was great. The food was delicious! The only reason I didn't rate it a 5 was due to visiting on Tuesday, versus visiting on the weekend. If the food on the weekend is the same quality, you can't go wrong at EVO!  Ordered dessert which was delicious! The dessert forced me to change my rating to a 5.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

B2Eje48GvFSj8ZJEClysEw.text: We took our daughter and a few of her friends who were home from college recently. Our daughter had been before and highly recommended it. Best lasagna I've had in a long time, great atmosphere, and even better service! We will return.

L51JFpaQbpxNGX1auDpOXQ.text: I went with a large group and the restaurant accommodated us well. We tried almost every appetizer and they were all great. I got the ribeye and I was pleasantly surprised. It was cooked perfectly and it was tender. Only reason for not giving 5 stars was not all the food was brought out together and some of us had to wait a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ribeye

SYai6QCjHFDSUvWbHDlirA.text: Caesar salad was good. Service and chicken fettuccini was trash. Literally chicken was frozen at $22 a plate lol

FA8i3xeypHufvSL1PfHuBQ.text: Wow! Still glowing and ecstatic from our experience at EVO! Our server, Abigail, was an absolute gem that exuded charm, knowledge and jokes that even made my crabby hubby smile! As a manager of a restaurant of 16 years, I have to say she was incredibly impressive. Abigail... THANK YOU!  The food and atmosphere was exquisite! The chef clearly knows the art of fine dining. I highly recommend the chili shrimp pasta! The perfect amount of spice intertwined with fresh house made pasta - such a treat!  Keep doing you, Evo! We will be back soon!

M0i_5v5OVGx_DpalIYzzug.text: Honestly average Italian food. The ambience is nice but the pasta isn't anything special for the price. I would go somewhere else if you are wanting authentic Italian food.

m0pH41K_uq4Y4KBTCwvKRw.text: *We had a BOGO* Our server was Maura, and she took really good care of us.  *Offer*:  Check for the 1 Cent lemoncello Yelp Check-In offer.  *Reminder*:  If you are trying the butter cake for dessert, let your server know in advance because it takes 20+ minutes.  Hubby and I had the ribeye and we both liked it very much. Mine was super rare, exactly as I ordered (rare/blue). Just be careful if you have food allergies, one of the members in our party asked in advance and he still got a salad with the ingredient he was trying to avoid. They immediately corrected it, luckily he saw it prior to tasting the food. I do not go to this area much as I do not like to struggle with parking, but they do have a decent size parking lot.   We had a reservation and hubby and I were seated right away (before the rest of our party arrived), I always appreciate that. Overall good experience.

L94QqfHUS9jgaW9lTxKWaw.text: I really enjoyed going to Evo the food is pretty good except for the salad wasn't very good not sure why so many restaurants are doing this crispy kale salad always tastes burnt to me I just know next time not to order that salad also had the cheese board which was  okay for my entrees had the I can't remember the exact name it was Squid Ink something it was really good nice fresh shrimp scallops like the sauce little buttery but very good I wish I would have had my wife's shrimp fettuccine that was great I like the pesto Alfredo mix very good almost sweet ice ice shrimp and plenty of them our server was great too we had a little mistake but it could have been more my fault than hers but there was no arguing it was just tucked away and brought me a new one great recommend but definitely get the shrimp fettuccine stay away from the kale salad gross

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheeseboard

JueZJr-dEA4W0QbwJPQHsQ.text: dom and the entire bartending staff were absolutely amazing. my coworkers and i came in after work and as servers we all recognize good service and they offered us just that. definitely recommend stopping by for great drinks and even better service. thank you guys!!!

c4nV4MwDDrA0McaUc6TDkA.text: I had dinner with my friend here! We absolutely enjoyed our meals and drinks!! Their servers were very nice too.   I posted a pic of towels in the restroom because I thought that was very nice!!!!:)

bc71DnucdFAND_l-v4JcXA.text: Terrible Waitress couldn't have been bothered.. Caesar salad was obviously pre refrigerated They gave me a broken beer bottle...so dark we.had to use our flashlight to view menu Flash fried salad. ..dont do.it!

47fsrWmAHtmKXeZxIy5qzw.text: I went to an event here for being Yelp Elite and it was wonderful! I took my sister since she always is wondering what being Yelp Elite is all about. We arrived got a sweet rose from a cute flowershop in town &  free drinks and were seated with some of my other yelp elite friends. We were told that Yelp/ EVO would comp all of our meals/drinks as long as it was under $50 per person. I could not believe how generous Yelp/EVO was to us.  She had a few glasses of pinot grigio and I had a few Four Peaks Peach Ale drafts. For an appetizer we shared the EVO salad and the Scallops dish. I wish they gave more than 3 scallops but everything was DELICIOUS! The EVO salad was a "warm" salad. It contained brussel sprouts, crunchy kale, feta, pine nuts, and balsamic vinaigrette. It was tasty but I would recommend some dried cranberries for flavor. Our friends ordered the meatballs and they looked yummy.  For our meals we had the Lobster Risotto and my sister had the Chili shrimp pasta dish. Both were filling & fantastic! A major highlight of the night was the medium/palm reader that was there! She really was on point besides one little thing - saying I would be getting married in 2014(even though as of now I am single... so I don't know if that will pan out but hey ya never know right?! ). The EVO staff was wonderful and great! They went above and beyond to make this a memorable experience. Our Community manager Lindsey does an amazing job planning these awesome events. I felt so spoiled at this one and really appreciate EVO and Yelp's kindness.

rO9aHC5VkIZCAI5DO3fzzw.text: We went here for New Years tonight and it was such a disappointment. When I called to make the reservation the woman on the phone actually asked me if my party could be done eating by 8 because they had another party. Still went, based on reviews and the menu we were pumped to try some place new. When we arrived we learned it was a select menu that only had 3 options for each section and they were not necessarily the best options, nothing to do with Italian food except one pasta dish. My pasta along with others rice pilaf was in need of seasoning and my pasta has lobster in it that you had a hard time tasting. Those in my party that had the lamb chop said it was great but very very rare. Atmosphere is nice and intimate. It was a shame, if they had their whole menu available we might have found a reason to come back, but everyone in my party agreed next time this place is a pass.

G30J4zErM4ObxjUnqWkX8g.text: Attended dinner with the girls last night and was excited  to Try Evo for the first time. When I walked in I was very impressed; the ambience is great and also is the decor.  I ordered a BB&T and specifically asked if the blueberries were muddled in the drink, the server said yes. If they weren't going to be muddled then obviously that was a request of mine. The drink was $10 and I expected a $10 drink, the blueberries weren't muddled. Yes I am somewhat of a specialty drink snob but that is why I asked before ordering.  we also shared the bruschetta, not impressed.  Then for my entree I ordered the chile shrimp which was really good and the spicy was just right.  All in all,  I would not return simply for the fact that these Scottsdale places do not measure up to their wanna be status. I have worked in the restaurant business and there is such a lack of customer service these days.  Here's a tip Evo, educate your servers that if you come to refill water for one person at the table, common sense says to glance at all waters and refill as needed, I.E. Less than halfway filled means to refill all waters, then again it's always everyone's first day on the job these days.

D4FFc_h4JfYa4G6awHH10A.text: The food was great but it was very noisy. We were all sitting really close together but had to yell in order to hear each other.

6pXOe4pwb60OPcpBoquGpg.text: Heard a lot about this place and it was just average.  Nothing stood out, there's so many great restaurants in scottsdale I don't see myself going back

fCh_5s2HB8a83bK0fUTyBA.text: Hubbie and I really liked this place. We started with the bruschetta of the day (goat cheese, arugula and fig w/balsamic) and a bottle of Italian SB, then shared the lobster pasta and pesto pizza, and finished with the chocolate torte. All quite nice, though the torte needed a bit more whipped cream and the crumble sprinkled on top was too hard. Prices aren't low, but they're reasonable compared to other Scottsdale restaurants. Service is attentive, but not knowledgeable. We'll be back.

tiMO3jl8SP8fWmr8ryuvSA.text: Food was amazing as was our waiter Anthony. I will definitely be back. I highly recommend this restaurant. Some of the best food I have had in scottsdale!

lYOfcG1o2Kdii9Je9WEzDg.text: EVO is a fantastic new addition to Old Town.  It has taken the place of T. Roosevelt's, which was more than a disappointment.  The first thing of note was the great service.  The owner spoke with our table for a while when we arrived and stopped by the table a couple more times during our dinner, and our server was very attentive.  We were there during happy hour, and they definitely have a good one.  Drinks were cheap, and they have a good selection of happy hour menu items, and happy hour is from 4-7 7 days a week!   I ordered off the regular menu and had the pasta bolognese, and it was fantastic!  I am never one to pass up homemade pasta, and this did not disappoint.  Plus, it was very reasonably priced for a decent sized portion.  I also tasted a friend's arancini (fried risotto balls) and my boyfriend's mushroom risotto, both of which were excellent.  The only reason that I am not giving 5 stars-- I wish I could give 4 and a half-- was the noise level.  I was with a group of 6, and we were sitting at a round table, but I had trouble hearing even the person sitting next to me once the place got busy.  That will definitely not keep me from going back though!  Overall, I had a great experience there and am happy to welcome EVO to my neighborhood.

0nbfJ86WQCJFKsTp7ElEiQ.text: My husband and I had a wonderful dinner tonight at EVO. The food is SOLID and did not disappoint. The staff is friendly and prompt.  Would highly recommend.

1zmWQVqcDEgW683jtQUX9Q.text: Our server Ben was awesome and personable. The food was a little too salty but the great service and conversation Ben provided made up for that!

jHM0JKOJUvSGyju2lhBcgg.text: Visited EVO last night in company with our Meet-Up group, Educating Wine Lovers in Arizona.  Nick, EVO's owner, and his crew of servers couldn't have been more lovely and welcoming to the group.  We were set up by our group's leader for a wine tasting of EVO's wine on tap plus appetizers.  We learned a lot about wine on tap thanks to Nick---it's really *better* in a lot of ways than bottled!  And although I am a red wine drinker, I had a lovely little Coppola Pinot Grigio that I think might become my "before sundown" beverage of choice!  We also had some wonderful appys---two different bruchettas---a tasty tomato-basil and then this to-die-for one with rare slices of beef tenderloin and slices of asparagus---so good!  The bruchettas were followed by pizzas---Funghi and a Gorgonzola "white" pizza.  The mushrooms on the Funghi were roasted and the flavors just burst in your mouth.  The chef had added a touch of honey to the Gorgonzola pizza, that really took it to another level.  Now, I don't really like pizza---it's the crust and red sauce, mostly, so I tend to fork off the toppings to enjoy.  But DH, he is formerly from NJ and is the self-proclaimed pizza expert, said the hearth baked pizza crusts were light and crispy and perfect.  The expert speaks!  And the ambiance of the whole place was so nice and relaxing and fun and the staff was so great---we can't wait to go back.  DH wants to try some of their other pizzas or the Bistecca, while I am torn by the Scallop dish or I so love a well-done risotto as well...  Well, that's obviously at least two more visits!  It's probably just as well EVO is almost 30 minutes from our house or we'd probably park ourselves on their doorstep several nights a week!  Thanks, everyone at EVO, for a great evening!

0bWbsqaK90zuy7P_wowG6w.text: Sublime would fall short of how I felt in this unbelievable atmosphere.  Looking from side to side, all I felt in the deepest corner of my soul was pure love and joy from the "Family" at EVO.  They made the experience the best I have had in my life, possibly ruining other restaurants altogether. From City Hall to Taco Bell, I have found home in the cozy, dark, candle lit realm that overlooks Camelback mountain. I came in on a Sunday night, where the champagne and wine flowed like rivers due to the half priced bottles. My two bartenders, Jake and Dom, may have been riding steeds, I couldn't tell the difference with how smooth they operated. I ordered the braised beef pasta and the egg yolk drizzled from the cracked head across my dish with vibrance and purpose. While I nestled little bites, I found my own spirit animals, in the form of people all while remixed disco filled the air. The staff danced, sang and were so very interactive.  I laughed, I cried, I lived.  Thank you to Dom and Jake, and the rest of the EVO crew for changing the way i view Restaurants forever!

912ro1vjBh5EbjsAF9vrgQ.text: Wonderful eclectic food & very knowledgeable and friendly staff! Two thumbs up!

W6lz4DGGmeSEY-5sqxgu5Q.text: Dangerous drinks, cool staff, food til 1:30!, relaxed atmosphere, awesome people to meet, industry friendly. Should have had you at dangerous drinks!

ctLDxK1XU-Tv_D_BqW-C3Q.text: I love they're salads, I'm sure people order more than a salad but i honestly come here solely for that and of course they're massive selection of wine. They have a beautiful patio and during the fall it's gorgeous you wouldn't the best place for a ladies dinner, or whomever you like to fine with.

iRm0gVRHxFWNPsLIvWutAQ.text: We had a great experience trying EVO. The food was delicious and quite different, and we would definitely return for if. The pizza and pastas were great but the EVO salad stole the show. We were pretty disappointed with the service though. Our waitress wasn't clear about what was on the menu for vegetarians and wasn't too responsive to any of our questions. She did have a few good suggestions when we were struggling to decide what to order. Her suggestions on proportioning though were very off so I am glad we didn't go with those. The food came out very slowly which was fine for our group since we were conversing, but in a smaller group I think could have been frustrating. We ordered a bottle of wine when ordering our food and we didn't receive it until after our food was served so we ready had to drink it quickly and were unable to enjoy it. They also didn't allow us to taste the wine before pouring for everyone.  Overall, great food choices and good atmosphere (but don't go when a live band is playing because you can't even hear yourself think).

3wd26VCbrHxrstHJom8CWA.text: Where can I start? This is by far one of my favorite places period. There aren't many spots in old town that I feel truly capture the right mix of food drinks and of course, people (I'm a hard headed Italian and I think they have nailed the food). The staff are fun and entertaining, the music isn't the overplayed garbage you hear at every club and the late night industry put a really fun spin on it. Feels more like a home away from home. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for something old school, new age and up and coming. Maybe this is an EVOlution. :) cheers

oFhBHUoZC1M7OYlE6GYK1g.text: My husband and I went here for the first time last night. We sat at the bar and had drinks before our dinner reservation. The bar tenders were so friendly, and very knowledgable. The happy hour specials from 4-7 daily are awesome. The "sunrise" bourbon drink is delish. I had the chile shrimp pasta for dinner and it was amazing! The red sauce was light, and the pasta was very fresh. My husband had the salmon and was very pleased. We also shared the roasted brussel sprouts - a great addition to our meals. We will definitely go back!

LITPigams82YNDfYsAfJ7A.text: went in to evo last night to for the first time with my girlfriend, they had awesome live music and 1/2 off bottles of wine. very awesome find!

_J5kFCWSYUEItyrzTZiy2w.text: What a wonderful surprise! Evo has great food, service and ambience. We just dropped in after shopping at the nearby Fashion Square for happy hour. We had the mushroom pizza and the kale salad. Best salad ever! Don't miss out on this great new restaurant.

bVVh11X8bdi4nuw1QyGf-w.text: My husband brought me here for Valentine's Day and we will most definitely be back. It has a very urban vibe that I love. We started with the beef bruschetta and it was to die for. the combination of meat and cheese with the seasoning melted in my mouth and I've been craving it ever since. I also ordered the Artisan bread with the pesto and dollop of goat cheese. I loved it and the bread, I assumed, was fresh baked. It at least tasted like it.  I ordered the special which was the scallops with saffron risotto. It was ok - I wasn't the biggest fan, but I think it was more on my end then anything to do with the food itself. My 7 year old inhaled his pizza and keeps asking to go back. Definitely two thumbs way up. My only complaint is there were too many yummy options on the menu that I had a hard time deciding what to order.

zoXDK8bYwjv-F7UU9IHRuA.text: Dom and savannah were awesome!. They were attentive and friendly. Evo is a great a place to watch sunset.

jiOclzUbus9EXsxpMfsDUw.text: Whether you're looking for a light Italian meal before a night of clubbing, or just want to check out some late-night bite offerings in Old Town Scottsdale, EVO is a recently opened spot worth checking out. I saw a packed house when I went there for some pre-local show grub on a recent Friday night.  The restaurant is just how I like it -- dim lighting with candlelit tables, along with an expansive bar serving up tasty cocktails amid the pretty people crowd. The cocktails (all $10) are strong and infused with fresh ingredients. I loved the Grapefruit Basil, infused with fresh basil.  For dinner, my pal and I sampled so many of the delicious offerings. Let's start with the Risotto Balls ($5). They usually come in a meat sauce, but we got ours vegetarian. It's fried risotto in a tomato sauce -- every bite was scrumptious, and it's a perfect portion to share as an appetizer.  We also shared the Evo Salad ($10), with Brussels sprouts, kale, pear, and pine nuts -- again, we made ours vegetarian and skipped the pancetta. I never in my life would eat Brussels sprouts willingly, but this salad had me dipping my fork in again and again. I loved the crispy texture, and now, at least at EVO, I'm a Brussels sprouts fan.  We dug into the Caprese salad ($10), which, compared to some of my faves around the Valley, stacked up just fine. Again, this is a great light appetizer before hitting the town.  Finally, we noshed on a Margherita pizza ($11), one that almost rivaled what I've had at my favorite Valley pizza place, Cibo. Everything at EVO just tasted super-fresh and handmade, and with impeccable service, the experience was delightful.  One of the coolest things about EVO is that it's open late-night, which has been a hit with the Old Town Scottsdale service industry looking to wind down. The spot's late night menu is served until 1:30 a.m. every night, and Sunday's would also be a fun night to go, since there is live music and half-off bottles of wine all night.

iR2TIDRte2WkPQx-OOFOYQ.text: My friends and I love Evo! It is one of our favorite spots to eat dinner on the weekends. One thing we rave about is the spaghetti. Evo has the best spaghetti hands down!   Evo is the perfect place to go for a nice candle lit dinner that is reasonably priced. We love the atmosphere and the staff! Thanks Evo for always treating us great when we come in!

uau-RZeLPwLqJhefbo0YuA.text: Good food ... wonderful service .... very good happy hour ... check it out  I got the salmon and it was cooked to perfection .

42U1Yhg5uXqjv2Qd7-ZaKw.text: So... this is my first Yelp. I preface by saying the service lacks nothing and the food is very, very good. That being said, I spent  $18 on the bolognese -and it was great- but quite frankly the portion was... small. Pathetic in fact. At $10, it's justified I suppose.  At $18, inexcusable. I had been here before some time ago and got twice the meal in a large bowl. Same dish, same price. Twice the amount of food. I even took some home.  So, come here. Enjoy the wine and pleasant service... just don't get the bolognese. Though more than 2 stars are probably deserved, I feel a little ripped off.

253qnpLA17cBy2SJnCo8BQ.text: Evo is always the place I recommend to friends who are looking for a classy casual night.  Between the amazing appetizers such as the focaccia flatbread and entrees like the savory bolognese, this place is just great.  The cocktails are quality like the old fashions with the ginormous Death Star ice cubes.  The dinner crowd is booming and the night scene has a strong industry presence. Definitely a favorite that I always recommend for modern Italian cuisine cocktail lounge in old town.

EmJJQXdw5iFxJAHj2X0_Ig.text: Yum on the food.  Kind of weird on the service.  My husband and I are like old people.  Actually, in Yelp circles, we probably ARE old people.  We usually eat dinner out pretty early (to avoid crowds), and this was no exception.  We came in around 4 to an empty restaurant.  There was an open booth in the bar we wanted, but the hostess did not want to relinquish due to a 5:30 reservation??  We were out before it was ever occupied.  So we agreed to a table in the restaurant, but she had to check, double-check, and triple-check the reservations?? Maybe 2 parties came in before we left.  I didn't get it, but anyway...  We ordered spiced olives at only $3 on happy hour menu.  I didn't detect any spice, but holy moly, it was like they dumped an entire jar in that bowl!  Spice or no spice, I love olives!  We ordered the cheese board from the happy hour menu as well.  Not overly inspiring, but hey, it's cheese and bread.  Can't go wrong there.  Oddly, when our server presented it, he didn't know whether the jam was tomato or bacon??  Shouldn't he know?  It was bacon!  We also split the daily pizza which was a variety of cheeses and delicious, and a pasta dish (the name escapes me), but it was basically hand made pasta in a butter sauce.  So much sauce that I longed for more pasta or bread to soak it up.  Cheese, pasta, and butter.  The three staples in my diet...which explains a lot.  Easy 4 stars!

yHYMgC7mmx6qB-Eq_yDd_Q.text: (Lyrics - Imagine Dragons - Radioactive)  I'm ordering up shots and drinks I wipe my mouth as I eat the crust (pizza crust)  I'm breathing in the aromatics I'm dining in, reviewing it, then checking out on the foodie bus  This is it, the EVO atmosphere Yum!  I'm eating up, I taste it in my mouth Enough to make my systems blow Welcome to the EVO, to the EVO Welcome to the EVO, to the EVO Whoa, oh, oh, oh, oh, whoa, oh, oh, oh, it's EVO Scottsdale, EVO Scottsdale Whoa, oh, oh, oh, oh, whoa, oh, oh, oh, it's EVO Scottsdale, EVO Scottsdale  EVO is located in a location where all the restaurants appear......then disappears.  This is not a joke.  I reviewed several restaurants in that location and none is around.  Now comes EVO.    EVO serves up modern American Italian cuisine. I've heard so much about this place so my foodie friends and I finally convened and went for it.  I did some sharing after a free fireball shot after you check-in with the Yelp App.  Whooo...now my breath smells fresh haha!  My buddy and I ordered the Margarita pizza and added sausage and the EVO salad.  The pizza was okay, kind of tasted like pre-made dough.  The ingredients a top was nothing spectacular.  The EVO salad was my favorite.  Nicely charred kale and brussel sprouts and the pine nuts gave it that extra roast and crunch.  The aroma was nutty and a woody smell.  Overall, one of the best salads I say around!    Service was good and the place itself is really chill and cool.  If anything another round of drinks and the EVO salad is a must. - Enjoy!

PNw0iGT8ZAX9R3-qgnnnMw.text: While I was in Phoenix for a project, I frequently worked late nights. As such, my dining options were extremely limited. Enter Evo. Initially introduced to Evo by a friend of mine, I started coming here more and more as I stayed in the Old Town area to escape the Hi-Fi Kitchen douchebaggery.  This place attracts a lot of the service industry crowd at night and is a great place to relax and enjoy a nice glass of Bell's Two-Hearted Ale, which is on tap. Additionally along with other beers on tap, they also have wine, Fernet Branca (yes!) and Fireball on tap. And...maybe they still have bottles of SLO Down's Sexual Chocolate, which is a luscious Syrah blend...  I've never sat at the tables, but I've received excellent service from Jason and Jessy and the rest of the staff seated at the sometimes crowded bar. Nick recognized me from frequent visits, introduced himself to me, and always took time to welcome me on my return visits.  I've met some great locals here, had great drinks (see above Bell's THA and Fernet reference), and had great food. Food-wise, my favorites were the Pasta Bolognese, Scallop di Evo, and the Evo Salad w/ Scallops (see photo). Unfortunately I didn't try any of the other dishes.  As an homage, after working in the Phoenix/Tempe area and traveling back-and-forth for the better part of 2 years and 8 months, this was where I drank away my final night with friends.  As someone who travels close to 100% of the time, it's always awesome to find a "home" away from home. And this place certainly fits the bill.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Evo Salad w/ Scallops

qo0dZP4CDUvuvpqRb7hkxA.text: After attending a Yelp Elite event here a month or so ago, I was intrigued by the concept and came back.  I came for Happy Hour after learning about the great specials offered.   I don't know why, but I love wine on tap. I just think it's cool.  And for $5?  Hell yeah!  The happy hour menu has pizzas, small plates.  I've also had their regular menu and I enjoyed the meatballs immensely.  A friend had the kale salad which prompted me to go back after the Yelp event.   I am obsessed with that salad.  I'm not a health nut by any means, but that kale salad is amazing and you dn't really feel like you're eating healthy. Score.

KRm_XiLAfOEY2LS6seJ6rw.text: Dom and Jacob are the best bartenders in town! They never disappoint on the good service and great conversation! Everyone who visit Scottsdale, AZ should come visit these guys

HwX5wwluCVxabbO0OiH2pg.text: The only words I can say about EVO is holy smokes! The place is great! Super quaint, the ambiance in this place is to die for, literally! The staff is impeccable, the food exquisite. Here's the thing I'm gluten intolerant so I was CRAVING the bolognese, but as my fellow gluten intolerant folk know we can't have pasta! With that being said I saw they had fries on the menu, , why don't I put the bolognese sauce on the fries! The chef whipped up one of the most immaculate dishes of what I like to call "bolofries". My mind was absolute blown! Anybody looking for a unique and creative restaurant in old-town scottsdale I would highly recommend EVO

ytbc9mFwrbPbtfNRh7svuw.text: Audrey was our server and she was wonderful. Very attentive and friendly. She remind me of the limoncello shots on yelp when I got there. That was very nice of her. The food is delicious too.

6_8dFWdfaUOGg7prR1Zkig.text: Great service.. great food but best of all best desert in Scottsdale. If you come here you must try the baby cake. Takes 25min to bake but it's worth it. So order along with your entree.

Cs73Y70WdHU-AEhYKD8VIQ.text: We went to EVO after reading all of the great reviews for fresh pasta. Unfortunately, we didn't make it past appetizers. We went during prime time on a Saturday night and the restaurant was empty. This spooked us a bit, but we decided to give it a go.  We sat down and ordered some wine and the meat & cheese board to start with. The red wine came to the table very cold, which is gross for red wine. We looked past that and waited for our board. However, when it arrived we didn't like any of the meats in it. They ranged from salty to irony tasting. The cheeses were a little better, but nothing compared to many other nearby places. It was extremely disappointing.   Ultimately, we ended up leaving to go elsewhere for our main course and won't be going back.

lYTP6-hO-rrxk4ox7UwtNQ.text: One of my favorite places in old town - solid food, interesting menu, good service (usually).  Last time I went, roughly 10 days ago now, the server was off his game.  Described the pork but neglected to mention it was fried - probably my fault for not knowing what milanese meant.  Let me order a beer that was no longer in house, then came back with something completely different. (Is a shandy really similar to saison at all? Couldn't be more different)  A bit inattentive throughout but he did come out to explain that our first funghi pizza was burnt, which is why it took 30 mins to arrive.

maGKQVz6SvB2wAmZ21dUEA.text: I came here for a special dinner with my family and boyfriend. I have no complaints about this restaurant. The location is easy to find, the food was really yummy and not too expensive. We ordered bruschetta, pasta, pizza, salads, and sandwiches and our entire party liked everything we got.  The waitress was very attentive and nice. We also checked in and got two 1cent Fireball shots which was a little awkward with my 50-something parents there but it was still awesome!   One thing to keep in mind is that most of the restaurant is taken up by a bar and it caters to a younger, hipper crowd. The lighting was very dark and my parents and aunt were whipping out their phones to try and read the menu x). Anyway, I'd definitely come back but my parents would probably prefer somewhere with brighter lighting.

5ElkUV-qW-SrubZmR7P7Lg.text: In a nutshell: New-age "inspired" Italian...that's short on wow (e.g. bland). Good, casual service. The yelp coupon is a shot of fireball? Just doesn't seem to fit the vibe.  Had dinner for two on a Thursday night around 6:30. Evo was easy to find, had plentiful free parking and is in a nice space. Well decorated. Really cute, very pleasant hostess opened the door to greet us with a smile. Good start. Seated at a nice table for two. Evo wasn't crowded so we had plenty of space. Had the tables on either side been occupied, it would have been cozy.  We chose Evo over an older school place thinking the food might be great based on other yelper reviews who seem to focus more on lousy service in their complaints.  To our surprise, the service was fine. Attentive but casual. Above average beer and wine selection.  The menu appears great, though the starters are a not even a bit on the light side. We ordered the crispy risotto,. Good, not great and something of a holdover from the 90s I think. Whatever, it was fine.  Then the entrees: The Sablefish was ordered ($27) and the Broccoli Gnocchi ($14). I tried the  Sablefish first. Let me tell you my shock. This dish was so bad. Just outright bad. It was edible only in the sense that it wasn't off putting. However, it lacked any discernible flavor whatsoever. It wasn't send it back bad but it was certainly I'll never go back bad. The Gnocchi was better only in that it had an overpowering garlic flavor so it tasted like something. However, it was textually terrible (no little lines like you get on hand-rolled gnocchi). Again, not good.  Dessert was an affogato and the Italian donuts. I don't know if they were good or bad because I was so amazed at how bad the entrees were.  In fairness, I should give them another chance because maybe the chef called in sick. Regardless, I was so disappointed in the food I just can't fathom trying Evo again.   I'm not trying to be cruel, I'm trying to be honest. The truth is that this was among the worst meals I've ever had in a restaurant.   I would encourage you to take my review with a grain of salt because others seem to think Evo has some decent food. To me, it was outright terrible. Maybe It's me?  One final note: I just can't conceive of a restaurant that takes itself seriously when it comes to food (of any kind, much less Italian) yet offers a special on shots of fireball. Really? Seems kind of cheesy and immature to me. Why not offer an appetizer at half-off or something?

pE4DTplsXLxBqNk4PAQBdA.text: A+++ service, food, atmosphere - everything is absolutely amazing here. This is my favorite spot in Scottsdale, love everything about this place. Always come with a group for dinner and drinks. My favorite is the pizza, best I've ever had. Very lively and energetic, this is a great spot for date night or a group outing.

mVZf-4XUONcX4XYeG5ggaQ.text: This will be a short one, nothing here is amazing, but everything is just really good, if that makes sense. We had a table of 4 offered everything from focaccia/pasta/steak/ and salad, no one was disappointed and prices were reasonable. Service by Mara was timely and accurate, over all 5starr!!!

5VXNvAWQlPkda6z4EE8umA.text: We came in from Denver for a bachelorette party, Dominic was our server...wow!!!! We absolutely had an amazing time, he truly made our experience perfect! Great cocktails and appetizers, highly recommend!!!!

24Q5AxkResqenLCxskPVsg.text: Omg! Evo is probably my favorite Italian restaurant in all of Arizona! I always come here whether it is for a fancy dinner and casual happy hour! I always get the EVO salad! Beware: it is highly addictive! Staff is great and friendly! If you live in Arizona and have not been here I recommend that you do!

mZluNl1KSBeR2PyiiqDj9w.text: The service was excellent the dishes amazing had the ink squid pasta (with shrimp and calamari). My wife had the lobster  carbonara and she said was excellent the server Abby was very good and gave us the tip about 1 cent lemoncelio which we did when we signed up via yelp. We will come back again in next few weeks. Will you be having the pork porkquettea again? Price was not too expensive for scottsdale. I would recommend to others. Looking forward to our next trip and seeing what we want to eat I am sure it will be very good. Ok

UtGH-cvji2Lpx84cpWsN9Q.text: Bring back the raviolo!! I came here solely for this dish many times and I was so sad to see it was no longer on the menu. Everything else is great, but nothing compares to the raviolo!

Ym_3KKPdDe73oFXMuyUWAw.text: I came here for the first time for a bachelorette party dinner on a Friday night. Service was great and servers were knowledgeable about the menu! The ambient was a little dark in my opinion but I'm guessing that's the Italian theme they were going for. I will come back whenever I'm in Scottsdale. Thanks!

EWE44nGTpGEtYMDlb98J1Q.text: 5 stars for Abby's service alone. I don't usually write yelp reviews, because I'm in the industry and understand how one sided yelp can be. However I felt compelled to tell everyone how great she is, and how her sweet genuine service made a special day with my best friends even better. Thank you!!

e_E3EXLjE0mn3mvc0CaflA.text: We drove in from LA, went to a restaurant that was closing, and they recommended us to EVO. One of the best recommendations we've ever gotten. The food was excellent, and the service was great. I had the ribeye, it was very good. The portion was perfect

YY_tH1lF39OH32o6R8MgZQ.text: For me dining is an experience and there's so much that goes into a good experience. The ambience is great you can have a large party or an intimate dinner, service was phenomenal, and food was delicious. Our server made some great recommendations and you will not be sorry if you have the bone marrow, the squid ink chittarra, or their famous brown butter baby cake. i'm not a dessert person but that cake was amazing and i'm definitely coming back to try more of their menu.

XWAshy0460eOCJl9JXL8WA.text: I ate here tonight for the first time. The restaurant wasn't very busy. No one came to our table to take our order, and after 25 minutes I had to tell the hostess who just said "ok" to me. So that wasn't a good start. After the manager came by to apologize the service got much better and food came out in 15 minutes. The bread and pesto to start was very good. The toasted bread was infused with olive oil and made it really tasty. Fettuccini Alfredo was pretty good. The cheese pizza was the best pizza ever! It was soooo good. I will be for sure coming back for the pizza next time. Maybe just to get it to go. But sooo delicious!!!! Because of the bad service in the beginning they gave us a free dessert and gave us the butter cake. & wow that was the best butter cake I've ever had too!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bread with pesto
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fettuccini alfredo!
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best pizza ever.

oJ1w9aOJNU8shuyQYcNFSw.text: I took a small networking group here for a happy hour recently, and we had a blast. The happy hour prices were affordable (and until 7pm!), the service was wonderful, and the atmosphere was a bit upscale yet not stuffy.  My only wish would be that the happy hour included a bit more healthy, less carb-centric options. The bruschetta wasn't very good (skip it!) but the mushroom pizza and risotto bites were stand outs.  Last, the desserts were fantastic. Loved this place and our experience there.

YIeyvraLp_K8NacefH_8Aw.text: EVO went above and beyond to make our experience the best! From the customer service, to the amazing food to the beautiful atmosphere! So impressed! Highly recommend!

bZxrIdYymUU7gQl_6L4Zdw.text: We just happened upon this place during the Rose Day event in Old town. It isn't very noticeable when you drive by it, but it is a lovely chic little place that has a cool modern vibe. We loved the fungi pizza. The crust was perfect with a delicious assortment of mushrooms drizzled in a high quality truffle oil. Our cocktails were yummy. Try the lemonicello cordial after dinner. You won't be disappointed. We plan on coming here for a date night soon.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dining area with open kitchen in background
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemonicello cordial. Perfect touch after dinner
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fungi pizza. YUM

PqztI1jin2L98AXqtRnXjg.text: Went to EVO for dinner and it was a nice dinner. It is  a very noisy place even at 6pm when there are less patrons. Our waitress was having a hard time hearing what we wanted and we were having a hard time hearing her. She was very sweet and did do a good job. The food is an imaginative version of Italian. The popular meatballs are tasty but contain a bit too much bread; I actually got one that had a huge chunk of bread in it. All I can say is they aren't my Italian grandmother's meatballs but they are tasty. We also shared the steak bruschetta which again was tasty but there was more bread than carpaccio.. My husband ordered the rib eye steak which was cooked medium rare as ordered but he felt it was overly marinaded for what could be a good steak without marinade. I ordered the lobster carbonara which was very good, nice size lobster tail and gnocchi that were light and tender. For dessert we ordered the brown butter cake which was the highlight of the evening; it was excellent! We also ordered a bottle of red wine from Sicily that was very nice and reasonably priced and ordered 2 espressos which weren't bad. EVO would not be our go-to place for Italian but the prices are reasonable for what you get.

IbgEE29L8iYTg9jNd-U_qA.text: We purchased a Chef's dinner for 8 with wine pairings.  Service was excellent and the food was incredible  Prefect presentation, good wine pairings and each course was spectacular. We previewed and tasted what will be the NYE offerings  Thank you to our server, host and of course Chef You made our Family and Friends dinner EXCELLENT We will definitely be back

xhUO4Dg6lknngBXBAJhb9Q.text: Got take out last night. Our pasta order was not only the wrong order but all the spaghetti was clumped together and inedible! Simple directions were not followed and the portions and quality of the food is not worth the price in my opinion!  The only saving grace was that we ordered pizza, which was delicious!  Overall was super disappointed, hungry, and probably won't ever go back :(

eQL3dGH8jvGJgeWUnA5FTA.text: Love this place!! Such amazing wine and pasta, and the marrow is delicious! Staff is always friendly as well.

YeAb-CUvaHKxmg0ZCuG1EQ.text: This place is overrated. I can't believe I got fooled by the positive Yelp reviews and decided to come in for my graduation. The mushroom risotto is awful. It had no taste just rice and cheese. It's a disgrace to real Italian food across the country. You are better off going to Olive Garden and pay half the price.

YY7er4Vd2GfYXrRX44X71g.text: From the manager opening the door for us and seating us himself, to the servers lovely martini suggestion and the AMAZING food we were served, it was the perfect date night. Candlelit dining room, secluded booth and the bread service was worth the $9.00. I had the chicken fettuccine and my boyfriend had the margarita pizza- both were outstanding and took the leftovers home! Great experience!

KjSnHuN_ev1a7mzpKMu_4Q.text: This place is amazing. Jarrod is a fantastic manager, was gracious and welcoming. First Italian place we've been to in Scottsdale that has real, homemade, delicious food. Their menu is extensive and has options that can suit different diets. The tastes were fantastic. The Arancini was rich and creamy without being overly heavy. The Salmon with risotto was delicious, not too sweet, and the flavor was very fresh. My husband got the squid ink pasta with shrimp and squid on top. The shrimp was very juicy and the squid ink pasta had the perfect amount of spice. Our waitress was wonderful, and the place had great ambience. We will definitely be coming back. I can't recommend this restaurant highly enough. You won't be disappointed! This was the best Italian food in Scottsdale that we have had.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meatball
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Squid Ink Chitarra

5J24ON1Uwb7mh0bhwLxdhg.text: One of my new favorite places in old town. We went here because we had a restraints.com gift certificate. We went for happy hour. The prices were reasonable and the food was excellent. My friend and I split the crab bruschetta, veggi sandwich and a chocolate mouse cake. They were each above expectations. The staff was friendly and attentive. The decor was very nice. A+ Evo!!!

sXqDyCZnkAl8lhLvXczdlg.text: After the great reviews on Yelp I was expecting another great restaurant.....well it did not live up to the reviews. The food was fine not great but ok. The service was a little below acceptable, but the location and atmosphere were very good. Overall not bad not great. I would likely try another place.

WxvzDFE90q643LY5GSJy3g.text: This place seems to be cursed. No restaurants ever make it here long-term. However, the ambiance is very pleasant, with rustic, yet modern decor throughout. The food was above average but not great. With few Italian options in the old town area, I would return here again.

IRwDdJ9yUtpQRpcuwa7hGg.text: Love this place. The owner is usually there and very friendly, the staff is great, and the food is awesome. I like the Chili Shrimp Pasta and the Aragosta (lobster) Pasta. Pizzas are very good too. They serve food until very late and I'd say this is the best late night food available anywhere. There is often live music and the ambiance is nice though I usually stay at the bar or on the patio.

3QZyc01UOgMHYwiqPHZqTQ.text: There was a set menu for New Year's Eve. I had the lobster pasta and it was pretty mediocre. For the money there is a long list of other old tons spots if go to.

Rhw6YF-i5oEyIRgxWdcXWQ.text: EVO creates the perfect ambiance for a first date, family dinner or even guys who want to meet up for a beer and watch some sports.  Popular among the local service industry bartenders and servers in Old Town, EVO provides an elegant yet understated environment where all feel welcome.   The food covers a wide array of light Italian fare, including house made meatballs, funghi pizza, and bolognese.  What is great about EVO is that it meets the needs of all; they offer a Happy Hour Menu from 4-7pm and a Late Night Menu after dinner until 1:30am nightly.  The owner, Nick Neuman, is a stand-up guy who treats customers and employees alike with respect, sincerity, and warmth.  He understands quality food while creating a setting that steers away from what some might call the snooty Scottsdale vibe.  I strongly recommend this restaurant, whether it be for a casual drink at the bar with friends or to celebrate a special occasion.  Come to EVO and you'll feel at home.

DrrAU4tGvz0vWfWEJv7suQ.text: Great atmosphere. Great food-- arancini balls, evo salad, all the pastas.  The only thing is pass on is that pizza, but that's just because the pasta is so amazing!! Great drinks as well. Can't wait to go back.

ffSMO5q4nasV0trQSFOFtA.text: Went here for Happy Hour. Decent wines for reduced prices. The lobster Risotto was pretty good. The lobster was a little chewy and it was not broken into small pieces. Overall a good dish and nice place. I would try a diff dish if I was ever back at Evo

nXBpnpsACwwBgIdLjC19ww.text: This place was really great! Plus, if you check in on Yelp, you get a penny shot! :)

12MtzubHrRwkrfPBf-ilOg.text: I finally made it to this place and tried the infamous Evo salad as recommended by everyone. It was hands down, the best salad I've probably ever had. The bartender, Jason, was awesome and really nice.. Amazing service! I love going to places that make industry people like myself, feel welcomed. Also, Evo is exactly what I would want my own house or restaurant to look like. The decor is on point! I'll be back!!

3bgYRedyX85usYa0_sfnfQ.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant for a friend's birthday celebration.  The best part was the cheap Fireball shots with the check-in deal.  Also the food was very good!  But whiskey is my weakness...

t6bBO7dVQQwfOdZ5F-3BMg.text: The risotto was really good. Been to many places where it isn't done correctly. They did it right. It's noisy which doesn't bother me but just an FYI.. We really  had good service by a waitress named Taylor. Menu isn't very lengthy which I personally like but there were no specials.

C9Fs1_pr2ASUW6LTGeJTPQ.text: We loved the pizza.  Everything here is tasty.  Parking is easy right by the front door or around back.  Go check out the happy hour; good deals and well priced.

rzd5B4HsC578ZjdTAiy3cQ.text: Food is terrible. Short rib was like a piece of rubber. Kale & Brussels salad was ok but dry. Mussels come in tomato sauce that I would imagine bad canned sauce tastes like. Had one bite of my entree and left it for done. No one asked how my food tasted (good thing). I want my time and money back.

EyDlDtU8RSrWXGemsCVMhw.text: it's a fav for my husband and I! We usually sit at the bar and get the heirloom pasta and EVO salad.  Reasonable prices, great food, great service.  Not pretentious just good!  Wine on tap is a bonus!

JX67kStGXzurEBLL8oeCMA.text: Not what my wife and I were expecting. Two $$. Dinner for 2 was $160. We ordered 2 appetizers, 2 entree and a bottle of wine. No desert. Octopus came out cold, ordered a $60 bottle of wine and owner still wanted to charge $6 for bread. If u are a foodie don't go. If you could care less perfect location. By the way worst rack of lamb have ever had. I could have used them for hockey sticks.

sMsb-wSeKTFzyuJsGoWXeQ.text: So being in the industry its only natural to find a place for after a rough shift to eat REAL food and have REAL drinks.  Evo smacks it down pat!!!  GRRRRRRRRRREAT service, staff, drink and food!  I've just started to attend the late night post work sesh but I'm sold!!!  My new fav place to rave about and bring troves of people too!!!

UOh_Mf9XFdGQAW6cT8UN2w.text: Just an awesome & friendly new place!!  Food is quite good and very fairly priced.  My group and I also loved the creative cocktails and wine list.  Nick the owner was a genuinely nice guy, and worked with the server to give us the best service I've ever had.  He has a unique way of being personable that endeared us all to him and EVO.  My whole Office now refuses to go anywhere else for our afterwork get togethers!!!!

U-mzbbXZSb_SW3FqHNtN6w.text: We had a great early dinner at Evo. The ambiance was very relaxing, nice atmosphere. The pizza was great and don't forget to check in and get your check in special! Justin was especially friendly and very attentive. We are planning to get back there soon!

o78uj5Mdqd7cqQNyJCPq9g.text: More like a 4 1/2.  Really enjoyed this place.  Nice bar and dining room.  Warm, casual, great staff, and nice ambience.  We sat at the bar first and had a couple of cocktails, a Ketel One up and a drink on their menu called the Sunset.  Both were well made and tasty.  We had the Funghi pizza and Heirloom tomato pasta as entrees, the brussel sprout and kale salad, the grilled bread and olive oil, and a couple wines by the glass.  Everything was well above average, seasoned well, and exactly what you want when dining out. Typically, pasta dishes can do you in because they are so heavy so I usually take some home.  In this case, I finished the whole dish because it was that good.  They have their own parking lot so the parking was a breeze.  Can't wait to go back,

KDEO4sBqJP-oK0ETiNy4uQ.text: Great food.  Great Atmosphere.  Great vibes from bartenders.  Warm and welcoming just like a real home town local "joint".  Please keep it up!  Just wonderful for all ages.  Thank you.  Great touch when the chef comes out to bring the food to the table.  Menu is generous and the late night dining so cool!

FLJivOYDRCgiOGNQbLTkeQ.text: 5 stars. This place is delicious. Incredible food, yummy drinks and low key atmosphere.   I'd recommend the bruschetta to start. The beef tenderloin mixed with the truffle oil and asparagus is so yummy.   I had the Italian wedding soup and it was incredibly tasty. The meatballs were full of flavor!   Can't wait to go back and try the handmade pastas.

IeKjNKVVI2CuhHlG6WYSGw.text: My best friend and I wanted to try a new place for my birthday dinner. I looked on Yelp and saw that EVO had a lot of good reviews, so I looked over their menu and it looked like exactly what I was looking for. EVO provided some of the best service I have ever seen at a restaurant. Our waiter Tony was awesome and super attentive. We loved his facial expressions with every course that we ordered solidifying that we were ordering well. For cocktails, I had the peaches dream and it was quite refreshing and tasty. My friend had the Monroe's Mule and enjoyed hers as well. To start we shared the Focaccia Rustico which was amazing and you won't find anywhere else. If you are a fan of brie, marscapone, and honey then this is a must. I had the mushroom risotto and my friend had the lobster risotto for our main courses. Both were unique and delicious in their own ways. To end on a high note, we had the Nutella cannolis which were just enough and the perfect ending to this perfect meal and experience. To say that I highly recommend this restaurant is not enough. It is definitely a MUST to visit as you won't be disappointed and you don't want to miss out.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nutella cannolis delish!

ywhWCe-8QCLkMB8jLDKyfw.text: My son (20) and his gf (21) and I (49) ate here on Thursday evening. We were craving Italian and this was near where we were so we opted to give it a try. Everything was delicious! We started with the burrata to share. I had the squid ink chittara, which was excellent--and I'm from Seattle originally so I'm a stickler about good seafood. My son had the lobster alfredo. It was also very good, although different than what we thought...it was basically a lobster tail in the shell with a side of gnocchi--it wasn't mixed together. Girlfriend has specific tastes, so we special ordered gnocchi in alfredo sauce which wasn't on the menu. They very happily accommodated our request and she enjoyed her meal. The service was excellent, with our server being supported by additional staff, cleaning up plates and refilling water. One thing to note, it is quite loud in there...I wouldn't bring my hard-of-hearing dad there, but for us it made for a fun and lively atmosphere. We will definitely be back.

NruP75D-u0HhQoBtC4i14g.text: Fantastic atmosphere with great food. My wife and I have visited this restaurant multiple times and enjoyed each visit.  You can't go wrong with the pizza of the day.

k4Pe5LeSrJSHWp1uMlKstA.text: A big thank you to all the staff at EVO! We had our engagement party there last night and everything was perfect :) All my family loved the food, and the romantic lighting. Special touches like our personalized menu made our night extra nice. Elise the catering manager was great to work with! My parents enjoyed how easy it was to get a menu that worked with our guests needs. And OMG the flourless chocolate torte! Yummmmmy. Thank you again!

RFKzTRNusrf-5QX5pk3bgQ.text: I cannot honestly understand how this restaurant has 4-stars. Nothing about this meal was good.   1. Meatball appetizer - comes with 6 meatballs. I had three and each had a portion that was gristly that I physically had to remove from my mouth.   2. Whiskey cocktail - instead of the typical single ice cube, the entire glass was filled with ice cubes (like the ones you get at a vending machine). To make matters worse, there was so much ice it was above the rim of the glass.   3. Pork chop - good portion if you enjoy eating fat; ~40-50% was fat. The bean mix on the bottom of the dish was extremely salty and the orange puree tasted like an orange push-pop.  4. Roasted potatoes (side dish)- The potatoes were dry and flavorless like they were previously made and put under a heat-lamp.  5. Brussel sprouts (side dish)- the brussel sprouts were separated into leaves, fried and had a mayo drizzle on top. The net weight of the dish was approx. 1g because the leaves had been separated to make it appear as if there was more food. I imagine about 3 brussel sprouts went into the making of the dish. On top of this, the sodium content was through the roof.

klttX8mEam2xh6Anoa5gLg.text: Excellent service and also lively atmosphere. The food was fantastic. Freshly made pastas. Pizza was great. Try the meat and cheese board!

aF54V0uVqQwKFaZQoLrGfg.text: The fact that I tried cuttlefish ink noodles for the first time, and they were actually tasty is a 5 star experience in itself. Great service, awesome atmosphere, amazing food, and good variety on the menu (cocktails and food.) Overall, a pleasant experience!

crlz1_jxjJKQ3ETokSepYQ.text: Made a reservation for a group of 17, they seated us a half hour late but did offer us free champagne which was nice. Still, the service was slow, the items on the fixed menu were small portions, and the gnocchi was very unimpressive.

Pkzm-M7et9W3XMDGIdLxJA.text: Interior is eclectic and somewhat upbeat vibe. Not very busy...Monday night. Everyone we spoke with was very friendly. I had the Evo salad, which my server graciously offered as a half portion (which was huge!) It had great flavors but was extremely salty. Entree was the fennel sausage and pasta. Again, great flavors but amped up too much. I like spicy, but this was so spicy it burned my lips. Also heavy on the salt and garlic. Definitely not bland, but don't think I would order it again.

_gZsOP_zhRkEoEOsfgXWag.text: This place is great for a few cocktails before going out on the town. The drink menu includes everything you'd want to see and the service was good. Drinks are a little expensive but that wouldn't stop me from visiting again!

126J53nGzw1BaoC5fP1JjQ.text: They charge you $6 for burned bread! It's nice place just don't get bread! Also menu on open table is old, no chicken parm. Nice place just little ups and downs. Unfortunately not much better in Scottsdale. Salads are very good.

yDotsDjvHTkkXmTxS_Iq-A.text: Went in for my first time December 31, New Year's Eve night.  It was very crowded and busy but our server was attentive and very efficient. The food was amazing, from the meatball appetizer thru the butter cake finish, and the filet and sea bass main courses were insanely good! Chantel was our server and even though the place was packed she made our dinner one to remember! Recommend this place highly! Food, service, atmosphere were all the best and can't wait to come back next year which happens to be tomorrow? Great Old Town Scottsdale dining spot!

RGnQ5Eu72HirWmSNHue36A.text: Ben and Mike are the best bartenders around. Guided us through the menu and are very attentive and fun. Always recommend Evo to anyone.

PRVt8PKCyFBpOS4a5r_ZpA.text: Great service! Delicious food!!! Happy hour is awesome too! Highly recommend this restaurant! Get the charcuterie platter if you go- best I have ever had!

14orU2_lEwfFrrci0EoGbA.text: A great place to take your lady for a date. The atmosphere is perfect and the wine&pizza deal is top notch. Every Wednesday this place should be packed!

EkbCc5b3rxDkvQFSFmneLQ.text: We found this place as a result of our concierge service during a staycation in Scottsdale. We were impressed with the fresh produce used and the variety of dishes offered. Everything we tried was wonderful. Highly recommend this place for a upper end dinner with a fantastic atmosphere. Worth every penny

zs8ekUY67uolCd_b4zAoyQ.text: Came in at 1145pm--they were still serving some food and of course drinks which was great. Relaxing atmosphere Great drinks (Italian margarita ) Meat/cheese board was good size and had great variety w lots of pickled veggies  Great place that is walking distance from stand up Scottsdale which we choose as our post-show bar.

8yRF_wH38Ir33SjpKkJKJQ.text: Meh service was slow and the food was just okay. We ordered several items but the pizza ended up being the best of the mediocre. I thought surely the butter cake that several reviews mentioned would redeem Evo but, even that was just okay. Granted I think it may have been sitting for awhile before it made it to our table.

Eb9lGbcBaEPX9R3mmEwEfA.text: The best place to go after work for a great drink and ambience. The service is super friendly and the food is amazing!!

U01TS3hzh11ZEerPxO9F9Q.text: Moved to Scottsdale 3 months ago-  have come across some great restaurants but finally gave in and created a yelp account to make sure EVO got the press they deserve.   This spot is beautiful and the staff was off the chain.  Jason took care of us at the bar and knew the perfect balance between recommending worthy food/drinks and  giving us space to enjoy and take it all in.  The cocktails alone would make me come back-- but when our food came it just kept getting better.    I love when restaurants have the "it factor" and this spot has just that.  The live music on Sunday night is exactly what people need to to wind down to over a beer before their work week starts again.  Atmosphere is simple, classy, sexy and relaxing.  Definitely a hidden gem.

jhhVjQ7GtLAC7p79GdeA3Q.text: This place is awesome!!!  we routinely come here and our visit today just reinforces the fact that we will continue to come here because of the amazing customer service we get.  My girlfriend and I were freezing outside not only did we get a bunch of warm blankets, warned mugs with hot water to keep our hands warm, our little dog got the same hospitable treatment as well.  Great food (fried chicken thigh is the sh**) amazing service fantastic ambience!

Zl_pJIWhegEc8E8vThQZoQ.text: What an outstanding new bar/restaurant in Scottsdale!  First of all- Parking is a breeze with the attached lot. Ambiance was lovely and romantic, and they had a fun crowd at the bar if that's what you are seeking. The patio looks killer also, can't wait for it to cool off and enjoy a lovely meal al fresco.  To start- we had the Bruschetta- which was out of this world...it was Grilled Bread | Beef Tenderloin | Asparagus | Taleggio | Truffle Oil...just heavenly. For an app we also shared the Meatballs which has such delicious Italian flavors. Next we had the Chile Shrimp pasta...Tagliatelle pasta | Shrimp | Chile | White Wine | Mint | EVOO...divine! Perfect for summertime, nice & light. Paired with their fresh cocktails, the meal hit it out of the park. Bartenders are all just awesome, service was great and the owner was a delight and made sure we were having an amazing experience- which we did. If you have not been to EVO, you are missing out!
