EgjbodhrjLGA2YWtolgcjg.text: The place is pretty great. Nice atmosphere good people that go there a nice friendly staff good selection of booze and fairly interesting with limoncello on tap.  The food is pretty good- but very expensive. I had the pesto pizza which was pretty good and another time I had the Alfredo. Both pretty good although I would go with the Alfredo. Unfortunately the pizza is $14 and the pasta is $15 and I always like to add some sort of protein to my pastas but I felt uncomfortable paying over $20 for a pasta that was a smaller portion size than I expected. It might have been the plate it was served in, which is pretty cool looking and a bit different, but I felt like I could have had 2 of them and still been hungry.  Overall I still approve! Maybe I'll come back for the $26 salmon although I'm a bit afraid on the size..

hPL-p4qqVFZ10qzbj0JStA.text: If I were rating this experience alone, I would give it 1 star because the experience was shaped by the poor service.  The food was 3 stars, so I am going to give it the 3 and pretend the service didn't happen. The pesto for the bread was extremely delicious, but the rest of the meal was just okay.   I would NOT go with a larger group.  We had two tables of about 12 people each.  We ordered several bottles of champagne, the server poured extremely uneven glasses around the table (I had less than an inch of champagne while my neighbor's glass literally over flowed), then the other bottles were placed in ice buckets behind a service station, our glasses were empty most of the night, people kept asking to have our bottles brought out, after 45 minutes of asking our server, we got a back waiter to finally bring it out to us.  The gals that weren't drinking champagne waited at least 30 minutes from ordering to receiving glasses of wine. Our side dishes were brought out as if they were appetizers with one gal receiving her entree at that time. The rest of our food arrived about 45 minutes later but one person had to wait another 25 for her food.  Overall it was a mess, and dinner took more than 3 hours.

KH7nL70ZMlN0ffuvXOhB2Q.text: Evoooo!!! We loved evo! Arrancini was fabulous and we had a salad with Brussel sprouts and kale. Ended the meal with a pizza !!! Amazing amazing! Dominick was our bartender and he was awesome!! Can't wait to go back!

LMYZ-ZrjKbMGvFCayDbgvQ.text: What a great experience! We went her for my wife's surprise birthday. I wanted it to be special so I called to clear up details. Barb at the front desk was amazing. She spent about 15 minutes on the phone with me planning every detail to make sure my wife was surprised and had a great time. It worked wonderfully and I am grateful.  The food is also amazing. The meatball and arancini apps are great starters and the bolognese or the pork osso bucco are sure winners.

LB3q-EB5nCNGPmwHwFxKjg.text: Had a great time for a Saturday happy hour at EVO's 4pm to 7pm.  Seating anywhere in restaurant.    Brusheta with Crab, Vegetable Sandwich, fried risotto balls, Steak sandwich were all very good and range in price from $5 to $8 (steak sandwich).  If you didn't want the french fries you could opt for their sides, of salad, or 4 other picks.    The drinks were reasonably priced draft or bottled beer $3, premium well $4, glass of wine $5 (good size pour).  A good time was had by all.

OyEDlN2Y-Adgx-Ux3y91UQ.text: The restaurant, ambiance and food were very nice. My only compliant is that my food was completely forgotten by our server and then to compensate for the inconvenience, I was given a pitiful discount. As a first time diner at this establishment, it wasn't the best experience.

MV_9iTy3zN9CW9EGpjXBvw.text: Once again the food is AMAZING, the atmosphere AWESOME, and the BEAUTIFUL Jessie delivers exceptional service! I really love this place!

aKwAfwlAzqnAWyMRgEuZNA.text: Wow. EVO is damn good! Let me start by saying I hate Kale. Like I know it's super healthy but I hate it. It's trendy rabbit food, let's get real. My friend wanted to split the Kale salad which after saying "hell no" she finally convinced me so I begrudgingly decided to try it. Well...it was the most delicious salad period. You know you're at a good restaurant when they make the food you hate taste awesome. I concluded the meal with the bolognaise (sorry, I can't spell) and it was bomb too. Our server was very personable without being annoying and even made sure we checked in on Yelp to get the .01 lemoncello which I'm not a fan of but hey, a penny is a penny and we went to Old Town for a reason! :-)

_FH3SsInx-JnvUGFa7u3Ng.text: The food was just ok. Pasta was way over cooked, well past al dente, almost to the point of sogginess. Our server was not very good, she seemed extremely disinterested. Not sure if I will give them another chance.

KP4oa1TxhJQ2DPQolsxxew.text: Excellent market fish dish and chocolate raspberry torte. It's a must have menu everyone should check out. My foodie friends are going to flip over this place. Amazing!

QSAz3uTUtquySw-LDc8QJw.text: I've been wanting to try Evo for a while. Went here with my friend for a happy hour on a Saturday. The bartender only gave us one menu. Like why did he expect us to share? I asked for my own menu. It's not like I'm dating my friend. I ordered a white pizza, it was okay. I honestly like the pizzas at Vivo more. I also didn't really like the grapefruit basil drink. Wish I just ordered beer instead. The inside of the restaurant is decorated with cool chandeliers.

Mdi6WEAiPdyYybPevcAXGQ.text: This place is extremely trendy and awesomeness....Jason and Chelsea was really awesome! We all had a great a really good time!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jason! Is the best
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Well... Cuteness

Hm4S4Fv0NCaaqALxgZAu9g.text: We thought bread would automatically come with an Italian dinner.  WRONG .  We ordered 2 baskets (4 slices in each) for five people and were charged $4.00.   Read was okay but nothing out of the ordinary.  Carbonara was covered with too much pepper.  Chili Shrimp was good.   Heirloom tomato tasted like it has canned tomato paste with fresh tomatoes.

reBCS0mzqup1S8By7pFm2w.text: The food was excellent but the service was not the best. Maybe a bad night. Will try it again but I hope that the service is better. We asked for salad and never got it also they did not have the pasta for the dish that my daughter wanted. The waitress was supposed to let us know if they were out but never came back.

lO2AaUO72eQvvogZoKcpVQ.text: Very cute place! They serve a full menu until around 1:30. MUST TRY the EVO salad. Crispy brussel sprouts and kale combo, goat cheese and balsamic drizzle. WOW, I'm going back for that!!  The rest of the food was good, but not outstanding. The staff was friendly, and they have some awesome hand crafted cocktails.

sMau94mO_R3KCMNkaC8yjw.text: Mediocre food, indifferent service. The beef carpaccio was underdressed, the short rib was closer to pot roast and woefully under seasoned, and the olive oil cake paired overly tart flavor combinations and unstrained raspberry sauce. The food wasn't terrible, it was just unsatisfying. No desire to go back. Decent happy hour prices, but they were out of all the unique beers on the menu.

09qbwCCkweUF_aRaRxGStg.text: Last night my boyfriend and I had dinner and it was amazing. The food was delicious as always and nice big portions. The music was perfect for a nice date night as well. The best part was our server Abby. She was an absolute pleasure to interact with. Amazing service and such a great attitude. She went above and beyond. You guys are lucky to have her. We'll definitely be back.

b1tOmVYRsmPsXWWgLZrNdg.text: I came to Evo with a gf for a happy hour (5-7pm). We enjoyed a couple of glasses of good New Zealand white wine and ordered a Mushroom pizza each. Pizza was ok, I might try bruschetta instead next time. The service was good and it wasn't crowded. Nice place to meet a friend!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mushroom pizza

yud7cs-JqK7ylnRSocZOaA.text: I came with a large group to EVO for work. Our server handled the challenges of a group very well. Cocktails and wine were good, though the cocktails weren't the most inventive. Food generally was delicious, but again not unique to other American Italian style restaurants in Scottsdale (which isn't necessarily a bad thing, but probably wouldn't make me come out of my way for). I had the lobster gnocchi which was presented in the lobster tail itself, which was nice to touch. It was a bit on the saltier side, but the lobster was good. Other people enjoyed their food as well and there were plenty of options for the vegetarians. I would come here again for a group dinner, but probably not for a private meal, since the food was good but didn't stand out compared to other places. Service was great though, for a large group.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lobster gnocchi: tasty, but very salty!

mTbkkecdAcO87gIipsNQCw.text: We loved dining at Evo.   I came here with a big group from work for a team dinner. We always order lots of appetizers to share, which I love because it allows us to try multiple things on the menu. We ordered the arancini, bruschetta, and a pasta appetizer that was like one huge ravioli.   The ravioli was everyone's favorite - beautiful handmade pasta stuffed with a creamy filling in a decadent sauce. The arancini was a close second - a ball of cheesy risotto fried to a crisp on the outside, served in a puddle of hearty marinara sauce. Drool.   For my entree, I chose the Squid Ink Chitarra - handmade black pasta accompanied by shrimp, mussels, calamari, scallions, saffron, butter, and calabrian chile. I paired it with a glass of white wine and it was unreal. I loved it. It transported me straight back to Italy, a fond memory of enjoying squid ink pasta in homemade marinara with a glass of white wine overlooking the Mediterranean. Yum-o!  For dessert, we got the butter cake. All I can say, is you HAVE TO order it if you come here for dinner. It's unreal. So buttery. So flavorful. I actually had a dream about it that night... it's that good.  Evo supposedly also has a great happy hour, and I'm excited to go back and try even more dishes and wines from their menu. I'd love to try the grilled octopus. I also appreciate that the location is central in Old Town, too.

NaQDkOdWxUd6o1KoTzuVdw.text: Hmm, the food was good, but service could have been better. I'm not too picky on service either, it just seemed we waited for awhile for our server to check on us when we needed things.  My bolognese was pretty darn good. I added a meatball, which is good too. I topped my pasta with Parmesan which added to the flavor.   My friend liked his dish too, but  another friend not too much. We ended returning it.   We don't usually return plates either but if we're paying a lot for food, we want to be satisfied.  Aside from my friends plate, I would stick to the safe bets, like spaghetti or Alfredo or even the bolognese . I would come back just for the food though. Wouldn't expect much from the service aspect.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bolognese with meatball

mxTTMTKqwfC23C2XF_Rldw.text: I have very high expectations for places like this, and I know it doesn't mean much coming from a nobody but EVO blew me away. From the service, to the food, to the venue ambience, top to bottom-- everything associated with this location is high quality.  The squid ink pasta is a difficult dish to execute, but the chef cooked everything to perfection. The spices were present but not overwhelming and balanced the rich, buttery flavor of the squid ink. Every piece of seafood on the plate was reminiscent of a trip to the coast.  I have far too many positive things to say about this experience to detail in a Yelp comment. Anyone who enjoys food should definitely give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. High expectations for the squid ink pasta were met with exceptional delivery!

Gz_Kq0xEnSvzyVsZ2o3nPA.text: Yet another elegant, Scottsdale standard Italian place. Good ambience and music. Ordered - Eggplant Ragout : tasted ok-ish. Eggplants were kinda under cooked. It was lil dry when served.  Prices are on lil higher scale of yelp's standards. Just a one time try place.

bZqCom3buJNfIXz2WgNSyQ.text: We were looking for a new restaurant to try in Old Town for restaurant week and decided on EVO. What a great choice that was! The atmosphere was cozy and romantic, our server was attentive and friendly, and the food was outstanding.  For the appetizer we chose the Caesar salad and the grilled octopus. My boyfriend gets the Caesar salad everywhere we go and he loved EVO's version. The grilled octopus was perfect and not overly chewy, with a great char and flavor.  For the entree we ordered the steak and lobster risotto. Wow! These were both winners! The steak was tender and flavorful while the lobster risotto was perfection, bursting with flavor and had lots of lobster chunks throughout.  For dessert we got each of the options, the panne cotta and the chocolate cake. They balanced each other perfectly, with the chocolate cake rich and decadent and the panne cotta citrusy and light.    This really is a perfect date night location and we will be back soon!

O_0zYEKYz5ZC9pCWZGZWvQ.text: Evo has been a favorite restaurant of mine since 2014. They consistently have great food and wine along with many great happy hour specials. We especially love that they serve food late night as well! The menu changes up a little with new pasta dishes every now and then. I've always loved everything I've had here!

p54YhCV1TGaXZvo7waV3lw.text: I've been to Evo a couple times now and it's very inconsistent. The first time I tried Evo I had a great experience, the food was very good. The next time I went, my food came out cold. The waiter was very nice and had the chef make me a new dish. The second time it came out it just tasted awful. The manger came out and apologized and gave us a free dessert which was nice. I feel that this restaurant has a lot of potential if they can get the consistency worked out.

IAt6x4OwUw8bbD0P6LUIrA.text: I just moved to Phoenix and decided to make the drive to Scottsdale to explore old town. EVO is right on the edge of old town. I was excited to try out an Italian restaurant in AZ.   I started off the night with a Grapefruit Basil cocktail. I am not usually a grapefruit fan but this drink was refreshingly amazing. It is the perfect summer concoction!   We ordered the meatballs for the table and split them in half. They were so delicious that I wish I would have ordered them as my entree.   For my main course I chose the heirloom tomato spaghetti. It wasn't the best I ever had and the handmade pasta felt over cooked but it was still tasty and enjoyable.   For desert we ordered the Brown Butter Cake (you have to place this order 20 min in advance!). It was CRAZY good. I wanted to order another to take home. It's not overbearingly rich and the creamy and spongey texture were perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5cccsvRZ30clPRjUUxgFXQ.text: This place is beautiful inside. There are chandeliers, funky chairs, a dining area, a bar, and a patio. From the outside it looks like a normal bar but the inside ambience is fun and gorgeous. They play really good music, too! I was hearing new songs and early 2000 songs and the mashup was great. My fiance and I ordered drinks, I got the strawberry limoncello (made with gin) and my fiance got a drink with Jameson. Gin has a very strong taste and I was impressed with how the cocktail masked the flavor just the right amount. The drinks were delicious, we ordered another round! Great bartender. We ordered our food at the bar just to munch on something while conversing. I chose the Burrata Salad. It comes with bread, balsamic glaze, burrata cheese, a tomato relish type of spread, pesto and arugula. It was absolutely amazing!!! I loved it but I truly do love those flavors combined. My fiance was enjoying it too.   My fiance decided to order the meatballs. I have heard the meatballs at EVOO are incredible, so I will say we were a bit disappointed. I'm not sure if their meatballs are always so mushy inside, but ours were VERY mushy. Like mushier than meatloaf, I kid you not. We tried to force ourselves to eat it but it wasn't happening lol. I hope it was just an anomaly and maybe next time we try them they're good!   Overall I definitely enjoyed this place. We plan on coming back and trying the EVOO salad and some pasta! Can't wait.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Buratta Salad-- absolutely delicious, refreshing, and the perfect combination of ingredients.
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The meatballs that were really mushy :( (hopefully 1 time thing) Drinks: The left is a limoncello strawberry the other with Jameson!

OI12WcYLrraNUpTbgu0irg.text: Excellent food and service! Highly recommend coming during happy hour, where they have amazing deals. Will definitely be coming back!

Ke1nPOmx_wVc9HTjyu0P3Q.text: I came in here once (maybe a couple times?) for Happy Hour shortly after they opened and I honestly don't remember much about it. I recently stopped in again (and again) for HH and now REALLY like it!  Both times I had the mushroom (and truffle) pizza and it's delicious! It's pretty big, and honestly if you order this at the bar with a couple beers or glasses of wine you're good to go. I've also had the bruschetta board and all the types I sampled were yummy! The pear and brie one was my favorite. I've also tried the arancini, which are basically big, fried risotto balls. They're a little heavy, but good. Last time I came I had the ciabatta w/pesto dip & goat cheese. The dip was very good!   Beer & wine wise EVO has pretty much the best HH deals in Old Town. $3 pints of quality beers (there's three to choose from) & $5 glasses of wine.   Service is friendly.   I'll continue to keep EVO in my Happy Hour rotation.

f_PGv-DvwLuwxqIs2f_pTw.text: I really didn't enjoy my experience at Evo last night.  I participated in the restaurant week menu, so I paid less than usual. I still thought the value for the experience was excruciatingly minimal.  The service was very poor for an establishment that is priced to be classy.  They were out of several offerings with no replacement options.  The food was just ok.  We sent a few things back that weren't acceptable.  Even what we didn't send back was edible.  The flavor profiles were not great.  I was asked how my experience was by a friend and I said under no circumstances would I return.

e8fdsQHbRAv7AaOU1Via_A.text: Some of the more exotic menu items are gone, but this still remains a great value for the area, particularly during happy hour which lasts until 7:00.

_eITcZxyDxs9A6Sa7DOtlw.text: Let me start by saying that if you go here leave room for the Brown Butter Cake dessert. By far the absolute best dessert I've honestly ever had. Amongst the table, we had the Octopus and pork belly for appetizers, squid ink pasta, lobster carbonara and lobster risotto. All three dishes were phenomenal and very filling. Besides the BB Cake, we also had the flourless chocolate dessert complimented with an espresso martini and all were amazing. Start to finish, 5 stars. Drinks, apps, meals, desserts and service all absolute top notch. Modest pricing but who really cares when you get such great food, drinks and service?  Well done all around, we will definitely be going back again.

aW25GyFVIvZT3VHie_aVxg.text: Seriously overpriced for the quality of food. I got the fettuccini Alfredo at $20+ and it wasn't any better than a chain Italian restaurant. You are paying for atmosphere here.

olM2QGv1RJJxaR80BV3VrA.text: "Always trust the chubby waiter" - waiter John.  He didn't lie...the mascarpone app is top 3 all time.   Chicken Parm - eh.   Risotto - a lot.   Chile Shrimp - brings some heat and good.   Short rib - excellent but mashed potatoes stole the show.   Miller and Bud drafts cold.   We'd come back.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chili Shrimp.
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Heaven.

ayLluuqACNevKorFmwPTkg.text: I had dinner with a friend recent, it was a very pleasant experience. My spaghetti Bolognese was delicious. My friend had the scallops and she enjoyed them. The service was very attentive and we enjoyed our meal , will be back .

YyXlaXih6bRr21NFdj_03w.text: Nice spot in old town for Italian. Went with another couple all our food was great and the wine prices were good for a Scottsdale Restaurant. Will definitely go back and try again. Had the Bolognese but forgot to share picture.   Wife had Salmon and we share two apps the Funghi Pizza

BpkRtDwBvBpqSavVsoazEA.text: I love EVO for so many reasons but the main one is that every time I stop by this place after a long day of work my night instantly gets better. Today as soon as I walked in I was greeted by the manager place was packed, I asked if we can get 3 seats at the bar and they accommodated us right away. The bartenders are so attentive and the cocktail I had Monroe's Mule was top notch. Now on to the food this lasagna melts my mouth away it's definitely my favorite dish they offer served in an iron skillet I can't get enough! If I can give this place 10 starts I totally would, highly recommend this place!

Z4qgaf8a71dLznU4U-xTLg.text: We came to EVO last night for my dad's birthday dinner. I've driven by this place about a thousand times and had never been, so I was excited to check it out.  They have daily happy hour from 4-7 (which is always a huge plus for me) with a great selection of beer, wine, cocktails and appetizers. In addition to the HH menu they also had an evening brunch menu as well. I ordered a raspberry Moscow mule along with biscuits and gravy off the brunch menu. The drink was delicious, a great balance of tart raspberry vodka and ginger beer. The biscuits and gravy were great as well. 2 large biscuits topped with gravy and onions with a side of potatoes. I could have done without the onions and I wish they had a bit more gravy.  I can't wait to come back and try something off their standard menu because their pizza and pasta looked delicious!

wfFG7R-smgCRbyTwZfMG1g.text: Today is October 15th 2017 around 12am- We had a horrible experience with a waiter with a man bun... He was very rude, no customer service, and a bit of a snob considering he's a waiter haha. We frequent restaurant in Beverly Hills which in comparison makes this city look like a dude ranch and I've never had anyone feel so superior to their clients!!! The people paying you!!! Goes to show how intelligent this server is... The food was nothing special, not bad but mediocre. That server left such a bad taste in my mouth that I wouldn't go back.

8ceveNfGd9vb8_1ulM4pmA.text: Service was okay. It seemed like a one man show for service so it effected the flow of the night. The focaccia bread was really good. The spaghetti was decent but my friends fettuccine wasn't all that great. Overall the place was just okay for a late night meal

mETGy7F-FoZ7sMmVDV93tA.text: Biggest, and best charcuterie/cheese board ever!!!! Donny and Audrey were awesome. Greeted us right away, and Audrey picked an awesome wine (The Chemist) for my girlfriends and me to share. The ambiance and atmosphere were vintage and calm, with awesome 90's music playing. We were all so happy to be there. After getting off a long shift at work, we were put in a great, and relaxing mood!

RUivCjie67pZ7Uq4AkQ1XA.text: Went here on a weekday date and had a wonderful dinner here! The steak bruschetta blew my mind. Stacked high with tender beef it really stood out among everything else. I had the pasta bolognese and loved it. The sauce really packed a punch! Service was superb. As first timers we were perplexed about where to start and the appetizer that our server recommended ended up being my favorite part of the meal! She also offered lovely wine suggestions for us. I'll definitely be back for another dinner soon! I love the culinary style here (they call it "Modern Italian" I think of it like Italian with a twist!) so I can't wait to try more!

3iaYX5lpVJeeg2wLZFZLsA.text: Great food menu  Chicken picatta: 4/5 Shrimp fettucini: 4.5/5 Eggplant ragout: 3.5/5 Vegetable pizza :3.2/5

scV_a94zbOl11DveullDjw.text: Had high expectations. Good previous reviews, good location, good atmosphere. If only the food was that good.   To be fair, 4 of our party of 7 had good/great dishes. 3 did not. The gnocchi had some overwhelming sauce which left it half-eaten. My wife's pork belly, she sent back. Drenched in a melange of spices, it was inedible. I had the squid ink pasta with seafood. The pasta had been cooked then left partially out of water so some was actually crisp. One of the mussels was rubber. The other barely cooked.   Service was good, however.

2fbq1rx0tggKPNLd__-46A.text: We came here for Arizona Restaurant Week. Upon entering the restaurant, we were greeted by the hostess. There was still one person in our party yet to arrive, so we asked to sit in the couches that were somewhat of a waiting area. I went to the restroom and when I came back, my husband informed me that the hostess said the seating area was reserved. We thought that was odd, so we just asked to be seated at our table and we would wait for our friend to arrive. The table that we sat at had a very dusty table cloth and while they did bring a lint roller out to clean it, I felt there was a bit of an attitude that we asked for the table cloth to be cleaned off. The appetizers were decent but our entrees came out under cooked. We ordered our steaks "medium rare plus" and they came out rare. After waiting 10 minutes for a server to come by (not our server), we made mention that the steaks were underdone. They took them and brought them back about 10 minutes later properly prepared. Last item to note was that we had asked for our desert "to go" as we had to get back to relieve our babysitter (the under cooked steaks resulted in us being at the restaurant about 35 minutes longer than we needed to be) and they brought the desert out on a plate. Rather than wait for them to take it back and box it, we just ate it there even though we were pretty full. Our friends Cacio e Pepe was overly peppered to the point of it being inedible. She did not mention anything to the server as she was already full. I probably would not recommend this restaurant nor do I see myself returning.

gkL_xz3KD5W9L5Ox2x0s2A.text: I love this place. Perfect spot to come to late at night. Friendly staff, always good service, great drinks and desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cappuccino
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Controne poppers -  the cauliflower dip is spicy!

CcwwKwxErPyJSA_Xf4TthA.text: I ordered the lasagna and I couldn't even eat it.  It was nothing but cheese.  Our server was kind enough to offer something different so they gave me a pasta with Bolognese.  It was also barely edible.  It had no flavor and I couldn't even identify the meat.  I will not be back unless I hear there is a new chef.

gSStsfj7pKDUmhe0TMXUFA.text: I really enjoyed the time I spent here, about 2 hours dinner with a few good friends. Food and service were excellent. Party of six, and the waiter was efficiently provide a good dining experience. Wines: Must try the Italian selection...also a large selection of California though. Food is definitely top notch: squid ink pasta (crab meat) is incredible. EVO salad is a must. Cheese board is good and nice to show. Overall, I recommend this place for good and chic Italian foody. I can't wait to comeback for other pasta dishes. Happy Dining!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheese board is impressive &amp; delish!

N3VyPuyXWZrL3QdvllTkzw.text: This is going to be short as it's a late review from my original visit. This place has amazing handmade pasta and this cheese bread for an appetizer. EVO falls under a 3 star rating based on a steak I ordered. Steak in my opinion should be the easiest thing to do on a menu for any restaurant of this caliber. Especially when they have perfected many other dishes on their menu. I ordered a rare steak with instruction to just sear each side and serve. The steak arrived and it was close to well done which may happened because the steak was thin. Which for the price you would expect a thicker size of maybe 1 inch at least which is more forgiving in over cooking. I sent my steak back as it was inedible for me. The second was more medium, but as everyone was almost done finishing their dinner, I kept it. This is what ruined the experience. My recommendation is stay away from the steak. The other items are great.

PmdHZ1-EWpLwsaL4zfN_Ng.text: This is our date night favorite.  A lively and upbeat neighborhood restaurant with the best staff in town.  Audrey always takes such great care of us and always has a smile.  The food is fantastic.  The Caesar salad is a must have, along with our favorite homemade lasagne, bolognese, spicy sausage pasta dish and the butter cake for dessert.  I highly recommend!

A9FIiKjWNsBEy7ihK35z4w.text: Love love love it here. The raviolo is the best thing on the menu as well as the focaccia and arancini. The ambiance is super dark which I really draw to whenever I go to restaurants. You also have the option to sit on the patio which is small but it's nice.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Raviolo
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mussels
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggplant

UFHg-sN2LdTIQvRW5Hax5Q.text: The Focaccia Rustica is to die. We ordered the Raviolo and didn't like it and our waitress, Chloe was so nice about it! Customer service is great here! Love love love it here.

HV7DED3PgV5SDSC2CxbD5w.text: What I'd like to refer as a hidden gem. Great cocktails and wine selection, friendly bar staff, and the food is the best part! I'd only been in for drinks before, but finally came in for dinner and it did not disappoint. The Steak Bruschetta was AMAZING. Melt in your mouth delicious! The nice part too is that they serve their menu til late into the night. Don't settle for greasy pizza or a below average taco when you get the late night hunger wave. Seriously, EVO is worth the visit.

z0xjhgaVQF1Y2MephpZN4g.text: Great food and drink menu. They are very limited, which brings out the best in their food and allows me less of a headache when deciding. The only thing wrong was the waitress got my drink order wrong. Overall, the ambience is romantic and private.

2lTpk3gwc5XVyAJwRJM9Yg.text: When Davanti Enoteca suddenly closed a couple years ago, I was very disappointed. A couple months ago, word spread that the former chef would be returning to Phoenix to take over EVO. I made it out to EVO the first chance I got, and the feeling of disappointment returned.  While Davanti was a classy space, EVO tries very hard to cater to the typical Scottsdale club set. C'mon, 1 cent Fireball shots?! Not surprisingly, the cocktails were lackluster.    I went to EVO hoping that the foccaccia di recco, a famous dish from Davanti, would be available, but apparently, only people who know the chef are privy to that. I know this for a fact because I saw someone had posted about receiving the dish on another website the exact same night we were there. The evening's disappointments continued. My husband's pork belly was overcooked and the roasted cauliflower wasn't any better than what I can do at home, but the controne poppers were very good. Spicy, deep fried pizza dough is a winner in my book. Sadly, I think this was the highlight of the meal. My husband didn't like his underseasoned steak. My linguine was boring and didn't remind me at all of the cacio e pepe dishes I've had in Italy that it modeled after. My sister and friend said the squid ink chitarra was pretty good, but they didn't like it enough to finish the dish.  We sat out on the patio to enjoy the nice weather, but we also felt overlooked by the waitstaff. I still hear people raving about their great experiences at EVO, but we didn't enjoy our visit nearly as much.

lcDMJXz6HJZz7SI19M4_1Q.text: I have had mostly good experiences at EVO and one that was very disappointing.  On several occasions, we have enjoyed either happy hour or dinner. The food is tasty and I appreciate the vegetarian options. Most of the time, the service is good. The one time exception that I have not been able to push from my memory was for a friend's birthday party. We were a party of 14 and from the beginning, the night was a mess. It took 20 minutes for our server to greet us and take our drink orders (without much of an apology.) I ordered the vegetable risotto which came out 30 minutes after everyone had received their food. I essentially ate by myself and when the house manager came over to make amends, he gave two other people refills on their drinks. It was very strange and while I have not experienced anything like that since, it bumped EVO down on my list.

_9WYhq0kHs3m6cJo7I38cA.text: Went to Evo for the first time to celebrate mine and my husband's birthdays. We had a party of 17 and they were more than accommodating. Our party very much enjoyed the atmosphere and the food/cocktails. I ordered the Chile Shrimp and was very impressed. Half of the table ordered the lobster and loved it. The interior is cute and stylish. They have their own parking lot which helps in Old Town. We will be back!!

_Ez_Np0SGwrXJKbqMpShfQ.text: The hostess offered us a friendly escort to our table for two in the corner where we were able to view the entire restaurant. The ambiance is very laid back, but warm with the fun sound of an acoustic guitarist playing the background. Tony, our awesome waiter, was quick to greet us and go over the menu with us since it was mine and the hubby's first trip here. We settled on drinks (I got a glass of Sexual Chocolate ($14) a deliciously fine blend of Zin and Syrah) and started with the Scallop Di EVO ($14), which was cooked to perfection, at least in my unprofessional opinion. The three large scallops came in a scrumptious butter sage sauce garnished with chopped up granny smith apples that just tickled my taste buds. The appetizer was devoured quickly, but we didn't have to wait long for our entrees.  I ordered the Lobster Risotto ($22) which didn't include much Lobster and the risotto needed a little help, but I know cooking Risotto can be a challenge. The hubster ordered the Roasted Chicken ($19) and enjoyed his (so did I), but we made sure to leave room for dessert. I debated between the Chocolate Torte ($6) and the Zeppolini ($6) for about five minutes and finally committed to the Zeppolini (they are small italian doughnuts) which came in a tart raspberry sauce to counter the sugary goodness of the Zeppolini (but I think I would have preferred it without the sauce or at least have it on the side).  It was a great night and we will be back. We want to try the pizza and if the other servers are anything like Tony, we will be coming back just for that aspect.

f8-E5B9lfAtscNnbW1GWvg.text: This was a very unpleasant experience. We were on a business trip in Scottsdale and looked up for an Italian place and picked this. First mistake! Should have read the reviews.  I ordered pappardelle and the server had to wait long 30 mins to let me know that they are out of noodle. So they replaced with another and food was just unbearable salty. Not only mine, my co worker's.  That is alright. I can bare that. Next is the service. Had to wait good 20-30 mins for the check. Servers were running around and would not check up on the table at all. Even for water. Had to call a random sever and point out the server to get the bill.  We were disappointed in the whole service and that is what the gratuity is for.  "Customer" pays the gratuity for value of service. I tip generously. Specially when the company is paying for it. But we decided not to tip due to the poor care.   Guess what, either the server or the management (whoever has access to it) changed the tip from 0 to $10. Saw that after reading my statement and checking the receipt. This is forgery!!

WiB7HVRMT1Hv_xlAkscBNA.text: I went to EVO in Old Town  a few times this past weekend and had a great experience!  This restaurant has a combination of excellent food, extremely friendly staff, great wine/cocktail/beer selection, and a really nice fun vibe and ambiance.    In terms of specifics my favorite appetizer was the Polpettina which is delicious meatballs served with garlic bread and tomato sauce.  They definitely don't skimp on the meatballs, and the meat was tender, perfectly cooked, and the tomato sauce and garlic bread were delicious.  The Bruschetta was also really good and it's topped with Beef Tenderloin and asparagus, and again the meat was both cooked very well and it was a very generous amount of beef.  The pizza here is also quite good.  I tried two over the past few days, the Pepperoni and the Funghi.  I love pepperoni pizza in general and this one was just done very well and it's the perfect size for either a smaller meal, or to split.  The Funghi pizza was really tasty and in a little added twist the hostess suggested adding some goat cheese to it along with the mozzeralla and that was a great addition.  The only entree I tried was the Bistecca which was a very good New York Strip with gorgonzola cheese .  The meat came out exactly as I ordered and the brussel sprouts were really good (and I'm a bit of a brussel sprout snob).  I spent most of my time at the bar and enjoyed the wines on tap, along with a very unique and creative cocktail menu.  My favorite cocktail was the El Sugararo which is both delicious and has a nice spicy bite to it.  Everyone that I saw try it really liked it.  The bartenders are all extremely friendly and fun and make you feel at home.    Overall a great experience and a very well run new restaurant!

IXalsbXO9cqf5cABnjCJTg.text: Great new addition to Old Town Scottsdale!  We stopped in for dinner last Saturday night and had a great experience.  The atmosphere is comfortable and laid back, the service was great and the food was reasonably priced and quite tasty.  We enjoyed the arancini and meatballs to start followed by the lobster risotto and capellini for our entrees.  It was great that they offered their happy hour menu in the dining room as well...total bonus!  We visited some of the other restaurants in the space prior and really hope that this one makes it...I think they've got it right!

or66ND8PrJgnqo4xJK90sQ.text: drinks are great. Just don't order food. You'll never get it.  We asked for appetizer. Came fine. Then the main course. Never came. An hour later! And then the prick at the bar chastises us like we're trying to get a meal for free.

x9nTySWq9ozlwQyTvZcD5w.text: Wine on tap? I think that's an automatic 5 stars. Went to EVO for a mid-week happy hour and was not in the least disappointed. We sat at the bar for drinks and snacks and could not have been more content with the experience.  The happy hour menu is slightly short on the edible choices for a vegetarian, but they happily made the arancini with marinara instead of meat sauce and were totally cool with splitting a pizza half meat/half veg. Our bartender was so sweet and accommodating, we even got 2 rounds of pretty addicting ciabatta and olive oil as we wrapped up our second glass of beverages. I love that the red wine is served lightly chilled, just the way I like it!  Though in a rather inconspicuous location that has been somewhat of a revolving door for restaurants in the past year or so, I truly hope EVO breaks the streak and stays for good. The low-lighting, speakeasy atmosphere is romantic and laid back at the same time. The crowd is energizing without being invasive. And being only 2 miles away, I hope to become more of a regular before EVO becomes too trendy in Old Town :)

5p0ZVgyq2mQ7G2Z4RFgTqQ.text: Had a paint nite event here, our waiter during the event was Nick & he was great. The entire staff is extremely friendly & the service was amazing. After the event we stayed for dinner. Jarness was our server, he let us know of the shrimp bruschetta special. The selection of wine was great, I enjoyed a nice glass of Rosenblum Zinfindale with the lamb chops paired with blue cheese risotto & brussel sprouts. Everything was amazing & I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Paint Nite

WhSV84qpJMjcpIXDk1w4_g.text: I come here at least once maybe twice a week. Chloe and Tony take such unbelievably great care of us. They are the reasons we come back every single week. The arancini or "balls" as I call them and the focaccia are the most amazing things on the menu. Not to mention the Evo salad if you are more health conscious. Thank you Evo for creating such a fabulous atmosphere with such amazing food. You have staffed this place correctly!

SDe_zlu4OSfiSetsG7Oq2w.text: This is by far my favorite place to hang out and eat in Old Town. The staff is amazing, the Evo Salad is unbelievable and the pasta is terrific!   Love love love Evo!

LZRxT3-PqWi1eiAIVE8iLQ.text: Unbelievable.  Everything from beginning to end. Superior service,incredible food.  This is the place to go go. My wife and I celebrated our anniversary and they made us feel extra special.  Compliments to the chef and the owner.

BySZo-hIRUXOKdOtISSk3Q.text: Saturday night at EVO was busy and loud with amazing people watching.  Interesting name, as no EVO in sight. Beet salad was good, not great. EVO salad (Brussels sprouts, fried kale) very good. Arancia (coated, fried risotto) good.  Pork belly app terrific. Pork belly risotto very tasty, but could have used more meat.  (Same risotto, by the way, as the risotto app, so no need to get both.) spicy shrimp pasta tasty, nice burn.  At 50, we clearly were 20-25 older than virtually every other diner.  Interesting place with interesting but not out standing food.  Good but not excellent service. Reasonable pricing. Too loud to be able to sit at a big table and engage in conversation.

OLNQ7OvZ6K21TOZ6k9slPA.text: I went here with a couple friends for happy hour at 5pm on a Wednesday and was pleased with the atmosphere, crowd, food but not so much the service. Its a trendy and slightly upscale place and was perfect for stopping by after a long day at work for some food and drinks. It could also be a good date night spot. We ordered off the HH menu the shrimp brushetta, Funghi Pizza, and Steak Sandwich. They were all very flavorful and well priced. Unfortunately I was driving so I didn't have anything to drink but I will say that all draft and bottled beers were $3 and their Signature Drinks were only $6 and looked amazing!    Once we were seated by our hostess we spent a lot of time waiting around for our waitress. We were seated in the bar area and even though there were very few people in the restaurant everything from our drinks to our food seemed to take way to long (20-30min). Our waitress wasn't at all attentive or at all friendly and would disappear every times we needed something.   Overall, the food and drinks for HH were good and I would return because of that and pray we get better service our next visit:)

gXFOpynN_eCjMREJqIssVg.text: Love this place!!!!! Love their roasted bone marrow!!!! Customer service is awesome and the owner, Nick, is so friendly!

L1IdvGrxb0z-hwNhpzfuhA.text: Food = Amazing Service = Amazing Owner, Nick, is so nice and attentive to everyone who walks through the door!

KHALBSnNcRHg50CtiXpkmw.text: Cannot beat their happy hour! Delicious Italianish food and a great drink menu!  The energy is upbeat and they serve food until 1:30am! No more late night jack in the box binges! :)   We went on a Sunday and got to enjoy live music and half off bottles of wine! Needless to say I will be back!

kgGide1AC4zR1NN3k33GPw.text: I think I need to try EVO again...The prices are great and for happy hour even better.  They have lots of things that look good on the menu (italian-ish menu).  All the cocktails my group had were fabulous.  The grilled brushetta is delicious, but nothing special..more traditional style, but yummy. The pizzas we had were pretty burnt and in general they just were not good.  That is what made it 3 stars for me...usually even bad pizza is kind of good.  I feel like I need to come back and try more things; many of the dishes that went by looked and smelled appetizing.  The service was outstanding, and EVO subscribes to the whole local, fresh ingredient thing which I commend.

qpSoymXpc2tDF74LUua45Q.text: Service is great and the food is amazing! Made us feel so special celebrating my sisters bachelorette!  Can't wait to come back!

nyVk5JSmboAi_IzBz40Pog.text: I couldn't decide between 3 stars and 4 stars...  so here is the breakdown and you can decide.....  The good: 1.  Excellent service by the wait staff. 2.  Reasonably priced. 3.  Great decor. 4.  Not crazy loud-- you can hear your dinner conversation. 5.  Takes reservations.  The bad: 1.  Limited menu options. 2.  Execution of food wasn't great, but not bad.  I would go back, but I can't imagine myself saying, "Wow, I am craving EVO!" anytime soon...

w7VIJXzV6ev6BD8thSzDdA.text: bad service, celebrated my friend's birthday dinner here with a group of 15. Waited for about 20 min to even get water from the server. server came back an hour later to get our food orders. Food was good

OrAR7L-fWdVnWmdAm6Xr4A.text: Got here just in time for happy hour and sat in the regular dining section, not the bar section. Loved the dim lighting and decor. Definitely a great, romantic date place. I had the grapefruit basil cocktail and he had a glass of wine. I had the bruschetta and he had the chicken sandwich with fries. The drinks were great and well priced. He loved his sandwich and the fries were delish (truffle) but my bruschetta was super disappointing. Basically slices of toasted bread with a TINY amount of diced tomatoes.  We ordered dessert (mini donuts with dipping sauce) and the literally took 25 minutes to arrive. About 10 minutes in, I saw the waiter look at us with that "whoops" look on his face, run to the kitchen, then come back to us to say "Sorry - the kitchen is really swamped tonight". Really? Pretty sure you just forgot to put the order in, buddy, which is totally fine. You ain't gotta lie to kick it.  I will be back to try other happy hour food items. Great location as it's in the heart of old town.

BW0ZvuTGJlqqnXQzqHAQzw.text: Let's support local restaurants, not chains.    Came here last night to celebrate my birthday.  I originally reserved for 24 people at 7:30, a few other people showed up, unexpectedly.      Nick, the owner, was very accommodating to my extra guests.   The whole staff did an amazing job servicing my whole party.   Being in the restaurant industry years ago, I know how complicated it is to cater a large party, on top of that-the restaurant itself was busy.   Food was excellent, wait staff was very courteous, lots of smiles, good times, and decor is cute cute cute.^_^   One of my guest said that she loved her red wine, which came from a keg-chilled.   I was slightly disappointed that they didn't offer braised Rabbit Bolognese, which i had when the restaurant first opened.  So i opt to choose the Bolognese with meatballs, every bite was orgasmic, and hearty.    The sauce was tangy which I love. I also tried their Lobster Risotto.  Risotto was cooked perfectly, the consistency of the texture sauce was spot on.  There was other great feedbacks.    I'm glad to have shared this unique Italia experience in Scottsdale with my friends.

4J1JFsYOJ0OpPI0btfbQ4w.text: We had driven by EVO a few times and finally tried it last week.  We went during happy hour and ordered based on the suggestions of our server.  Everything was awesome!  Fun drinks, AMAZING pizza, crispy chicken thigh, polpettina...all A+ Great to go to a fresh and new place that isn't a Fox restaurant.

HjSKUyC4YlyqfGPaj8OzsQ.text: 1st time here and will most definitely be back! The one complaint is that they were out of the bottle of wine we wanted, chose another and all was good in the world! The squid ink pasta....devine, mushroom pizza....fabulous....the orecchiette....superb! Joy was our server and she was GREAT.

DoeVSqnyM0wPJml8-VFeHg.text: 4 stars only because we went here on a food tour and didn't try everything :) we sampled the arancini and roasted kale and brussels salad. Totally different that any other salad, was very rich! Loved the atmosphere as well. Will be here next time we visit scottsdale for a date night! Only downside, and also why only a 4 is because the fellow who was introducing which wines we were having was a bit weak in his presentation and descriptions. Just basically said each wine would pair well in a round about way...

iXYghscZpzXfgyemuCgDAA.text: Love this place! Always great service. Food choices are limited but late night in old town looking for cozy place, this place does it!

5p1ZER39CtDjuj0PO5cfMw.text: The place is probably closer to 3.5 stars but has all the potential for 4 stars.  The service was great along with the laid back ambiance.  The server had no issues dealing with our party of 8; he was very attentive and provided helpful suggestions.  I think the restaurant would be a solid 4 stars if the prices were a little more fair, considering the portion sizes of the entrees.  I did not order a salad but had a chance to taste a couple variations, they are very tasty.  We were celebrating a friends birthday so the $0.01 fireball shots for a Yelp Check-In came in very handy for the occasion--of course fireball whiskey shots are never a good idea. Ha ha!  All the surrounding tables appeared to be having a great time, inlcuding ours.  I would like to give this place another try to see if I can be convinced to be satisfied with a 4 star rating.

0VFzxDh2ugDENqN0YT2rdg.text: We've eaten here a few times before and liked it previously. This last experience wasn't good. Don't think we'll be going back. Our server wasn't that great, had to ask for drink refills - not very attentive. Had to stop him when he was walking by rather than him checking on us. It was the night before Valentine's Day and they were obviously overwhelmed. My friends ordered the EVO salad - it had crispy brussel sprouts and kale. My friends didn't realize that the kale would be crispy - it was super dried out - it crumbled when you touched it with a fork. I asked if it mentioned that on the menu and a manager overheard me and stopped to ask if everything was ok. My friend started to relay that she knew the brussel sprouts would be crispy but - the manager cut in and said "that's kale"....ok, had she let her finish her sentence she would have said that she didn't realize that the kale would be as well. My friends asked to switch their salads for Caesars instead. The manager said "yeah, it's a love it or hate it salad" and took them away. Stopped back by the table to let us know she took care of the EVO salads - hard to relay but she was acting like she was doing us a favor. We got the charcute board - always good there. Got the raviolo for the first time and it was delicious. Then dinner. I got the Arrabiata pizza - it was cold and way too spicy. Arrabiata is spicy I get it. But it didn't really taste like anything else - just super hot. My fiance got the Amatriciana - he liked it but I honestly thought it tasted like chicken flavored ramen. Then we ordered dessert - Zeppolinis and butter cake. Almost 30 mins later, no sign of dessert. We were ready to get out of there so we just asked our server to cancel it. The response was pretty much "oh, ok" rather than checking on it or apologizing for the wait. He did obviously tell the manager though, who brought us 2 business cards with notes on them for free desserts - but again had an attitude. They were way too busy. We gave our free desserts to the next table and left. Really disappointing, this place was so good before!

dpwKAEMMrVeyo_vVyPO95A.text: We had a wonderful meal at EVO. The service was great, I enjoyed my drink (Cantaloupe Tiny) and ambiance. I had the EVO salad and ate every bite. Roasting the kale and Brussels sprouts brings out their flavor and adding goat cheese just rounded it perfectly. I had the pork belly risotto and it wasn't watery or flavorless. It was probably on the salty side but I like salty so it wasn't a problem for me, it was very good. My husband had the pasta Alfredo and enjoyed it as well. For desserts they were out of the tiramisu so we ordered the zeppolini and they were delicious. Our waiter even brought me a little side of Nutella.  They have a parking lot which is a huge plus, not having to go around looking were to park. We'll certainly come back.

cP4f00IMbpOH8QBJ3UI2lg.text: Loved the mussels and steak bruschetta! Loved the pasta!  Drank so much wine! CJ was amazing and gave me Jameson aka the whiskey love of my life. I'm coming back tomorrow, and the next day, and the next day... EVO FAN FO LIFE!!!

dp_zj8EAAZv5nzFlCJluZQ.text: Every time I come here it is more soul fillingly phenomenal than the previous. Chef Chops Smith and his aggressive respect for food is legit. Cocktails that set you straight with a balance of sweet, sour, and depth start this experience on an altitude level ready experience. Just check it.

7JGvPvBeLywahdg_LahspQ.text: I went here for dinner and the food was AWESOME! I had the chicken and my man had the steak, and we were both very happy with our meals. Try the BB & T if you like vodka tonics, it's a nice twist on the traditional drink. Shout out to our waitress Jessie, she was friendly and fast!

1_jbThilK0BHC3zOADZA7A.text: What a great experience.  Our waiter, Nick, was friendly and helpful.  The pasta was excellent and it's worth the $3 for the bread - it is toasted and comes with the most delicious pesto!  Too full for dessert, but had an excellent bottle of Malbec at a reasonable price.

JwfAdil7CZv4lgXUjt0nsQ.text: Excellent service and excellent food. Ambiance was fantastic. We were a party of 16. Food and drinks came out in a timely manner and everyone's needs were met promptly. Homemade pasta was bomb!

ZpZMwDMWkF1Q0bPSz9_W5g.text: Had the chef's special bruschetta, with a pork-tomato spread and crispy greens on top. It was really good. The breed was toasted and drizzled in olive oil. Also had the prosciutto pizza. The crust was a little too soft for me, reminded me of peter piper pizza. The ricotta spread was sort of bland and really made the crust too soft. I don't wanna use the word soggy. Had to put some red pepper flakes and parm on it to amp up the flavor. Overall the place is pretty good, just wouldn't say the food is awesome. Really nice lighting for a date and good specialty cocktail choices. Free lemoncello shot for checking in!

eVSSjmZbC2ni2Az9xgb0rg.text: Nothing beats Sundays here. Dom and Jake keep the drinks flowing and the people watching is never-ending entertainment...

qeUlhTjqeB6rBWYas13fog.text: Great service. Hostess opened the door for us, and the great service Continued throughout.  Food portion is small for the prices they charge, but food is very good. Male sure to check in for .01 fireball shot

njrdXnPjwMGVyA9eX4gH6g.text: Great food, super service.  We came in, sat down, and staff told us they had two large parties, but they would be good to us and they were.  A little bread while we waited, and yummy cocktails.  Then appetizers to die for-try the arancini!    So much food, we barely could split a pizza. Thin crust, freshly made, I was only sorry I was too full to try the pasta.   We stumbled into the place in the rain, but we will be back!

7vqMGqS4siepp9AF4c93cQ.text: I will start off with the positives. The building itself, location, and decor felt warm and trendy. It had a very "cool" feel to it.   The drinks were tasty but the amount of alcohal you got for the price didnt quite match on some of the cocktails. They are not very good at making modifications to the dinner items and they ran out of some of the stuff on the menu that night which seemed odd. The service was also very slow and sloppy in terms of knowing who ordered what and which drink had what alcohol in it. We had to do taste tests thanks to the waiter not knowing what he even had in his hands.   Overall, I was there with a larger party and the food was good for some and bad for others. The service was average and all over the place. 3 stars sounds about right.

kovgZnB0ShHsYwvmai2ssw.text: Great food, drinks, and staff. Can't believe it took me so long to get here and try the food. The charred octopus, pizza, and gnocchi were AMAZING! I will be bringing my family here as often as I can.

e3wmaF6UM77p0AGpO10m0w.text: The charcuterie was expansive but with an odd selection that was uncomplimentary to eachother. Do not order the calamari! Rubbery, fishy, lacking in flavor. The heirloom tomato and bolognese pastas were very average but of good portion sizes. The pork belly risotto had very over cooked pork belly unproportionaly small to the amount of risotto. The only above average dish was the langasto pasta which didn't feel worth the price. Clearly, most of the yelp reviews are from drunk Scottsdale club-goers.

V3EWHaWT1sEJt9tAMNsRkg.text: I am in love with this place, and I can't wait to get back to the Phoenix area to try it again.  The cocktail menu was phenomenal-- had a hard time deciding, but ordered the tasty Monroe's Mule.  My Michigan-native friend (who lives in PHX) was so excited they had Michigan Bell's Two-Hearted on tap.  Decent wine menu, BUT THE FOOOOOOD.  We started with the Focaccia (brie, mascarpone, honey) appetizer, and it was amazing.  Like roll-your-eyes-when-you-eat-it good.  I'd almost recommend it for dessert with a nice glass of rose.  I ordered the kale and brussel sprout salad, and it was huge.  It could've easily been split with another person, but I ate it up because it was crispy and delicious with the tastiest nuggets of chevre, pancetta, and pear.  Instead of an entree, I ordered the raviolo app, and I about died.  Truffled ricotta, more pancetta, and brown butter sauce-- very reminiscent of a dish I had at Mario Batali's Osteria Mozza in Los Angeles.  My daughters ordered the charred octopus & potato app and the charcuterie board, and they liked both.  The charcuterie board is HUGE-- enough for 4+ people as an app, 2+ for an entree.  I wish I remember our server's name because he was great (Ricardo maybe????)-- want to hug him for recommending the focaccia.  We ate slightly early on a Monday night (6ish?), but I was surprised at how un-busy they were.  Love that most restaurants in PHX area take reservations.  Kind of out of the way (out of sight) from downtown-- have their own parking lot which is great.  Loved the ambiance.  We were in PHX and Sedona for a week from Detroit, and it was definitely our fave meal from beginning to end.  Anyway, yes, I'm gushing because it was THAT GOOD.  I hope they do well because I want to come back!!!!

zQHzwKz2DTuT4vdSNYup0g.text: Undeniably the best service, atmosphere, and most importantly - FOOD! Coming back very soon!

2GyYF1OEbi9fd2pyeTOkQQ.text: The night we went we had a party of 12. Good lookin out on the check in offer of 25cent fireball shots. WE had the arancini, garden salad with apple vinaigrette, caesar salad add grill chicken, and the chili shrimp. ALL 3 were fantastic. The handmade pasta was beautiful buttery and al dente with a generous amount of shrimp. The table bread was beatifully craggy and had a beautiful crust. I would eat here anytime. HEY GUYS THINK ABOUT ADDING SUPPLI TO YOUR APPETIZERS.

Bwyy2aMyqnhDjmnfYXAlBQ.text: A little hard to find, but such a cute little restaurant! I've been several times, ordered both the bistecca and salmon and they have a decent selection of wine on tap. Everything was delicious, however I do wish the salmon was a little larger or that it came with a little more something on the side. The first time I ordered the bistecca it came with these delicious brussel sprouts, however about a month later when I ordered the same bistecca I was given brussel sprout flakes (????) which are not filling, kinda strange. However, the rest of the food, atmosphere, wine and staff have always made my visit good. P.S. try their little homemade donut dessert.... So yummy!!

36U4ZG8qjrdQXn43WfSDww.text: Everything we had was delicious--Bruschetta of the night, EVO salad, and pizza.  With wine on tap and excellent food and service, what more could you ask for?!

mzyDdTRY7HBOX2GE-YJ9rg.text: I would highly recommend this place! Came here last Friday and while somehow they didnt have our reservation, they were luckily able to find us a table within about 15 min. The hostess was very friendly and accommodating and apologized for the mix up. The atmosphere is very cool inside and the way it is decorated is awesome! Warning - the place is loud so dont expect a quiet dinner. It was totally fine for our group but just an FYI.  The food here is truly amazing. Everyone in our group of 8 was impressed with their food. Some of the highlights of our meal were the bolgenese, the beef heart, the pesto bread, the EVO salad, and the Oreccchiette.

UG54_sp-HfndTeVUr6zLxQ.text: Cam here for happy hour, which they have every day!! Great selection, tried a few different items and was not disappointed with anything, all very fresh tasting. They have a great drink selection as well and lots of fun drinks that taste natural and not super fake surgery like a lot of places. Can't wait to go back!

g_9JiE9XTeiVHlbiqM-MVw.text: Had a great lunch today at EVO with my 3 daughters.  Chelsie was our server and she did an amazing job!

TxLMgkpRG9aP4HVgRhSplw.text: This place is so swanky and everything tastes so good.  Love the kale salad (it's not as raw as it sounds).  Miss Jessie is a great bartender I recommend requesting her!

ggGu0w2lcKR2HYb3gGtX2w.text: Awesome food and killer drinks.  Evo's signature cocktails are put of this world and I can't get enough of the Evo Salad! Love the environment as much as the food, overall great place.

4V0cQrjxtqFl2BO_Au-_PQ.text: Very disappointed. The last time my boyfriend and I were here we had the Evo salad and the bolognese and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. Tonight's dinner was different however. Not only was the kale overcooked on the salad but the homemade pasta was stiff and lacking in flavor. I have been raving about this place and the Evo salad all week but tonight was definitely a let down. We were served our entrees before we even finished our salad and ordered a bottle of wine which we intended to have with our dinner but it too came out before we had even finished our before dinner cocktails. Not sure we will be back.

2eCSS031WXgOV6pg8fcxbw.text: Don't come hungry. The food is excellent but far too expensive for the portions. I got the "full size" Evo salad. $12 for 12 bites, no meat.  Not exaggerating.

Qzc2BGklWLRaalJoebHW9w.text: For the price point of this restaurant along with the location, there are much better options around this area.  I had the EVO salad for my appetizer, which was amazingly delicious.  I enjoyed every bite of it.  For my entree, I ordered the vegetable risotto.  The risotto tasted like Uncle Ben's white rice.  It was overcooked, mushy, and watery with absolutely no flavor.  When I complained to the server, the response was "We get that it's bland a lot."  With no apology or offer to talk to the manager.    The service was just okay.  Our server seemed to only have three tables, but rarely checked on us.  If I returned to EVO, it would be for just the EVO Salad.

q1NEQAFq9FK_qL1XSawb_Q.text: Great place! the bolognese was fabulous! the noodle was cooked to Al Dente perfection. get the house salad!!! delicious! the burrata was also very good and I love that this place is open late. the only reason it isn't 5 stars is because the service wasn't he greatest, but what else can you expect when they are working past midnight!

K0Ln9Efc2c81Az7rRK0WWg.text: Food is wonderful, but portions are small. Several alcohols we asked for weren't in stock, but the 1 cent lemoncello Yelp deal almost made up for it. I like the atmosphere, but they need a better tended bar. First time I was here our bartender was Dominic and he was awesome. Service is decent sitting at a table. Mostly just wish portions were bigger, as we were still hungry when we left.

jcMdAmPWOpOxAc2lYXUuwQ.text: The red-headed server was extremely friendly! She made out first impression (since it was our first time there) great! The bruschetta was amazing!!!! Loved it! The portions for the entrees weren't very large but just enough to fill myself... Without the appetizer we would have still been hungry. Cheers!

qwTfaSbDfpSRFtTWy9r6yA.text: We requested to sit at the outdoor patio.  It was decent.  We started with Calamari.   Don't order it.   We were served 7 small pieces and the plate was loaded with peppers.  Very skimpy portions for $13.  Other food was decent.  We then noticed a loud table  next to us, which started off with 2 people and a dog, with a bowl of water.   Shortly after, employees took turns to sit at this table,  while taking short breaks(try using a break room).  At one point, a waitress pet the dog several times, then immediately went to serve a table their food, without washing her hands.  Another employee pet same dog and walked to back of building.  Not exactly what I'd call sanitary.  We spent a good deal of money to eat here, yet your employees were careless, dirty, and very unprofessional.  I felt like I was at a fast food restaurant.  I will not be back.  Too many great restaurants in the area and no need to settle.  I hope management corrects these issues for your sake.  To be fair though, our waitress did a good job and pizza was good, which were the reasons for the 2nd star.

AACqjWjQyPhRoMI6O60_3g.text: A great place for a date or birthday dinner. Love their raspberry Moscow Mule and beer options, and love their desserts! Wish the menu had some more options for picky eaters like me but a great pick for a nice dinner.

PtJdNqBf-MXJ--AzlqShzw.text: Nice late-night destination, and a far quieter and more peaceful alternative to Mabel's.   Good appetizer menu with ok prices. Comfortable surroundings. Cool clientele.   I'll be back

7CCzeS3s4d4gdgPBhG1amA.text: This place has been my go to for years! Great service, food, and ambiance! Crafted cocktails and creative food. You can't do better than this.

qsYxpl-lQr4C-4uKHzLijA.text: Was looking for a place to hold a bachelorette pre-party dinner. So surprised at how well they accommodated our large party and special requests.   They've just remodeled their patio and it shows. It was so nice to enjoy the nice weather and, even though we were right on the street, not have to yell over passing traffic.   The inside is very chic and intimate and menu very diverse Italian cuisine. They even personified the top of the meanies with the bride-to-be's name. What a wonderful touch to make her feel even more special!  I highly recommend EVO for special occasions and large parties. The wait staff was knowledgeable and helpful answering all of our questions and dietary requests too.

6H4zf2sPQHS2YCoerOULBQ.text: Evo is the place to go! Love walking there after being at Jack's for the night. The service is always fantastic and the atmosphere is always fun no matter if it's 6pm or 12am. Highly recommend any type of pizza! I'm a crust snob and there's is perfect! Not to thick or thin! Not to crunchy and not to chewy!

hSfUgWXHLlft2bdw6zBDRw.text: I am visiting Arizona from the east coast. I have had Italian food all around the country and i am Italian . This is the best Italian food i have ever eaten and the service is outstanding !! I could not recommend this business more!!

P3hEhGshVFu5pofVXoBG6A.text: Being in the food service industry I definitely overlook things most wouldn't. I've been there on more then a few occasions after work and after tonight i won't go back!  Sat at bar the service was less then mediocre.  Our appetizer came out cold (ravioli)  sent it back it came out more then hot.. microwave?  And when a customer orders decaf coffee you give them decaf.  i clearly got 2 cups of regular because its 5 am and i am wide awake and mad as all get out.  suck service food and staff!  Never ever ever going back. so unacceptable

2JyEuNEN-192L7jGQ39UHg.text: Had high hopes for this place and left disappointed. The best thing all night was the evo salad and the focaccia bread app. If we probably ate just apps we would have been much happier. To start, they have a nice drink menu but most of the table ordered a specialty drink with basil. Waiter comes back and says they are out of basil can we get you something else. How does an Italian Resturant run out of basil??????? After waiting what seemed like an hour the apps finally came out and were awesome as stated above. About another hour went by and finally dinner came out and here came the let down. Some plates were hot, some were cold, some food was hot, and some was not (nice rhyme I know...). The bolognese was cold and tasted like tomato paste and basically no meat. The rest of the food was bland and not exciting: gnocchi, squid ink pasta, and fennel sausage. Again just ok. We then got the free desert which took about 30 minutes to bring and was ok.   All in all, just an ok place and there are much better modern Italian places here in Phoenix/Scottsdale, especially for what you are paying. Not sure how a dinner for a Resturant like this should take almost 3 hours but it did. Also, while the server was nice and friendly check up on your table once in awhile.

BBRM81ODcE6nnmb4hepntA.text: Came in on feb 9th. The bartender looked familiar but not one of the regular guys. Good flair, quick drinks, great job!

TjdF1ZWZ_Qfx6WTJiKJTyQ.text: Awesome meatballs and wedding soup. My new spot. Chelsea is great and Nick the owner has a passion for excellence!! Get in here. You won't be disappointed!! And they're about to expand their patio??? Major score!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The drink menu is to die for!!!

Ax8mlxjNYX8hMGb71Y5rCA.text: a local friend's neighborhood restaurant is one of the best I've ever experienced . Service, food and atmosphere are 5 star! Old Town rocks!

a-T0djDBLntLF_bn0BFJog.text: By far one of my favorite spots in Old Town. Nick is an awesome guy and great owner. He truly cares about his craft and the food is unbelievable. Customer service is always on point. I have been here many times with clients and not once have I had a bad experience. Highly highly recommend this place. They also serve food until 1am 7 days a week. I don't know of any other fine dining restaurant that does that.

A-ZAaWmjDA0LQjv0RdSexA.text: Went there with my best friend and sat at the bar. OUTSTANDING customer service and the pizza was great. I would defiantly recommend this place if you want something chill with great people. I will be coming back. Thanks for being so great!

nd1aizJt6y0gdD_BMOz68w.text: This is my new favorite local bar.... The staff has a great feel for each other and their customers which Makes it a really welcoming experience.

-u0QnonTuOlw4FZh2MYH7Q.text: I came here with three friends for Restaurant Week (arizonarestaurantweek.co...). I ordered the bruschetta, surf and turf (pork and scallops), and the chocolate torte. Arancini (fried risotto ball) also came as a small bite included with Restaurant Week. That was a nice touch. Bruschetta - chorizo and egg were great, but the bread was too hard. Surf and turf - pork temple and diver scallop. Scallop was cooked nicely but there was way too much salt. Pork and the sides were good. Chocolate torte - amazing! Should have saved more room for this... The service was very good. We noticed that they put a lot of effort into the presentation of the food as well. I would come back again!

QBsSo_7Jhj-eDRJwcJLvRw.text: Put on your most expensive dark wash jeans and pay homage to "so Scottsdale" at EVO, in all the best ways.  The name, combined with the upscale-casual, verging-on-tacky-but-still-posh vibes you sense upon entry should immediately tip you off. This place is Scottsdale as fuhhh, but then, the hip music selection and chic booths ease you into it, and you're like, "yeah. I can dig this."  Fast forward four and a half minutes: you're ordering bruschetta of the day (ours had pea shoots and crab), kale salad (complete with crispy brussels sprouts, pear, goat cheese, and pine nuts), and trendy thin crust pizzas. You're sipping something bubbly. Life is good.   Finish the experience full force and hop in your BMW, head back to NoSco, and watch Orange is the New Black on Tivo. Doze off peacefully on your Tempurpedic, memories of good times at EVO floating through your perfect little head.

uslzeZDUy3nOdwmeHum1RA.text: Delicious food at a reasonable price. Loved the atmosphere too! The meatballs were the best I ever had!

bxFrMHWzpx9NAFDE04jDag.text: we came back here for their happy hour specials last night. arrived at 6pm and self-seated at the bar. waited about 10 minutes, grabbed our own menus. i was getting a little peeved at having to wait for a drink. as my buddy James says "if i don't have a drink in my hand within 3 minutes, i'm outta here".   luckily, we were approached shortly thereafter by a server. when we ordered 2 reds off their tap, my heart sank when he said they were out of reds on tap. we were supposed to be meeting a few other folks, so i immediately jumped on yelp to find other wine bar happy hours. meanwhile, the wife tells our server it's her birthday and the only reason we came to evo was for the wine happy hour.   in his most pleasant voice, our server says "let me see what i can do". he returned in a few minutes with 2 pinot noirs on happy hour prices. and the remainder of the evening, he was quite possibly the sweetest, nicest server we've ever had. AND....evo must consistently hire these folks because our previous 2 visits, we experienced the same sincere and great food/drink service.   i hate i don't remember his name, but i should stop by and commend him to his manager.   we ordered a few more glasses and a funghi flatbread which was absolutely delicious by the way.   again, discount my initial frustration....evo is simply a great place.

4rsp-MuOql0FmS6vY8aRmQ.text: Our visit to evo tonight was made by our bartenders Dom and Jake. They went above and beyond to make our experience wonderful. We were indecisive on what wine we wanted and Dom was knowledgeable and helpful in our selection. So much that we started with a white wine he recommended and then ended with a red (we were only planning one having one) they were attentive and helpful without being too much. I looked for a manager to compliment these two- but I couldn't find anyone- I assume one of them might have been managing maybe and we just didn't know it... Food was great..... we will come back just to see them again. No doubt.

w0rvg950UPo2U4I8lYM4Ug.text: Great food! Great service! Such an amazing spot to hang out with friends, get a bite to eat and enjoy a drink.

kp3XRNkKOkQZ97t1VU9eag.text: Happy hour was amazing. Everything we ordered was a perfect size and tasted great. Good wines. The service was fantastic. They were very accommodating with specific orders. Definitely recommend this place!!!

Le8BRzOC2KmDK0TSwewEWw.text: Dom and Jacob remembered me after one visit, I've come back since because the service was personal and memorable. Keep it up

lu3epm6ewYLIUdaxMnDrOA.text: Hostess-Meh. She seemed to bored or disinterested in directing me to a table where my friend was. I said " I'm here to meet two people who I believe are already here" her response. "K." She didn't move an inch, God forbid smile.  Food- The kale salad was recommended as a house favorite...I HATED IT!!! The waitress asked how I liked it and I said "I'm so sorry, but I actually hate it & there's no way I can fake enjoying it or eat it." She responds with "50% love it and 50% hate it!" She asked would you like something else? I ordered the squid ink pasta which was fair, I've had way better even in Phoenix. She proceeded to leave the salad on the table the entire dinner & dessert. Perhaps a sign that you WILL be paying for that salad and I'm leaving on your table as a reminder! ??  Because they charged me for two entrees (the salad was only $13 but still, I hated it!!!) I will never go back!

O77W6XyHMscCq2ofdxvy_A.text: My husband and I were recommended EVO during our weekend stay in the Scottsdale/Phoenix area. He had the lobster and gnocchi and I had the chicken and gnocchi. We waited for a little over an hour, but we were in no rush! Just enjoying each others company with a bottle of wine. The atmosphere was interesting... dark, candles, red... but played some hip hop genre music. I mean we aren't picky by any means. Just letting you know...that you should expect to hear those kinda tunes.  Due to our meal taking so long to get to us (my husbands lobster was a bit rubbery, my chicken was a bit dry but whatevs) the manager did take off basically a dish. He did this on his own, we didnt once complain so this is why I'm giving them 4 stars because the manager actually cared and was watching his floor. Unfortunately I did not get his name. Nice guy, and apologized for the wait. It was a kind gesture and we appreciated it!

loZ31qcyVY2L_MNeC6XiUQ.text: Great place to go if you want to pay $24 for a dewars scotch on the rocks. Decent food and atmosphere but extremely overpriced.

Apbj45xtV5l1ZLLFLMmIuw.text: Good food... good service and pricing!  Especially during 4-7 happy hour! Nice seating indoors and out!   Well managed - we will return!

SuOkBuWk8lOpHOo-2ZiaCw.text: We were not greeted for at least 4 min despite the server making eye contact much earlier.  Once she acknowledged us she immediately suggested the bar.  We preferred a table so she sat us at a high top.  I asked for suggestions which she made some great ones.  She gave us water and told us our server would come. Someone else finally came much later apparently he was not supposed to be our server. From the time we were sat till we got our drinks took about 20min.   Fireballs - for a penny with check in were fairly large.   German Riesling - can't go wrong! Caprese salad - fresh and tasty Alfredo - great taste. Would have been excellent with more sauce.  Pepperoni Pizza - was very good   Food was great we finished every bite.  They lose a star because of the service. However the other server Jarness redeemed our experience.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Caprese salad
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pepperoni pizza
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Alfredo

HdL6Hku5oyKOd4M3D21wWA.text: Good but not amazing. Given how pricey the  food is, I would prefer going somewhere else if I'm ever back in the area.  I ordered the lobster pasta with basil and corn. My boyfriend ordered their steak dish. Pasta was very chewy and they are definitely generous with the lobster. Steak was a bit under seasoned in my opinion and lacked flavor, but was cooked well.
