Unfortunately I found a piece of plastic in my pasta dish, which was a bit unsettling. They immediately remade the dish for me but honestly I was too full to eat a second pasta dish and wished that they either gave me a discount or let me choose something different. Good think I had my boyfriend who managed to eat half of the second pasta so that we didn't waste it.  With the wine I ordered the bill was around $75. We definitely ate much better food for the same cost if not less in the area the ensuing days. If you are traveling and looking for a nice place to eat, I recommend checking out second story instead. It was much much better!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak - just ok...not worth it IMO
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lobster pasta - pretty good and lots of lobster!

0jmXIs5BNhDvo_BBfu3XFA.text: This past weekend I went to EVO and was pretty disappointed. I previously ate at EVO and it was amazing. Handmade pasta and very flavorful. I ordered the same exact meals this past weekend, Chile shrimp pasta and the chicken fettuccini and it was a completely different dish. The chicken was tough, almost like it was the scraps from a rotisserie chicken, the noodles did not taste handmade and the sauce on both dishes were very bland. The chili shrimp pasta wasn't even Spicy this time around. I thought this experience was very strange and disappointing. On a better note the ambiance and staff are amazing and great happy hour prices.

3hAqre3-ccOVFCYWNbOjEg.text: Let me start by saying, we ended up here by default. Went to Coach House for some cocktails, at about 9:30 we were hungry, looked up what was close by, it was The Beverly, online it said they were open till 12. We went there, they were open, but told us that the kitchen was closed. They suggested EVO, acc. to their directions it seemed a little further than we wanted to walk so we strolled up  to Scottsdale Rd, figured there had to be something open on the main drag. Again, nothing open. One of the employees from anther restaurant that was closing up also suggested EVO, so we figured well if 2 people in the biz suggest them, then maybe we should go. Absolutely delish!! I had the kale/Brussel sprout salad to start, it was very tasty, my only suggestion is maybe a little more goat cheese to balance it out a little more. Then I had the shrimp fettuccine, fresh pasta, cooked perfectly in a pesto alfredo sauce, the shrimp were overcooked and rubbery, but honestly the pasta and sauce were so good, I could have eaten another bowl of it on it's own. Ambiance is a nice relaxed intimate setting.  It's not super pricey, drinks are, but it is Scottsdale. Great for a group gathering or a date night. Most importantly their kitchen is open till 2am. Will definitely be back!!

r6ItoiJPFsnhWB6_chPVlA.text: Evo is a neat Italian influenced restaurant in the heart of old town. I felt a comfy, vibrant and cozy vibe dining here last time. There is also a twist of modern decor. Staff is extremely friendly.  The Arancini which is a fried risotto ball with meat sauce is a greater starter to any meal. Love the meat sauce. But the highly recommended starter or entree is the Evo salad. Brussel sprouts, kale, Bosc pear, chevre, pancetta, pine nuts in a sweet reduced balsamic is extraordinary. I still have dreams about this salad - which means I need to come back very soon!  I read that the wine is on tap in another review. Didn't try the last time I was there! Really looking forward to the salad, a pasta dish (since it is all homemade) or pizza and wine on tap for my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eco Salad
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Arancini

IRQuVZ8NYwx7d-yF90Xr7A.text: Went for brunch one afternoon w some friends; great staff, delicious drinks...would definitely go back! Wish I had taken a pic of the scotch drink one of the bartenders whipped up, merely at my request to try something original

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bottomless mimosa brunch
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This was a special scotch drink made for me w rhubarb bitters...absolutely to die for

Q6hDgO5irAUQfrqL6PREfw.text: Wow! We had a wonderful time at this place. The service was incredible. Everyone there was attentive and very pleasant. All four in our party loved their meals. They even gave my dad a butter cake for his birthday! Will definitely come back here.

SJqTI9P--r9Zjed0Sdn6PQ.text: So, we went to EVO several weeks ago and had a very bad experience,  after having been many times and always enjoying our evening. I left an honest review. The owner invited me and my boyfriend back and we went. The service was stellar, the food was delicious. The staff was very attentive. I will say the bad service from our previous visit was probably an aberration. Thank you for inviting us back.  It was a wonderful date night!

9keyZ1ZUp8PW-VENrtdQtQ.text: My husband Matt B. and I took a weekend trip to Phoenix, and decided we wanted some nice Italian food for our Saturday dinner. We found Evo on Yelp and managed a same-day 7:00 reservation. We were a little worried because there was a check-in special for a $0.01 fireball shot, but this proved to be at least somewhat incongruous with the restaurant.  The place was pretty classy, with nice decor, date-night lighting, and a decent crowd. We were seated near a bachelorette party, but it seemed like their first stop of the night. Our waiter was very friendly and earnest. He had the menu down pat and when I asked for recommendations, he gave detailed answers. I didn't need him to explain what squid ink pasta was, but I found his enthusiasm charming. Also, half an hour into our meal, I heard the man at the table next to us ask what kale was, and our waiter was ready.  We passed on the fireball shots (we'd actually had fireballs at a different kind of bar a few weeks earlier, and things ended poorly) and opted for a bottle of Nero d'Avola, which was good and decently priced. It went well with our meal.  We started with the charred octopus and the charcuterie board, and both were pretty great. The octopus was tender with a savory char, and it came with romesco and crispy pimento potatoes, which were lovely. The charcuterie board was definitely the centerpiece of our meal, a walloping board loaded with meat, cheese, bread, pickles, and other accompaniments. There was blackberry terrine, spicy salami, and mortadella; drunken goat cheese, Celtic cheddar, triple-creme brie, and manchego; golden raisin, fig jam, pickled okra; and on top of it all, a big split bone brimming with marrow. It was a bountiful feast, and everything on the platter was solidly tasty.  Pasta was almost overkill (in fact, our server warned us we might be getting too much food), but we went for it--we came to Evo craving pasta in the first place. Unfortunately, this course was a step down from the appetizers. I got the squid ink chittara, which sounded right up my alley--thin-cut pasta with lump crab, scallion, uni butter, Calabrian chile, and toasted breadcrumbs. None of these ingredients really stood out to me. The flavors were muted, and worse, the pasta clumped, making for gluey morsels. Matt's pappardelle was better, if not memorable, a basic plate of thick pasta with grana padano, tomato, basil, herbs, and a veal, pork, and beef ragu.  We passed on dessert and left quite full, more or less satisfied despite mediocre pastas. We enjoyed our dinner at Evo. The service and atmosphere were pleasant, and I'd recommend the place for a hearty meal centered around charcuterie and wine.

Etv2YHG_4iz_s0QYA5Ur-Q.text: Not what I was expecting. The food was bland and not much flavor for Italian dishes. The service was mediocre and not much interaction with our waitress. We asked for recommendation as it was our first time and the waitress basically said it was "modern Italian"  and didn't go into detail about what's good.  After that she came by once to check on.   Probably the biggest issues was the cigarette smoke from the outside people, waiting to be seated. You could smell it throughout the restaurant.

N_ETNHLTldwv8kWe2i4A7g.text: Way too dark for my old eyes to see the menu, and not a ton of selections, but the pizzas were good and the service (Tony) was excellent!   Wednesday special- pizza and wine for $20- can't be beat!  Not a bad place to dine, although with so many other restaurants in the area, I might not give it another try just yet.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A bit dark inside Evo.

EZeCXUhk1GEBwOgpjBe8gQ.text: Start by visiting Dominic at the bar.  Shaken with a twist, perfectly served for the spouses. Yes they have 1942, which is my first measure of any establishment.  Angela served our every need. Beginning with two orders of what they call meatballs. These delectable morsels deserve a better name, than meatball. These little yummies were Amazing! Definitely a top 5 international contender for this 3 time Elite yelper. We ordered a pizza, shrimp pasta and a pork chop. Let's start with pizza. Perfect crust, perfect toppings, (mushroom and sausage) and sooooo good. Again, pizza is a poor description of what was delivered to our table.  The pork chop was an inch thick and juicy throughout. Again perfection. On to my selection, shrimp fettuccine. The pesto leaning gravy could have been served as a soup. Awesome. Shrimp prepared as they should. Did I mention the sauce. Yummm! Donny, the manager stopped by just to say hi. Another requirement for a five star rating, just saying. The finish...butter cake. Ok you can just come for the cake. This was our second visit. We'll be back!

_wETx4Qd2KMGkfgIB0Ympg.text: We came for the Wednesday $20 bottle of wine & pizza deal. The wine was ok but the pizza was fantastic and the value unbeatable.  We also got a couple desserts that were yummy. Every thing was so good that we returned again for drinks and appetizers.  Very cool vibe, good good. What more can you ask for? Well worth checking out!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I can&#39;t remember, lemon cake I think? Recommended by the server and fantastic.
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannolis!
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pizza and wine deal on Wednesday!

mvp0BMae0Nzm66P6V4fZQw.text: Wow! Loved this place more than I remembered. Place has positive energy and a good size crowd on a Saturday night. Everything we tried was tasty.   + Focaccia rustica- this was def my fave! Warm bread filled with creamy cheese, drizzled with honey. So fab. Way better than the version at Mora. + Grilled octopus- tender, tasty + House salad- basic but the greens are fresh, dressing good, and roasted tomatoes a nice touch + EVO salad- crispy Brussels sprouts, kale, pancetta. Wouldn't call this a healthy salad, but a tasty side + Burrata- creamy goodness, exactly like you'd expect + Lobster carbonara- tender gnocchi in a rich cream sauce tossed with chunks of lobster. Bonus for the clever presentation in a cracked tail. It's really rich so I'm glad we shared. + Squid in pasta- perfectly cooked and topped with all sorts of seafood Though I didn't try the meat options, my friends said the pork belly, ribeye, and porchetta were all good   Would return!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lobster Carbonara- so rich, so good
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. House salad

93cS0s657szePIifq32b_w.text: 5 stars for food, 3 for service.   The food was great!  I got the lobster gnocchi and was pleasantly surprised to have an actual lobster appear with my meal.  I was expecting just chunks of lobster!   The meatball appetizer was very good.   Per many reviews recommendations, we ordered the brown butter cake and it was very good. Came out warm with whipped cream and strawberry. I wish it had more strawberry but it was still really good!   The wait staff were fine but not the friendliest.   I would go back!

Pk48odIoxWSEnULR7flLDw.text: I've just never had an amazing time here due to staff curtness/rudeness...or getting my drink (it's wine - write it down and you won't get it wrong the first time or on refills...) right. But the ambiance is excellent, the happy hour deals are plentiful and interesting, and they have a great patio.   Don't worry about old town parking either, since they have their own decently-sized lot right by the entrance.  All in all, I'd always keep going back because the food is excellent, but I'll always apparently end up leaving thinking what the heck!?

R-9mznzi7oA5jkuU127LOw.text: Great restaurant the only place in the old town Scottsdale you can get a for good meal that's not fast food staff is really good ambience is a grate

vPsHOGc2a8FhZrcTJ3SQNA.text: One of our go to spots for Italian comfort food.   Great wine and cocktail selection too !  Amazing happy hour specials on food and drink. Especially worth checking out for their half price wine bottles on Sunday.  Do not miss the Focaccia Rustica!! A piece of carb heaven, ( reminds me of a savory Italian quesadilla).

GbWZsi46wfkJCbcUCMk7Xg.text: I gave 3 stars for a few reasons. The first one was the music. For a trendy spot, the playlist was a mix of older music that didn't enhance my experience. The restaurant week menu looked appetizing but everything I tried was average, nothing blew my mind. The salad and bruschetta had some good flavors, the zucchini pappardelle was not what I visually expecting at all and tasted bland. The brown baby butter cake was pretty fabulous and saved my dining experience. Our server was great and very patient with my friend and I and answered all her questions. It wasn't my worst meal out but it didn't impress me enough to be back soon :(

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

F8MLOY39zFiXB8gDPsP1Ng.text: Hip and modern spot for Italian cravings. We ordered the grilled octopus and it was mouth watering. Also, the meatballs were pretty tasty too. Our favorite was the fettuccine dish. The cream sauce and all the flavors were great. Will definitely recommend this place to everyone !!

foHKQwnE1Bgod6FYnTDWow.text: Definitely one of the worst Italian meals I've had in a long time. The caesar salad was doused in garlic and cheese, but all I could taste was garlic. The bolognese was way too heavy on the sauce with overcooked pappardelle to the point that the only flavor it had was chili flakes, and the consistency was a bowl of mush. I was too hungry to bother sending it back, but the entire meal was a huge letdown.

5PiUM_WZ0sgiqZ27fFOe3w.text: We ate here for dinner before going out for a bachelorette party! We were seated outside. They have a nice patio with misters so it didn't get too hot!  We also received a complementary bottle of pink champagne from the restaurant since we were celebrating! They have a good sized menu and I couldn't complain about anything we ordered. The pasta is made in house and you can add a protein to any dish (fyi the meatballs are crazy big and oh, so good!!) i highly recommend the chicken fettuccine! I dont normally like pesto but the sauce on this is creamy and delicious. Portion sizes are really good for the prices! Dessert was also good and I recommend the butter cake- order it early ad it takes 25 minutes to cook.   Our server was amazing and very knowledgeable. He definitely made our dinner memorable!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Heirloom Tomato with meatballs
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fennel Sausage
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roasted Funghi Pizza

hTWe_Pvzot2L6v9QrwAeUQ.text: Evo has a super cute Italian / bar feel to it. I came in on a busy Friday night. The staff was super friendly, helpful and prompt.   But.... I hate to say, I didn't enjoy what I ordered all that much. The drinks were good! My friend and I both ordered raspberry mules. For dinner we started by splitting the Evo salad. It was okay, but not the lightest option. The salad is comprised of very crispy kale and fried brussel sprout shavings, accompanied by pancetta, pine nuts, and cheese. It was a little too heavy for my liking. I've actually had this salad before, and I really enjoyed it. It's almost like the brussel sprouts / kale / pancetta was too crispy and well done this time around.  We also split the chicken fettuccini entree. It was wayyyy too salty. I wanted to really like it because the underlying flavors of the pesto and cream sauce were there (and the pasta itself was amazing). I think for next time I'll try a different salad, and pasta dish. I can tell that Evo is a quality establishment, and definitely worth giving another try. I know they also have some fab happy hour deals! I'll be taking advantage of those next time I come in.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JxHkKHM_wssb228QQfu8bw.text: We came in for Happy Hour and left very happy.  We sat at the bar and was greeted by Dominic who was friendly and made good recommendations. We ordered drinks which were very good. For food we ordered the meatballs, mushroom pizza and bread with pesto. All were tasty but the pizza stole the show, yum yum. Nice size for HH with truffle oil, cheese, and mushrooms. Great food and fair prices are the winning ticket at EVO Happy Hour.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. EVO meatballs and mushroom pizza

3fC8sJTcqmmbOof-XKuKKQ.text: Really enjoyed my pasta dish at EVO. Homemade pasta FTW! Taste was 5/5. Portions were on the small side and no pre meal bread? Definitely one of the better Italian restaurants in old town Scottsdale. Walking distance to old town. Perfect spot for a date.

tT4lj5ChxHtmha0x-f3bqQ.text: My husband and I are obsessed with this place!!! We came for vacation to Scottsdale and I just happen to stumble on this place on Open table reservations and are we so happy we did! Not only were the hostess so incredibly wonderful- and they got us a booth as I'm 8months pregnant and my back was killing me. So thoughtful of them ( thanks ladies!) I didn't even have to ask, but they made sure we got it! Then the food- to die for. My husband had the squid ink pasta.. he kept saying "wow this is so good" " so good" with every bite he took. As for me I can't remember the name but it was spaghetti with red sauce and the flavors were exploding in my mouth! Yummmy!!!! Then last but not least- the brown baby cake for dessert.. it's been a week and we still can't stop talking about it! I wish we could go back to AZ just so we can have this experience all over again. Do not miss out on going here! A+

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Squid ink pasta
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brown baby cake

KEleehXBnyRna3q6xO6d8w.text: Food itself deserves five stars but service deserves a 3.   Food: Amazing. The focaccia rustica is so sweet and light and it's the perfect appetizer, and it won't get you too full before your entree. Scallops are amazing and the risotto that comes with it is so yummy. Every time we come here we're amazed by the food.  Service: Unfortunately, the service gets worse and worse every time we come in. This time, we waited 20 minutes before our server, Caitlyn, even greeted us at the table, and there was only two other tables in the dining room. It took a long time to get our drinks too. Finally when they came, (I ordered hot tea) she brought out a box of tea for me to choose from. After I chose my tea, she literally just left the big box of tea just sitting there on our table for half of our evening. No one came by to pick it up to put it back in the server's station where it belonged, until it was almost time for our entrees. It was kinda awkward. She also gave us the wrong wine. We tried getting her attention so we could get the right one, but she didn't come by for a long time. We tried getting her attention as she would walk back and forth in front of us, but no luck. Finally we thought it just wasn't worth it anymore, because even if we got her attention and told her it was the wrong wine, we would have to wait and extra 10+ minutes to get it, so we just stopped trying. Our visits before this have been similar (long time waiting to be greeted, long time waiting for drinks), but this time was kinda bad. We LOVE the food, but are so torn because the service is not prioritized at EVO. It might be awhile until we come back, which sucks because the food is so good.

AIH1OlNT40aw89rbtAscuA.text: We had a less than acceptable experience at EVO on 7/20/19.  We'd been there before and had great dining experiences on all of our previous visits.  This one, not so much.  Our experience started off on the wrong foot when we walked in.  We had 6:30 reservations for a table for four.  When we checked in, we were told that our table was ready, but because they were busy that night, we'd need to vacate the table by 8 PM.  What kind of a restaurant greets people like that?  We objected and were seated at a different table that had no such time restriction.  So we thought that the worst was behind us now that we were no longer under pressure to be done in 90 minutes,  Unfortunately, we had several other misses.  Our waiter was not as attentive as we think he should have been.  He did not follow up to offer us additional drinks, and was late to check in on us after the meal was served.  One of our party asked for her meal to be made without red pepper flakes.  The kitchen either didn't get the request or erred in preparing the meal.  When our dining companion discovered the miss, it took too long for the waiter to get back to the table to make sure that our meals were tasty.  The waiter did offer to either prepare a new meal or attempt to tone down the spice.  Given the time lapse between serving the meal and checking up on us, our dining companion opted to have the dish modified a bit to avoid waiting another 15 minutes or so for a new meal.  Unfortunately, it didn't work out so well.  Her meal was still too spicy for her.  Finally, we had a $20 off mailer that we presented with the bill.  When we got the check back, the $20 was not taken off of the bill.  We brought that error to our server's attention, and he corrected it.  I will say that to the restaurant's credit, the other three meals and the dessert were great.  Unfortunately, the service aspect and the one meal tainted our experience.

GFnZlXrB5ZKVRYD7mbTtBw.text: Nice modern upscale Italian dining in Scottsdale Arizona.  Calamari was a bit dry, the meatball appetizers were fantastic.  The Evo salad was huge... The cast-iron lasagna was very good, however, was overcooked a little hard and burnt.

J2dGxu9MNBDvnNl-We4V3g.text: Food was only okay in my opinion, but decent prices. Good ambiance but too crowded and loud, we couldn't have a conversation.

fFHToFzN9zk2WpzfzG2kSA.text: Ambiance was very nice, our waitress was great, Very fun and bubbly personality for being so late (12am).

Baib8kzIb3vPW7HKk13v4g.text: Just had my birthday here last night and it was great! Food was amazing and with twelve people they were able to split the checks no hassle. Would absolutely come back here!

eLQ86t19mr507xbxGT2j4A.text: We visited EVO while on a weekend trip to Scottsdale that happened to be during a period of perfect 80 degree weather, as a result our experience was based on their small but cute patio.     Atmosphere: Evo provides delicious Italian dining in a non-pretentious atmosphere, overall the decor is  fairly modern and does a good job of pulling in local materials.  While the patio is small so I would suggest reservations specifying outdoor seating if that is what you prefer.  The patio does not have much in the way of shade but did appear to have water misters for hotter times, that said it really starts to shine and have charm once the sun goes down and the strings of outdoor lights come on and compliment the blue glow from the patio's rock walls.  The location is on the edge of Old Scottsdale and is on a fairly busy street so there is a lot of traffic; however, it is great to have the view of the sun setting behind Camelback as you dine!  Service: Service was excellent, Kaitlynn was attentive and clearly was paying attention to details.  We found ourselves unable to finish the meal and Kaitlynn boxed our food for us and labeled each box with the contents and date (an extra detail I always appreciate!).  Food: We started with the Pork Belly appetizer which was delicious and well constructed...honestly I could have happily made a meal of that alone!  For mains we tried the Chicken Picatta and my Fiancee had the Bolognese.  Both entrees were delicious and were well portioned, neither of us felt like we had massive plates but there was certainly not a lack of food.  The sauce for the chicken Picatta was creamy and fairly garlic forward without being overwhelming, personally I prefer a bit more lemon flavor in my Picatta but that is a personal preference.    Drinks: We stuck to a bottle of Reisling for this meal, the bottle prices are reasonable and in line with what we would expect.  The wine was served chilled in a bucket of ice.    Overall we had a great experience and would happily return next time we are in Scottsdale!

6saIsApqumAIc2AY-j4RGg.text: I saw all the good reviews so decided to try it. So very disappointed. My salad was drenched in salad dressing. So much so I wasn't able to eat it. Waiter never offered to bring another salad or to take it off the bill. Three of us had pasta dishes and the pasta was over cooked. The bread they served was thinly sliced and dried out. The service was equally as inadequate. Too many great restaurants in town to settle for mediocrity.

qhWdDyzbR1I2a41lCJUvIA.text: Ask for Tony.  He rocks.  The food is amazing.  This is the place to just ask for what they recommend.  Blueberry cocktails are awesome.  The dessert martinis are out of this world.  Super awesome experience.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cesar and meatballs.  Yum
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great atmosphere
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hg_EE8K27FLF1uebeSin9g.text: Oh where to start...the ambience was nice and the staff was pleasant and informative. I ordered the Pappardelle. The menu described a pork, veal and beef ragu but I could encompass the total amount of meat between a circle formed by my thumb and my forefinger aka a small amount of meat. Even if the meat was not the star of the dish, which I understand, c ' mon! Their margins must be good on this dish...bravo. I will admit that the pasta was cooked well but the sauce lacked salt. EVO deserves a honest 3 stars.

lnPPdaEq50enqelaABCl7A.text: I absolutely love this place! One of my favorite little spots for happy hour after work.  My personal favorite is the Steak Brushetta,  a must try.  On Wednesdays they also have pizza and a bottle of wine for $20, definitely can't beat that!

GiHzJwfmp0ZAzCGDnCeJCA.text: This is my third time dining at this restaurant. The food is fabulous but what keeps me coming back is the exceptional service. We came in this Sunday evening and it was very cold outside. The manager was extremely accommodating to not only my boyfriend and I but our service dog as well and suggested we come inside. We will be back again soon.

xxwf3kBxwAzgR_pGmnOarg.text: I love the atmosphere here! It's a great place to grab a drink and the staff is friendly and helpful.  I recently went here for an event so I got to try a couple different menu items. The EVO salad is good for something different, but pretty rich. I really liked their pizza- it was simple and delicious.

cr2jmwMeRSeEX4g4DbBFmA.text: I went there for the new year's eve dinner, $55/person. The food was pretty decent, including the dessert. I especially liked the spicy squid ink tagliatelle with mussels & shrimp. The noise level in the restaurant was very high with diners laughing & shouting, we could hardly have conversation - but it was NYE, so I shall not complain about that. So, why am I giving the least number of stars? The server (a tall Brunette female). I noticed that she started having an attitude after finding out that we were not going to order any alcohol. And when I gave her $120 cash for a bill of $118.72, she decided to keep the change and when I asked for it, she said "it's only a dollar and change" and shrugged her shoulders. Mind you, she DID get tipped decently ($20) in addition to the change I was supposed to receive. I decided not to crate a scene & embarrass my company (and myself) in front of the cloud, so I just walked out after letting her know about the chair (the one I was seated on) falling apart (I am only about 180lbs so it was not me that destroyed the chair bottom). The otherwise decent NYE dinner experience was ruined by this snobby & inconsiderate waiting staff.Therefore, I just cannot recommend EVO to anyone.

CLWYBELLVSN0tKUOXkVeTA.text: Homemade Italian food just like Mom used to make. Had the arancini and it was delicious! Highly recommend Evo! Fun atmosphere! The music was great too!

ueJZNb0ad8Aux92h8JP5iA.text: Great food! Came for happy hour and split the meatballs, aracinis, evo salad and evo burger. They were all great! The server, also bartender was amazing. She made great recommendations and was very personable. We will be back to try more of the dinner menu.

hSz5AvwtMfUIAjjaTvxtNA.text: Tony is a great waiter! Very personable, knew the menu; great customer service. One of the best waiters we ever had!

QerKwhOhoisX_mUglUXmIQ.text: Solid late night food, solid service, good tv's.  We stopped in for a bite.. Bartenders could not have been nicer. Informative and seemed like regular guys.  Tried a pasta and pizza.. Both came out hot and tasty.  I will go back to check out the happy hour...

vURwo4kHMGZ-cFW6Aar9KQ.text: I went to EVO for Happy Hour, and this place was awesome. One of the better places I have gone for Happy Hour to in a long time. From the gorgeous greeters to the helpful bartenders I thoroughly enjoyed my visit.   Ambiance. This place is bigger than expected. They have a restaurant section, and then a bar with booths and a nice open "loungier" area by the windows. Very nice for mingle activities. I was only here a Friday for Happy Hour, it will be really interesting to see how it develops into the wee hours of the night, and how the clientele changes.  Drinks They have a decent Happy Hour menu that I was very tempted by, but I had dinner reservations so I kept my HH all wet. This being said, they have stuff like Nitro Milk Stout from Left Hand Brewing Company and that is awesome in itself. Nice selection of wine too.  I will definitely come back to EVO.. as soon as possible!!!

IybJDsO2gFtMo3TOkr4Asw.text: This is one of those places that thinks it's being cute or hip to not have traditional salt and pepper shakers on the table.  I don't care if others don't use them but I do so they located some for me.  And bread with your salad or meal? Heavens,  like the salt and pepper,  who ever heard of such a thing?  OK, they'll sell you a couple of slices of toast.  The "music" was bad but they made up for it by having it loud.   That night it was very noisy in there and I couldn't hear myself complain.  The food was just so-so.

2li90O5pcVJGeyQYkzM0FQ.text: Be sure to check in to get a fireball shot for just a penny!  Went here on Halloween to try it out and was very pleased with the food. I ordered the bolognese and before I knew it I had scraped my plate clean. My girlfriend had the fried kale salad and loved it but her pears tasted a bit like cleaning product which the server attributed to mixing with balsamic and whatever else was in the salad. It didn't change the flavor of the salad, just a bit confusing when eating the pears within it.  I can't wait to go back and try the pizza, it looked extremely delicious!

iWzjXGKXWDE3Bu8E933lXQ.text: Amazing food. The service was terrific and the good was innovative. I am looking forward to go back!

bFrSOkBwG-WttnYouu3GUQ.text: Evo seems like a really good birthday spot. The menu was a little limited in my opinion and not being a very big pasta person limited my options even further. I had the daily bruschetta and the octopus antipasti. The octopus was cooked perfectly and really delicious but it was an app portion. Overall I wasn't super impressed with the food and thought it was overpriced but the service was excellent and for that reason I was pleased with my experience.

1fP7irXTXrtnen7Ttn6yUw.text: Excellent food and great for a late night meal.  Everything was on point.  The industry crowd likes to come in around midnight so its a good mix of people. Some of the standouts were the ravioli and the squid ink uni pasta.  Bone marrow was also really good.  Overall a great meal.

BdxndvEuvXEn8Rpdv9CseA.text: Had a fantastic experience at EVO'S tonight.  CJ was an outstanding server.  Next time you are in Scottsdale this place is a must!

OdoDdaytR-ZwttqmcgRV3Q.text: The roasted mushroom pizza is amazing! Also, try the steak bruschetta. Josh and Ben were great, very attentive and nice. All around a great experience.

qe61o2c167I54ZUhQJkpdA.text: I love the crispy chicken thigh! Stop changing the duck gravy recipe and don't take out the honey! A little more consistency would go a long way.

YYDF_gz-wY9PQAs0VkCoKg.text: The Focaccia Rustica alone is worth it! Great ambience and the service was wonderful. Definitely will be back.

k81KfbekmHKEMSTWyM2pGg.text: When we walked in we weren't really expecting much; it looked like a typical pizzeria.  But when the food arrived, our minds were changed.  The lasagne was excellent; the lobster carbonara was quite good and worth trying, but wasn't as good a value as the lasagna.  Don't be put off by appearances.

iJzW0eEGphv1w39PZZ89lA.text: I love this place. It is in my top five in oldtown. Great solo, for a date, or for a group. The pasta sauces are unctuous, tasting better than a pasta sauce has any right to taste, especially their red sauces. The charcuterie is fantastic. The bartenders are fun and attentive and make you feel like family. The crowd is beautiful and the bar area almost always full. I've even seen two food network stars eating in here. Beau MacMillan and Troy Johnson. If you haven't checked it out, do it!

afSJoeCa63vklADE3Rt2gA.text: I came here for a late night dinner with my sister on my last visit to Scottsdale. First off, the ambiance is cool. It's dark and has very chic decor.   I ordered the wine they had on tap that day which was really good. I would recommend getting (or at least trying) what they have on tap. There aren't very many places that do it! For food, we got the cheese board (which is gigantic and full of amazing meats and cheeses). We also shared the focaccia which was nothing short of AMAZING. It had mascarpone cheese on top and was drizzled with honey. Need I say more?  We each ordered a different pasta dish and ended up sharing. Everything was SO good! Our server was great and very friendly. He made some great wine recommendations for us and quickly cleared our table of the seemingly endless parade of dishes we went through that night. This is a restaurant I will request to visit again on my next trip to Scottsdale.

tTnDXnw8CZPRrTYIwYrdLw.text: Only thing good here was the Ceasar salad. Over priced and disappointed. We ordered the chicken piccata and the lobster gnocchi. The lobster gnocchi came out dry and over powered with butter. And I love butter my motto is everything is better with butter. The service is sub par. Slow service and follow up. We are disappointed in our choice and money spent. We will not be back.

TJJEJQWtrxor6aN7iqaJjA.text: Fun dinner and great service in the bar area. The food was great - something for everyone. Enjoy the lemon cello with your Yelp check in.

rJl86zQENPrmW4MVnJAG9Q.text: What happened here?  Hadn't been there for a couple months, and could not believe how ordinary the food had become.  The meatballs, once the best I'd had anywhere, were now just meatballs.  Watery, bland sauces.  Too salty. Even the server was sub-par. Eventually, I was able to get her to admit that they'd replaced the chef.  I guess owners wanted the place to be below average, not brilliant.  It worked.  Fools.

s7Jpzs8I9DzdaZLaum0clg.text: The music is amazing, love the 2000s hip hop & rnb drinks are strong which is great. Audrey was so much fun!

GUOGxDzUZ4poV2DKtLvtBw.text: I'm very torn between giving this place a 3 star or a 4 star. =/  The first time I came here was for a Yelp event Lindsey put together last year. It was amazing and everything was perfect. So my friend wanted to go to dinner, and I wanted to find a place that had happy hour on Sundays. This place has happy hour every day from 4-7. Perfect right?  They also have live music after 8 pm on Sundays too. Plus I've been here before and after such a good experience, sold!   So for drinks, I wanted the Canteloupe Tini, it was amazing the first time. They didn't have it! What!? First fail. =/ So I got a Cosmo. Definitely got my money's worth on that. Ok for food, they had the house made pasta on the list. They didn't have it! What!? That's two for two. So I ordered the Funghi pizza. This comes with mushrooms, mozarella, tomato sauce, pecorino - herbs. Our waiter, (Tony) suggested I added duck to it. And it tasted amazing.   I'm torn between the 3 or 4 star because how can you not have both of these items on the menu? But, Tony our server was amazing. He was so knowledgeable of everything on the menu. & I pretty much ordered everything he suggested. You're getting a 4 star Evo. Thank Tony! =P

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cosmo
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Funghi pizza with duck

NPZ-o0iCB4_dOImfM-SKeQ.text: The service here was awesome and they had the best homemade noodles the also have these cool glowing purple rocks, obviously the color of Italy.  Lasagna was interesting with a little balsamic drizzle.  Have outdoor seating and a happy hour specials on Monday and Wednesday.  And, btw, nothing says Italian like Pitbull playing.  (Kids and groups welcome)

tQySi03fISfo1q0Mw0qjWg.text: This used to be one of my favorite restaurants. It's just not up to par on my last two visits. Last visit the chicken piccata was seriously bland. No flavor at all and pasta was very over cooked. This visit no offer for grated Parmesan cheese. Everyplace offers that and comes to the table and hand grates it. We had to ask and then they brought a shaker that looked like Kraft Parmesan in the green canisters. A lot of little things that just didn't add up for a restaurant of this caliber and this expense.

CeL8TMdKht8r15KKKWbrCA.text: We stumbled upon this restaurant during a weekend bachelorette getaway from Las Vegas. Our group of 10 girls were treated exceptionally well, even complimentary rose! The food was beyond amazing - it was the talk of the next day, and we even considered dinner there a second night. The whole staff from bartender to waitress to bussers to the manager were so gracious and accommodating. Can't wait to return!! My new favorite eatery in Scottsdale.

1WleTABqK4GHoFZfDkqoSQ.text: Delicious Lobstor Carbonara ,wow!!! Incredible freindly staff , comfortable seating, highest recommend

r9Gp_j1EbytgE6BTSYx-Mg.text: Evo, how i so longed to experience you, You let me down Service was wonderful  Unfortunately the food was below subpar  Excruciatingly small portions of barely edible food  How can you have such great reviews if your food is so terrible My boyfriend and I had a late date night here , i was craving a new experience We ordered a pizza, angel hair bolognaiss and calamarie with a spicy arabitta sauce The pizza claims to be 12 inches unfortunately this is not so it is 10 inches at most  including crust! The angel hair bologness,  the waiter comes out and says we do not have angel hair pasta, my boyfriend asks what are your pastas then? ,Uh i dont know let me check , we have spaghetti  Ok, well do that , When the plate arrives it is to very small and the noodles are not spaghetti, it is over done freeze dried ramen with a very bland watery sauce The calamarie, small portion chewy with a sauce made up of nothing but water with a little tomato paste , you clain to be True italian food No, this place is not authentic italian food, Shame on you  I do not know how you can call what we had food, nor how you can serve it, I am sorry we had to pay for a poor evening out  Perhaps we ordered the wrong things i would like to know what makes it so great, it cant be the food so what is it? Be known this review should be one star however because the service was good its getting two stars although it should only be one point 5 but yelp will not allow half stars *this review has nothing to do with our server,despite a little rocky he was great*

CPGs5kmuJM-LCY8STqCTOw.text: After reading rave reviews about this place on Yelp and on TripAdvisor, my mom and I decided we wanted to give it a try. It doesn't look like much from the street, but the parking lot was packed at 7pm on a Thursday. We had made a reservation earlier that day on OpenTable and we were shown to a table right away.  The ambience is romantic but also casual. It's a little bit louder than average, but part of that is because it features some open patio seating and you can hear a little bit of outside Scottsdale through the open patio doors.  We had the Lobster Carbonara and Roasted Funghi pizza. They were both AMAZING. We almost licked both plates clean. We went ahead and also got the Brown Butter Babycake. It takes 25minutes to prepare, but it was so amazing. The outside is crunchy but the inside is perfectly chewy-gooey.   And the price is much cheaper than I would've expected for such exceptional food. Definitely recommend this gem!

O1ekPsGDtcxv_PPPMohBdg.text: The Brussels sprout salad was amazing! I added chicken to it, but the chicken came out undercooked. I raised the issue to the manager and they removed it from my ticket. Pizza was great!

b0gTGTQTIBP3MtEu-eS2uw.text: Not cool! - No mention on their site that the pizza was "personal" sized (Tiny). Pizza was basically bread with a couple tomatoes and a little balsamic. Can't believe I paid for this.- GrubBub driver was 45 min late and I had to walk 10 minutes to meet the driver. Worst part... still starving!

UQ7SowlQoIAY30HRpT0TgQ.text: Appetizers and entrees delivered at the same time. Starter salad had zero dressing on it. Entrees were Luke warm. Had to wait for plates and settings even after food was served. Server seemed very anxious.  Brought me a drink that i never ordered. Checked on us once right after the food was brought and then not again until we asked for the check. Pasta was grainy. Only good thing was the burnout on the rocks.

fDplLLp16m27dDQkNOVKHA.text: Ambiance was great, service and food were weird, something had to be going on, because we had about 5 servers ask us if we were "already being taken care of" and the "hostess" when we came in asked us to take a seat on the couches when we arrived so they could clear a table for us, and I'm not even kidding 15 mins later the same hostess comes over and asked us if we were "waiting" for something.... we were able to see the table they were clearing for us, from where we were sitting and ive never seen a table turn around take that long, the food was subpar for the price, there are definitely better places to go in the area, the margarita pizza was one of the best ive had, that being said- I dont know how you can mess up a rib eye...

cTOvUVxyXHymxOp022edoQ.text: Dined here on a Sunday night.  Service was poor.  Appetizers- meatballs were good.  Focaccia was too sweet.  I did not enjoy it.  House salad was full of onion.  Felt like I was eating an onion salad.  Two members of group had Bolognese pasta / small portion and pasta was doughy.  One person had chicken Marsala which was ok.    I would never go back here.  Plenty of better choices.  STAY AWAY

4-r50U0GjAYciqoN-XEJ0Q.text: I came here craving pasta with my boyfriend. I found this place online, saw "squid ink chitarra," and changed my dinner plans. I obviously ordered that while my boyfriend ordered Bolognese. Both dishes were soooooo delicious. I prefer authentic Italian, not our American version but don't really get to go out for that cuisine. So this was heaven to me.  I'm not a local, but can't wait to come back for this place.  Side note: probably shouldn't go for sangria. It's mediocre according to my boyfriend. He says Aldi's Winkling Owl Sangria is better/worth your money.

fd8BUy9X9e9d3vpgD_KVCA.text: Need a spot that serves quality food and is open late? Look no further. Evo is a great option for dinner before a night out in old town. Or if you're like me, when you get bored at a club and would rather be eating! Dinner is served until 2 a.m.   Carpaccio is one of my favorite appetizers. EVO's Steak Bruschetta comes with Tenderloin carpaccio, creme de brie, grilled asparagus and truffle oil. The creamy creme de brie pairs perfectly with the carpaccio.   The Cast Iron Lasagna is homemade pasta layered with mozzarella, starcciatella, bolognese, Parmesan and herbs. The pasta was good, but was too thick for my personal taste. Other than that, no complaints!   Calling all meat lovers! The Salumaria Pizza is topped with pepperoni, sausage and spicy salami. I wasn't able to finish the pizza, the leftovers made a great lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salumaria Pizza
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak Bruschetta - a must have!
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. EVO Lasagna

5gwrtqlvNBrGNVeTGKcJFQ.text: The best late night food in scottsdale.   The pan seared shrimp is unreal.  This is coming from a soon to be elite yelper so it's legit.

gLtHLi_8OhNd9IaM0L0QHg.text: Open late night, and last night they had an awesome special, order a bottle of wine get a free pizza! Say what! Service was great, the food was deeeeelish and the wine was awesome. Great lowkey atmosphere with a great vibe and aesthetic! The lobster Carbonara and Margherita pizza were so good (little heavy on the balsamic on the pizza so if that's not your thing ask without or on the side).

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Margherita Pizza
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lobster Carbonara

dAU0DY-58A7pMtFfFZdfMg.text: Tough night at  Evo. The place was extremely noisy even at 6. Service was slowwww, very slowww. Now the appetizers were good but entree size, one would have served our table of 4.  Two of the meals were not very acceptable, the Bolonese was not edable, rice balls were just ok, the lobster was tasty.. Now after very slow service they told us we Must Change Tables after 1:30 hours, WHAT?  How offensive.  This is not a 4 star restaurant. 3 stars is a gift..

rBIafkHU899WKJuYa3VBJw.text: Loud loud loud loud! Food was delicious,  our service was meh. There was 3 huge bachelorette parties going on, which we found out was a normal thing. Go during non peak if you don't want to scream at each other. Apps were delicious, entrees were good sized.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Decibel level
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ambiance

Sl1uc2L2iGBZKfW1MwI4hg.text: Great restaurant! We tried the EVO burger and the Roasted Fungi pizza. Both are great! Also, the happy hour size is actually pretty large.

jhor-NVbwfQ60qom74Ug9w.text: One of the few spots in the Phoenix area that stays open late on a Sunday evening offering a full menu. Place was lively with people at the bar on dates and even had people on the patio enjoying each other's company. Great vibes for sure. I am fortunate enough to have stumbled upon this Italian eatery this past weekend. Service and entrees were at a 4 star level for sure. The bolognese I ordered had great flavor and I ordered meatballs with it just for extra meat to go with it. The dessert was definitely a 5 as the Brown Butter Babycake was one of the best desserts I have ever had, I could probably eat two by myself.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brown Butter Babycake
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. EVO Lasagna
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Picatta

jW7N_2yCf6HzUyOa64gdkw.text: I came here with a group of close friends to celebrate my best friends birthday. We called to RSVP but wanted to sit outside since the weather was beautiful and asked if there were heaters so when it got chilly at night. They said yes.   We got seated for our table and ordered drinks and our meals. I ordered an extra dirty martini and zucchini noodle dish. I asked to switch the  pomodoro sauce to the alfredo garlic brussel sauce but was told it would be a $4 up charge to do that, so I kept the pomodoro. Very unnecessary.   Needless to say, the zucchini noodle and extra dirty martini were delicious. Loved the whole mushrooms in the dish!   A couple of my friends had the chicken fettuccine dish and it looked yummy and they said they'd come back for it again.   We told our server it was our friends birthday and to bring out a dessert and she dragged so much that we almost left right before she brought it. She also put everyone's meals on one receipt (8 people) even though she was marking who got what and where we were sitting.  The night started getting chilly, even with a light coat on, so we asked them to turn on the two heaters next to the sides of our table. One didn't work, the other only worked for 5 minutes. So much for asking ahead of time if they had decent working heaters.   It's a fun and beautiful restaurant. I would definitely come back but sit inside.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Fettuccine // Extra Dirty Martini
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Zucchini Noodle- very good
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Zucchini Noodle

QC0l92wyPnh6_YxusBNG2w.text: Romantic setting inside. Nice priced happy hour menu. Ordered the calamari and the meatballs for appetizer. The calamari was plated beautifully but had zero flavor and was difficult to eat. The meatball texture tasted wonderful but had an inconsistent texture. We split the squid ink chittara and it was wonderful. A lot of garlic! The service was not great. We weren't checked on or asked if we wanted anything else. I would not go back. Too overpriced for sub par food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wQrJdL2s8xAY8dopSVAUsA.text: First time eating at Evo. We had the Zucchini and later at the Dave Matthews concert we started talking about how good dinner was as well as pointing out how Tim Reynolds looks like an alien. Later in an Uber I suggested the Uber goes and tries it. At 3 in the morning in the ER after a scooter accident we agteed, well at least that dinner was great! Now it is 11:27 AM and all I'm doing is thinking about the food at Evo. I never write review but this place deserved it.

AyBtDSugPbI6lWuJYePCIQ.text: One of my fave spots in the valley! Not your typical Old Town place, this is somewhat of a hidden gem, set away from the main strip of everything. Food is consistently amazing, vibe is really cool, prices are reasonable, and the kitchen is open late (midnight or later).  We usually end up ordering way too much food and sharing the plates. The great thing about Italian food is it's sometimes even better as leftovers :) For apps, you can't go wrong with the focaccia rustica or meatballs. The focaccia is something truly unique to EVO, and I love the meatballs so much that I've actually ordered them as an entree! The lasagna is always my go-to dinner, but the lobster gnocchi is out of this world as well. To end your evening, you absolutely have to order the brown butter cake. So simple but divine!  I always bring out of town guests here, and this is one of my favorite spots to celebrate an occasion of any type.

06wMhCtmMju4julVeGmNfQ.text: I spent a week celebrating the start of the holidays with my family in Old Town Scottsdale, and we tried a number of restaurants during our time together. EVO, without a doubt, takes the brown butter baby cake and stands out among the rest.   The hostess sat us ahead of our reservation time, and we soon met our awesome waitress, Audrey. The restaurant was completely full on a weekend night, but Audrey anticipated our needs like new glasses of wine, the speed to bring out our courses, and after dinner drinks like a pro.   We started with an appetizer with bread, goat cheese, and pesto, and it was so tasty. I knew as soon as I spread the pesto and cheese mix onto the perfectly toasted bread that this place was going to be legit. The beet salad was so tasty and fresh (although the pretty slate cheese board plate was a bit odd to navigate a salad on).   I enjoyed the eggplant ragout for my main course, although I wished the eggplant was sliced a bit thiner to get a nicer crisp to it. My relatives loved their lasagna and chicken scallopini milanese. Our only wish was for free bread with our main course, which I found it odd that the restaurant does not offer as an Italian place.   But back to that brown butter baby cake: Order it when you order your main course, and you will be treated to the most outstanding dessert in  Scottsdale. It was pure perfection.   EVO was a treat, and it will be my first stop on my future visits to Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing appetizer of pesto, bread, and cheese
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roasted Beets salad
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lasagna

8w_7iX0XRRUwRJO4QM_yLA.text: Nice place friendly staff. We were there with quite a large group and management made the extra effort to see we were taken care of.

QBy_A3OYt7GfbFcZAM2OXg.text: The boy toy and I stopped in for a quick drink and we decided to try the arancini and it was perfectly made; crispy on the outside and the risotto inside was cooked perfect. We followed it up with their homemade, yes homemade limoncello and it was the best I've had in a long time (and I make my own)

Twc1Bv6lV8XyKmBLn4a0ug.text: I love EVO we go every few months and it had been a too long.   Food was amazing as always, the dessert .. just order the butter cake  and thank me later. There are not enough characters here to explain it.   My only complaint is they changed the EVO Salad.   Much smaller now and seemed like they batch made them.   Our joke with friends is order the EVO salad for starters, an EVO salad as a main then try the EVO salad as dessert. Amazing.   This time was a bit off - the portions were in much smaller bowls which made it much harder to mix and unfortunately two or those at our table had tons of cheese and apples and balsamic. I had just one small piece of cheese, one tiny piece of apple and my salad was nearly dry. Other person at the table had cheese, no apples, and was dry. We ordered extra balsamic - but in the end I wish we had sent them back. It just was meh at best.   Also the kale/brussel ratio was a lot different - usually 50/50 now 80%+ kale.   The two others raved about the salad - except it was impossible to mix.   I will be back, maybe it was an off night and someone dropped all the salad bowls and broke them and the brussel sprouts, cheese and apples revolted against the smaller bowls.   All in all this place is the bomb. Just an off night ... I hope.

4N6TlPqjERHKxwJmCvEJfg.text: We had dinner with friends on a Saturday evening and although we were there before 6, the restaurant was still very busy (good happy hour?).   We let our waiter know we needed to be finished by 7 and he said that wouldn't be a problem.    After ordering and getting drinks we had to wave down our waiter to take our order.     Our salads took a while but the entrees came before we finished our first course.      Waters were never refilled and extra plates were not removed.   Maybe they need more staff?  Everyone enjoyed their food including EVO Salad (served in 2 bowls since we said we wanted to share - nice!), Beet Salad,  3 pasta dishes and the Salmon (a little salty).     Unfortunately we had no time for dessert - sigh.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. EVO Salad - good

SznGZP1b884tv6OSr9Mv5w.text: We ate here twice on a recent trip to Scottsdale.  Both times, the food and service were top notch.  It was one of the best lasagna dishes I have ever had.  My husband loved everything he ordered and our apps as well.  They have a nice little patio.    Our only 2 complaints: The inside bathrooms are pretty disgusting.  The second night we were there, they still had the misters going off at night and people were cold/damp.  They shut them off, which caused a shower on everyone's food.

ZT7_pocfrFXUSDZrV_tIhQ.text: Great service sat at the bar (Jake was the bartender) Great food.  Great atmosphere.  Meatballs were awesome.  Pizza phenomenal  French fries delicious.  Happy hour has good deals.  Good drinks. Would definitely go back.  Oh and mixed some chili oil with ketchup and worked great with the fries.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. These fries are awesome

fZOcAKIoaRkh9n183ZOBGw.text: Amazing spot for date night. Server was absolutely incredible and knew everything on the menu and how it was prepared. Came with a coupon received in mail as promo, and we will definitely be coming back. Nice job EVO! Also, charcuterie board was bomb.com

Vomiu2-8BavxOLYJFE6a4w.text: There is really nothing not to like here! Great homemade pastas (ask about the pasta tasting menu!), wonderful pizzas, appetizers...a phenomenal charcuterie board...oh, and the "crack" known as the chef's focaccia (not on menu...you need to ask)...an unbelievable thin bread stuffed with mascarpone/ricotta cheese and drizzled with honey...OMG. Crispy chicken thigh is also outstanding. Fantastic happy hour from 4-7 pm. Get here now.

Wwx9eyexIOoKdfVDJLYfUQ.text: Came here for happy hour with some friends. They offer happy hour on Saturdays, which is great. There's a nice selection of drinks and food items. The meatballs were awesome.

uKZW45DDoHUAjWOiZFVL1A.text: If you want an entertaining time, with good beer, and great food and even better service, go to Evo.  I don't know how it is on a weekend before midnight, but as far as a fun place to go on a Monday night with someone you really like, Evo is a very good option.

9EfaxN_7hZ3nXfPLrZmunQ.text: I've been here a few times and love the food! My first time was on New Years Eve last year, and have been coming since. My only complaint is this place gets busy on the weekend.

x7_TnNCxeUdBf2T5mxD3xw.text: Evo is a new stop for me in old town Scottsdale! They have great happy hour and industry drinks. In my most recent visit I had the Weekly special which was a Lobster Rissotto. My favorite appetizers are the scallops, the Polpetinas (meatballs) and the charcuterrie board. You have to try the Evo salad! Its different than any salad I've ever tried and is definitely worth the trip.  I have frequented the establishment many times and have never been disappointed with the food or the drinks. The specialty cocktails are playful and fresh. I would recommend the Evo Maid or the Monroe Mule to start but I suggest trying them all.   This is a great place for an after work drink as well as dinner with the family. The staff is knowledgeable and ready to please. The owner is always there making sure the guests are enjoying themselves.This is my new favorite restaurant. Well Done!

xYPuMc-e4goRsrlGFlFYhw.text: We are from out of town and had a group of 10 for dinner. We thought that EVO sounded good. We had a reservation and we're promptly seated. The restaurant was not at all crowded. The waiter took our drink order. It was nearly 30 minutes before our drinks were brought to the table. We then placed our dinner order. 45 minutes after placing our orders, the waiter approached the table and said that they only had enough lobster for 2 lobster risottos. 5 in our group had ordered this. Meals were brought to the table a full 2 hours after arriving at the restaurant and 1.5 hours after ordering. Only half of the meals were delivered at that time. The rest trickled out over the next 20 minutes. We had requested drink refills and received none,  or even water. After asking to speak with the manager, the situation improved with his attention but the waiter became rude and clipped. The food was mediocre. The final blow was the bill reflected 5 lobster risottos when only 2 were received. The other 3 switched to a different (and much cheaper) protein in chicken or shrimp. As a group, none of us were impressed and certainly would not go back.

1I2w9Vc6kCJsETSSwfx0Yg.text: Ok restaurant in old town. Great charcuterie plate and good drinks. It has it's own parking lot which is nice. Not a lot to say about it but it's worth a try :). Staff are very nice.

Spq_-0G6I9OoQF2gzdo05w.text: Went in for just drinks w a large party. Staff was welcoming and they attended to us well.  There was a time lag but that's expected with separate tabs in a large party (20-ish). Great atmosphere.   Prices are typical for Scottsdale.   No reverse happy hour - this isn't a big deal to me, except that advertise that they do have it. Or at least they did at the time of our visit. They also charge $2 for ice! If you order a rocks drink - expect a stiff charge w your stiff drink.

_BGmFWq1boWmJ2DzsFbomw.text: Fantastic dinner - grilled calamari surprised us (didn't notice on the menu it wasn't your normal fried recipe) but it was absolutely great. Tenderloin bruschetta was incredible too. For meal my wife and I split chile shrimp dish - and the waitress brought out on two dishes -- great touch - and it was really good. Just stuck to the house cab wine - was solid. Overall fantastic experience. Restaurant was very noisy - but no problems for us (good for others to know). Service was great -- waitress and several helpers were always checking on us.

fyu7tZ5JvK-1rf1_SYET_Q.text: This place is AMAZING! We had a group of 15 visiting Scottsdale and Evo was not only able to accommodate our large group but they also did a fabulous job. Everything about this place was excellent from the atmosphere to the delicious food to the amazing service! I will definitely be back the next time I'm in town and highly recommend it!

FlND5am4Otm3jL-Y_WeVrw.text: We moved to Old Towne Scottsdale several months ago and this place has become our neighbourhood favorite. The atmosphere is warm and inviting but fittingly trendy for the Old Towne area. The food is a euro Italian twist which I love. Must haves on the menu include the noble bread (served with pesto) as well as the daily pizza. After three hits with the daily pizza on special, we've stopped asking what it is and order it right off the bat. Finally, favorite part of EVO is the service - it has never been anything but on point. Not only is the  wait staff above par but the owner has been there every time we've come and has checked every plate coming from the kitchen. This place is an Old Towne gem.

16f2soGodSoxasguQCcDEw.text: Great service! Stopped for drinks before hitting the food trucks, waiter was fast and super attentive. We'll be back!

HvF4AeTcT8gATIw8muW79A.text: It's tough to write a review when our experience hosted both top-notch AND crappy aspects. So, 3/5 it is.  I called Saturday midday to reserve a birthday party table for 8 and they happily set it up for that night. When we got there, they had printed "Happy Birthday, Stephanie!" at the top of the menus...nice touch! We also checked in on Yelp for .1c fireball shots. Great way to start off the evening. We immediately got a round of wine and cocktails while we perused the menu. They had a $6 wine of the night, and it was really good.  Unfortunately, it went downhill QUICK. Our server was nice enough when at the table, but neglected to come around...hardly at all. We weren't ready right away, so asked for a few minutes with the menus....we waited so long for her to come back that we ended up getting the hostess to send someone over. By that time, all our drinks were dry, and everyone was starving. So, we placed our orders, and waited.  and waited. and waited. then a salad came out....so that girl sat with her dinner in front of her for another 10 minutes while the rest of us waited on our hot food. It wasn't that busy, and I am typically very lenient on high-volume kitchens, but this was really out of control. The wait wouldn't have been so bad if we didn't have to hunt someone down for every water refill or new cocktail. We finally got our food after 50 minutes, and (you guessed it) one of the pizzas was wrong...unfortunately it wasn't a situation where she could just deal with it due to allergies. The pizza was remade but didn't come out until everyone else was finished. Awkward.  The manager came over and was very chipper, but didn't offer to do anything to make it better. Another round of .1c shots or a 'comped pizza would have gone a long way.  The icing on the missing birthday cake was just that--all evening there were bday desserts being delivered, with candles, sometimes with a song. Our server just dropped the check and walked away. We almost just dismissed it, but we could tell the bday girl was disappointed so, again, someone went to talk to the hostess. Eventually the server brought out a complimentary dessert, but without a candle, and with an evident side of grudge. It was just such a damper on what had started out so well.   I will go back some time and see if another server offers a better experience--the vibe of the place is definitely cool and I like the location a lot.

1VBv2BeF57B8_e91myF8uA.text: Great atmosphere but entrees do not match.   Appetizers were good though.  Good service.  Homemade pasta bland. Spaghetti and meatballs ought to be pretty simple to get right.

ZMIcDtWtV9FLoOPPnJr3Bg.text: We came here last year after evo opened and had a great experience. We remembered the food and service were very good.  So we went again last weekend expecting to have another good dining experience but we were disappointed.  I started with the italian wedding soup which was pretty good. Then I had roasted chicken for entree and when she brought it out I was so surprised.. there were 2 very small cuts of the chicken breast and one tiny drumstick, with a few potatoes and tomatoes.   For $17, I was expecting a reasonable sized portion..and its not like chicken is an expensive meat where you expect to get a tiny portion. My friend got the pork belly risotto and she got a big bowl of risotto. Since that was heavy andd rich, I would have thought it would make sense to have a smaller portion of that instead.   The service was disappointing.  The waitress didnt come back to check with us after the food came out. It would have been nice to order another glass of wine. When we were finished she gave us the check and didnt even ask how the food was or say  thanks for coming in.  Unfortunately I wont be coming back here.

CFJD4XWM1M5u_O_h_KA7dg.text: Great cocktails, great service, and great atmosphere!!  Definitely go if you need a place to lounge and a great happy hour in Scottsdale.

Ix-vp4LfTYR0undF_Cc75Q.text: The place always busy but fun.  I had the Evo Salad which was Rich, flavorful and just a huge hit.  Although it was the lightest heavy meal I ever had, it was very tasty.  The evo salad was original and yet the flavors were deeply layered.  The chevre added substance.  Totally recommend a late night bite here.  Also the dessert dounuts are light and tasty.  Get some. Ye all....

wkqZghtxlr60J_vFdfPEWQ.text: Perhaps the worst wait staff in Scottsdale?  We arrived for happy hour at 5:30, and there were only about 5 people in the entire restaurant.  You would think it wouldn't take 15 minutes to serve a glass of wine and a beer since there were no patrons.  We found the menu to be very limiting.  In fact, the chef's daily bruschetta was a concoction of red pepper paste and anchovies, of which we steered clear.  We thought a pepperoni pizza would be safe... But after the 30 minute wait after ordering, we were rethinking the whole deal.  Our waiter was nowhere to be found, so we flagged down a bus-person, ordered a second drink and waited for our pizza which did eventually arrive - burned.  The real wait started at this point.  No second drink ever arrived, no waiter, no check up.  At 6:45 we finally left money on the table and walked out.  No bill ever came and no wait staff ever checked on us.  It was ridiculous.  We won't be returning.

Epuy1zCs4cFR1ZqEmna7-Q.text: Best pork chop in town hands down!! I don't know how they cook it but so tender! Desserts were also amazing!!

SbyQNXFC9IE3XselMgWghQ.text: Friendly staff, good food, delicious wine. Yes please :)

_4gJkTKrvGzXJv9R6UDmcw.text: My husband and I tried Evo for the first time the other night and loved it!  Their happy hour is great (lots of food and drink specials) but we were especially thrilled with our meal.  We both got the squid ink pasta, as it's been SO hard to find outside of Venice, Italy and it's one of our favorites.  Evo's version is a bit spicier than other versions I've had -- which we both loved!!  Such a unique dish that they have made their own.  We got the brown butter cake for dessert, which was beyond delicious.  Not sure what it is exactly but it was essentially heaven in your mouth.  Will definitely keep coming back to this neighborhood gem.

FeN-0aVyD4EOj1mdyWaRpw.text: What kind of ITALIAN restaurant doesn't serve BREAD AND OLIVE OIL!? Portions are small as well.

krZtkBJXxYJoRzR6Zt-w4w.text: I had a good experience, likely because of the great company... Anyway, EVO is just north of Indian School on Goldwater Blvd. The atmosphere is modern with subdued lighting. I started with the Scallops as an appetizer (decent), then I tried the NY Strip which was on the small side but well cooked and flavorful. The service was upbeat and prompt - I shall return.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hvLFfSUDAapdJMeeCQ3f-g.text: Yuck!  Thought we would try this place, my suggestion is don't make the same mistake we did.  They served really below average, at best, food which is really overpriced for the quantity and quality of what you get.  Service was virtually nonexistent and the bartender had an attitude, I mean, gosh, we are customers trying to buy a drink so that you get paid, could you be a little friendly?  Oh, and when we got our special order drinks, they really could not have been smaller.

px4-iLalk_fWIcTQapPlDg.text: I was REALLY disappointed with our service last night. It was a Monday night so it wasn't very busy. My friend and I ordered a charcuterie board, which arrived in a timely manner. Our waitress, while polite, set it down and turned to walk away. We stopped her asking her to explain all the items. She did not know much of what we'd been served. Another waitress came by to help and she wasn't very familiar with the items either. I ordered a glass of wine, one that is on tap and listed on the menu for $7. Our waitress disappeared. Quite a bit of time went by and I did not see her so I flagged down the bartender. He brought me my drink with apologies. Another friend joined us and nobody came by to greet her so we flagged down the second server, who appeared to be on break. Eventually our server came by again and we ordered a round of drinks. This time I ordered a slightly more expensive glass of wine that was not on tap. Soon after, we saw our drinks sitting on the bar. After some time passed, the bartender delivered them with apologies again. I was given the wrong glass of wine. Once I realized this, I walked up to the bar to get what I'd ordered. Given that our server was absent the majority of the time, I'd assumed she'd ordered it incorrectly. But when our bill came, the items on the bill were correct. The bartender had poured me the cheaper glass of wine and I was still being charged for the more expensive glass. Not everyone would recognize this mistake so I felt as though he was intentionally trying to rip me off. And then that first $7 glass of wine showed up on the bill as $8. I wouldn't normally complain over a dollar, but given the series of circumstances that occurred during the night, I felt like we were intentionally being mistreated. The bartender said he'd fix the mistake.   When I receive awful service, I don't want to return to the establishment. I've been a server. I understand everybody has bad days. But I felt like all 3 people waiting on us made our night stressful. Stress is exactly what we are trying to escape when my friends and I go out together. I don't think I'll ever return to EVO.

d7DE3HMmILAnDB-xDx5GwQ.text: CJ is an amazing waiter! Food was delicious and accommodated our bachelorette party of 11 with no problem!

slLXXnux2xFjrbgPzAvT4g.text: We came here a couple days after Thanksgiving and either they're short staffed or they're in trouble. There were hardly anyone in the restaurant, but there's a live DJ playing dancey stuff. Ok, interesting.   We got excited after looking at the menu, esp with all the rave reviews here. The server was very peppy as well. Then the nightmare began..  - All the protein entrees "apparently" were not available. - We ordered meatballs appetizer and it was great! We re-ordered but now it's not available anymore! - We ordered bread with pesto and then I tasted the sauce, it's not pesto. When I asked, he said "Oh I just whipped that up in the kitchen just now. We don't have pesto." Umm... were you trying to test me if I know what pesto is? And hoping I won't even notice it? - My pasta entree came first before anybody else's APPETIZER. And it was the most horrible thing actually. It's their "new" menu with Amatriciana sauce and they were testing it out! Yuck! Worst Amatriciana I've ever had; did not taste anything like it. - Then we waited... and waited... and waited... and the music got LOUDER. #nightmare - One of our orders were lost in the process. - In all fairness, the server was super nice, but his effort in giving us free desserts to remedy the situation made things worse. We waited even longer to get out of here, and the desserts were just OFF. When I compared the pictures on Yelp with what we got, something was definitely wrong here...  We won't be coming back.

NL5SM7wC67oRHLR8KIK-pQ.text: Took my daughter to EVO for a drink and appetizer. Sat at the bar and were served by JAKE, amazing he was, entertaining he was, took our order, got our drinks, and managed our food order. Koodo's to the chef, food was hot, and prepared professionally. Loved the Rosetta Rice balls with Balinese sauce. Thanks JAKE for an amazing experience. We will be back. Did I say JAKE was a master at crafting drinks ? He is.

fdnUox8gy8Yz-4ThY8yhLQ.text: Nothing disappointed me here, and I was able to try 10 dishes. At our table of 5, the most popular plates were lobster rissoto, the game hen, and the marrow.

NY9DEPbYAA7ITaG1i3-PrQ.text: 4 stars for food, 1 for the staff. Food was delish, ambience was good (dinner). The food and drink service was super slow and the restaurant wasn't even packed, so I can't give any discount to the servers. Wrong drink was served at our table, not a biggie. Server spoke with sort of a condescending tone, and came across as if he knew everything about food and downplayed most of our food and drink choices. Usually I appreciate this, but given the condescending tone of the sever, I couldn't. Server mimicked one of our friends when she was talking when he brought out the bill, he thought we wouldn't notice but awkwardly for him, everyone on the table noticed. Still would recommend this place because the food was really good.  Suggestion to the restaurant: Please check the attitude of your servers, the food is amazing and you don't want to lose repeat customers due to something as trivial as an uninterested employee. Also would like to clarify that I'm just talking about 1 server actually who was assigned to our table.

lJeYYYCc0QDTAw0V4yzTdw.text: OMG. EVO is a miss. Ate here for Valentines Day. My Italian rose was great. My Arancini and Burrata were to die for.....and then...wait for it...my Cioppino main course was so disappointing that all I could do was eat the 3 shrimp. Oh, admittedly I did try one mussel that was fishy and over cooked just as the mushy waaay beyond al dente squid ink pasta that was served in the same bowl as the seafood. I mean I don't know about you, but I have never had Cioppino with pasta in it?!*# AWFUL.

Gs9H56dPxPMpSo78ZkU1gg.text: This is hands down our favorite restaurant in the Scottsdale area. Everything on the menu is fantastic, we definitely recommend the Bolognese and Evo Salad. All of the staff is very welcoming and friendly. Every time we go it's always a 5 star experience. If you're ever in the area, this is a must try, you'll love it!

AzAcN760qGZKXxB4kTzuKA.text: So I have been a food rut and haven't really been inspired to want to try to make something at home. But Chef Pete has totally blown me away with EVo. I don't even know where to start.  Well first the must have drinks are Grapefruit Basil if are looking for something tarte and refreshing but the John mule its all the right notes if you are looking for a little sweet and a favor you just can't pin point. For Apps: MUST get the Spiced Pork Belly- if you love watermelon salad this take you to a totally different world great texture, right amount of spice, and the home made pickle watermelon rinds.. the well season super tender pork.I can get this all day and just thinking the salty and the crisp sweet watermelon mmmm The raviolo- is this huge homemade truffle ricotta goodness with the cuper crisp bacon bits to give the salt you need.   Totally something I never had before was their beef heart sandwich which has this amazing homemade mustard seed. My fellow elite Jody favorite was the  EVo salad and i love it just as much but the brussel sprout leave were charred to perfection and the micro pear bites was such a better idea then when you get those large slices that you would have to cut.  We also had the chicken thigh and bone marrow, equally really good if you are looking for comfort food.   After all this yes we still shared two pasta dishes! How can you not- they all homemade too. If you are looking spicy you have to get the squid ink pasta- its creamy with a hint of uni favor but the pasta is cooked to perfection and then you get hit with a little heat of spice after every bite, it not too spicy as you keep going so you end up eating the whole thing and realized you forgot to get a bite of the huge crab chunks.  The Fadellini- that classic clam sauce with a twist and it was a lighter version with these beautifully made pasta.  Price point- we under price for the quality and service you are getting here as some of these dishes in Chicago or NYC would be much higher so totally worth checking out.    Great play on texture, hitting all favors of salty, sweet, sour, etc in each dish and honestly hard to bored.
