Ev2BTVyxfrkxq3YuTHLLbA.text: Had my birthday dinner here during restaurant week.  Evo was able to accommodate our group of 14 with no problem.  When we sat down at the table, I noticed that they had personalized the menus and wrote "Happy Birthday Mimi" at the top of each menu!  I ordered off the restaurant week menu and had the scallops, lobster risotto, and chocolate torte.  All the food was delicious.  We wanted to go to smashboxx after dinner which was about a mile away.  Our server asked the manager if he could help us out and he called and had golf carts there in less than 5 minutes to take us to Smashboxx.    Great service, great food, and great ambiance.  I will definitely be back!

uu0hKC-XfmEguRQbFdcdeg.text: Food was tasty... but I felt everything is over priced, unfortunately. No bread on house,  our pasta dishes were half portion at other restaurants, and price was higer side as an Italian restaurant's pasta dishes. I will drive up to "North Italian" in Phoenix next time when I want Italian while I am staying PHX area.

IgNO60iyKd4npJ5fCn9fOw.text: There are so many great choices for restaurants in this area, and if we are not wowed, we don't go back. We try something else. This was our first time. We went early and caught the happy hour. We loved it! Simply had a pizza which I LOVED, a great $5 glass of wine and sat on the patio with a view of Camelback Mtn. Yep.. we shall return!

0nGjYDT-cqTVSmUhDMBm3g.text: What can I say?  The food was not good. At all.  I had the funghi pizza and my friends ordered some kind of pasta.  We also ordered a cheese platter, which was pretty good.  However, who can really mess up cutting cheese?  You don't have to cook it and cheese is cheese.  From the toppings down to the crust, the pizza was mediocre.  I practically ate the pizza not for the taste, but to fill me up.   I tried some of the pasta that was ordered and it was not good at all. We had thought we can make better pasta at home. The only thing that I was pleased with was my specialty drink - BB&T.

oRvFdbAW2X9TEPkX2BBGbg.text: The place.has aa great casual but upscale vibe.  Great happy hour selections including wine on tap.  The polpettina very.very tasty. The dinner menu is reasonably small but offers some good Italian selections as well.

O3s0jegLzMevjqCHJfJoew.text: Great ambiance, awesome appetizers, fantastic pizza, flawless customer service. Evo has it all. What was really nice and unexpected is that the owner visited our table and chatted with us for 15 minutes, asking for way to improve the service, the food and the feel of the place. He was very interested in what we had to say. We have since eaten at Evo 2 more times and will go back many more.

5__KmjGc33QvFjFstBB-5A.text: I was recommended to go to EVO by a friend. So this Past Sunday I took my family there. Wow almost everything was amazing. Their food is bomb. Bruschetta with asparagus and beef loin was amazing. So goood that I order another one. Capresa salad was amazing as well. For my entree I order the chile shrimp past. Im from Brazil and I love spicy food. But this one was away to spicy. But it was still good. If u dont like really spixy food stay way from this one. My wife had Alfredo with shrimp. It was bomb. Kids food was amazing as well. They dont have to much on their menu.. but u dont need quantities.. u definitely need quality and that my friend.. They HAVE. Service wasnt all that.. but I didnt really care. Im in the industry and I understand that openning a restaurant is not easy. Overall... I WILL BE BACK AND THIS IS ONE OF MY NEW FAVOR SPOTS TO HAVE DIN DIN ON SUNDAYS WITH THE FAMILY.

Yd1R41g1b_Ruw2rNS3wGSQ.text: Such an awesome off the grid spot. It's sorta tucked away, but it's definitely worth finding. The presentation for the food is on point, tastes delicious, and they were pretty solid on filling the waters.   I'll definitely be going back so I get a chance to try everything on the menu. I also want to check it out on a Friday or Saturday night. Looks like the bar could get poppin, there's a small lounging area, and an outside patio to be explored.  The PBLT is BOMB.  ~ TheWaterGuy

a7GxpZ76OUDbD3HM0yAryA.text: If you have a large group & want to be loud this is a perfect spot to go. Nick the owner is extremely professional & accommodating to all your needs. You must order the Burrata & bolognese pasta! The group of 14 I was with all loved their food. Great location in old town Scottsdale & fun inviting atmosphere. Look forward to future visits.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bolognese

rnmXAt0Be2R91-H0NaM1Xg.text: First of all, the service here is great.  Our server had a fun personality, the hostess was very friendly, and the manager seemed kind as well.  The ambiance is very nice as well, though I feel really bad for whoever has to light all those candles.  There are A LOT of them.  Unfortunately the food wasn't great.  The bruschetta we had was literally shrimp on bread, and both my steak sandwich and my date's pizza were just OK.    It took probably 30 minutes for our entrees to come out.  Maybe they were short-staffed that night, and maybe other nights the food is better, but what we experienced wasn't as good as we hoped it would be.

Gf4XjKfDVGU7YJpaZAgcTQ.text: One of my favorite spots to go with my gf Alex for the happy hour wines and awesome cocktails.   Menu is fantastic, literally everything is made fresh in-house from dough to yucca chips. You have to try the pizzas, chicken sandwich, or bruschetta.. But for dessert you HAVE to get the zeppolini's (Italian donut-holes). UNREAL. Made fresh in-house, lightly dusted with sugar and cinnamon, and when you pull them apart they steam... Then you dunk them in the chilled, house-made vanilla bean frosting.. and, ugh. It's just so damn good.

v4jpLLG8mULAvV14kIPYAg.text: Great new restaurant in Scottsdale! When you walk in, the vibe is sophisticated and warm. They have a full bar and full dining room, so no matter what - there is something for everyone. They specialize in Italian dishes with a twist and amazing cocktails. Our server, Jarness, recommended some cocktails - which we ordered. Over the course of dinner we had tried the Grapefruit Basil, Pit of Passion, and a spin on a Moscow Mule called the 'Monroe Mule' (which had a raspberry flavor to it). All of which, I would order again.   On to dinner: We got the EVO Salad (which Jarness recommended) - which has kale, brussel sprouts and other yummy things. The salad was unlike any salad I've ever had. The kale and brussels were baked/broiled and mixed together. This was my favorite item I tried, and would order again.  We also ordered a Caprese salad and a Funghi pizza. The pizza was a perfect size to share (10"). We finished everything we ordered.   In addition to a great dinner, they also offer a late night menu (kitchen closes at 1am) which offers a lot of the same items.   The food was awesome, and I'm excited to come back to try new items! On a separate, but incredibly important note: The service was fantastic. Our server was knowledgeable, personable and really made us feel welcome. The owner was also present on the floor, and stopped by to see how our experience was. I can't wait to go back!

LOGBU2-EKoZZDpwmyRNtuA.text: L says- "A place to have cocktails and a few quick bites, but nothing more."  J says-"The Roasted Cauliflower and EVO Maid will not disappoint, but have dinner elsewhere."  First Impression/Ambiance First impression was great. The hostess was friendly and the restaurant was rustic and cozy. Interior was a mix of hardwoods, black booths and red napkins with white dinnerware. We noticed we were the only diners in the dining room (this was an early dinner for us 5:00) and the bar was where the people were at. We were hopeful for what flavors awaited us since we had gone on a clean eating relatively bland diet this past week to trim down.   Drinks Our server greeted us and helped us choose 2 seasonal cocktails - one with melon and another light and refreshing drink. The first disappointment was the 2 drinks were unavailable because they didn't have the ingredients. We Settled on 2 additional drinks, the MONROE'S MULE and EVO MAID. 28 minutes after our arrival we finally had our drinks. They were delicious and refreshing so we decided to remain open to the rest of the experience.  Food NOBLE BREAD SERVICE -We've had Noble bread at other dining establishments and have been very pleased. For an appetizer to be labeled as a "service" I was expecting something more extravagant than 6 pieces of bread in a single rustic loaf flavor with cup of pesto with a dollop of ricotta. Definitely skip the bread service, as grilled bread points are served with the roasted cauliflower (bonus!).  ROASTED CAULIFLOWER- We love ordering at least 1 vegetable appetizer to really test the kitchen's ability. Anyone can put vegetables on a plate, but it takes a True chef to make them delectable. This dish did not disappoint- brown roasted cauliflower on a bed of smooth hummus with crispy chickpeas, olive tapenade and grilled toast points as a garnish. This was by far THE best item we ordered...which is sad considering the appetizers should entice you to what lies ahead in the main course.  LOCAL GREENS, a simple salad with very fresh vegetables. The only problem was the overpowering vinaigrette. L said "I didn't want to pickle these vegetables. I wanted a salad." TAGLIATELLE PASTA WITH POMODORO SAUCE- Pasta was homemade with "flour, water, and love" but we have to admit Chef Marcellino a few blocks over wins in this category. The pasta was ok, and drowning in pomodoro. Normally, the pomodoro pasta comes with spaghetti but as the server said.."wow this dish looks so much better with the subbed Tagliatelle noodles." At least she was honest. ROASTED MUSHROOM PIZZA- Admittedly, we have very discriminate tastes when it comes to pizza. There are very few places in AZ that fulfill our pizza desires. Unfortunately, this pizza did not make the cut. The crust was bland, the sauce was lacking depth of flavor and the mushrooms weren't all that plentiful.   Service For being the only table seated in the dining room and seeing the bar crowd order very few items, I was disappointed at how long it took to receive our food and drinks. The chef was very nice, and came over trying to sell the specials (48 oz Porterhouse for 2, whole branzino for 2,  and braciole) but I noticed he did that to all subsequent guests. While L would have considered these specials....he needed a partner in crime to help eat this.. J being vegetatrian is not up for this challenge. He also pushed their Sunday Brunch. So perhaps that would fare better than dinner? We think we will leave that up to other diners to try.

qTTYvrlNjq-yz2H27coivA.text: A-OK about sums it up. We visited in June when EVO was (I believe) newly opened. It's in a weird location--you could miss it if you weren't looking. They have their own parking lot which was great!   We arrived at a weird time (around 5pm) so the place was deserted, and the hostess seated us at a table that had crumbs and dust all over it. It seemed really strange that with every table in the place open, she'd bring us to that one. She reseated us immediately after we pointed out the crumbs (and there were a lot of them--she should have seen them as we were approaching the table).   After that little glitch, service/staff was friendly and excellent (including from the hostess who had seated us). Drinks were cheap for happy hour, so that was cool. The food was just okay. We had the caprese salad which had little flavor and I believe some sort of risotto balls, which were good. I don't recall our entrees. I remember thinking it was an okay meal, but not outstanding in any way taste-wise.   We may give EVO another try once they've been open for a while to see if the food has improved--from the other more recent reviews, it looks like it might have.

21VeHs3ev5uUtZJhe2wlZA.text: Was really looking forward to trying this place after reading the awesome reviews. I must say I was a little disappointed.  We sat at the bar and I must start by say that the bartenders were friendly, attentive and made a good drink.  We started with the tenderloin bruschetta which was rather disappointing, the "tenderloin" was not like any tenderloin I have ever had, I ended up spitting out more than I could chew due to all the fat and gristle.  For entrees we tried the lobster risotto and the New York strip dinners. First off, very overpriced and mediocre flavors to both. And I believe this is the only place I have ever been where your dinner does not come with a soup or salad to start until I came to Evo. $32 for New York strip dinner and $24 for the Lobster risotto I though was a little much for what you get.  3 stars only due to the cleanliness and service.

FiBaPHp6uYGBpWFHzNzglg.text: Great food.  Amazing service.  We had the bone marrow, bruschetta, raviolo and orchiaetta.   Simply delicious.   1/2 price bottles of wine on Sunday.   It doesnt hit yelps top 3 but we think it's the best Italian we've had in Phoenix so far.  Nice job chef!!!

aqIXbFHhWbpbhWJF8SnpCg.text: "Drinks and atmosphere..all day.. food.. hmmm"  SO I really wanted to give this place at least 4 stars. It's more like 3.5, but not enough for me to round to 4. The service was great and the restaurant was cute and very sultry -- good for groups or a date, but the food didn't wow me.. and it hurt!  We arrived and were promptly seated. Our waiter was attentive and kept the bread and garlic infused oil (which was fantastic) coming after he realized our group was very hungry. We started with some apps -- risotto balls (on a meat sauce, boo) and the bruschetta. Which was okay. Then we ordered our entrees. I had the chile shrimp.. which was okay.. it seemed the shrimp was overcooked and the noodles a step before al dente (re: ultra firm/borderline crunchy). Most everyone had similar feels about the food just being okay.  So would I come back, yep.. with the focus on maybe pre-drinks or good times with friends. The place really did lend itself to that. Very modern decor and a warm space.

QpKNSCk22z_QcThrZXHCeg.text: My husband and I ate here couple of months ago. There was only a few vegetarian options on their menu. We tried the Margarita pizza, house salad, heirloom tomato pasta, couple glasses of Chardonnay and pinot noir tap wine. When I took a bit of the pasta, it tasted fresh made (i guess that's a good thing). Over all for vegetarian its an okay restaurant. Not too many choices, but its a good change from Olive garden, Carrabbas, or any other chain restaurants.

hJE_Pz5A-KsQXKvSLh7Olw.text: Found this place on open table at last minute for Valentine's Day and it turned out to be amazing food and service! The calamari steak appetizer was delish. I had the lobster risotto which was also yummy. The waiter was extremely nice and even comped us when we ordered desert and 15 minutes later after telling us it would be ready he found out they were out of it so we got free drinks, even better!  Would definitely be back to try some of their other menu items...well and to have a grapefruit basil martini too. :)

-ad3lqvWBqAPrjjBV-YfiQ.text: I've been here twice so far... once for happy hour and once during regular dinner time. The happy hour was really good (the cheese bread was surprisingly DELICIOUS, better than the pizza actually) and great pricing for what you get. We checked in to get the complimentary Fireball shots which ended up being pretty smart on their part because everyone in our party continued to drink, haha.  During dinner, I had the EVO salad and the bolognese pasta. My two friends really loved the salad but it was a bit too balsamic-y for my taste. I would have liked a little bit more of another flavor to balance out. The bolognese though was fantastic (how can you mess up my favorite food though). I would definitely recommend.

G9wu_3YtV8Ac5-t78p1iVA.text: The chefs have really taken their time develop the dishes. Great care is taken in cooking each individual dish. The evolution of regional Italian cuisine is very prevalent here.  Charcuterie board is awesome , Pork Temple Rocks. Presentation showcases the Chef's talents in every dish. Bravo.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

nGmcOcvXSrQjAvIKVmiw8g.text: Three words: New. Favorite. Restaurant.  Not even kidding. From atmosphere, to service, to food, this place sets the standard. From what the owner told us, everything is made in house and sourced locally whenever possible. The taste and quality of our food reflected this.   We sampled something of each portion of the menu except the salads. We started with the bruschetta. It was phenomenal. Our entrees were a pepperoni pizza and the chicken over greens. They were both melt-in-your-mouth delicious.   Desert was an artistic take on a s'more- a brownie with Nutella, marshmallow fluff and gram crackers. Sweet but not overly so- the perfect finish to the meal.  The absolute stand out to me, however, was the drink I had. Even if the food was terrible (which it obviously wasn't) I would come back just for the drink. Try the Blueberry Basil Lime Tonic. You wont regret it. They also keep a number of wines on tap- which is extra cool. Wine's on tap make sure your glass is aerated by the time it gets to you, it also significantly reduces waste.  This is surely going to become a hot spot. I don't see how it wont. Come try it while it's new, so you can get in before the crowding gets out of hand!

qo-VaDg7eI0ZhJMBbgRVPQ.text: My husband and I stumbled upon Evo and were very happy with the food, service, and ambiance. Everyone from the hostess, server, and manager were very friendly and attentive. I highly recommend the Evo salad as it's very different with great textures and flavors. Both pasta dishes were perfectly cooked (al dente) and all of the food came out promptly. The manager went above and beyond and sent us home with a chocolate tort to satisfy my pregnancy craving for chocolate. For you make a reservation, ask for a booth as they look very cozy as they are tucked away to the back of the restaurant. Their outdoor patio also looked inviting.

AW8_qbacHP8Q5laptX2eNA.text: Outstanding new restaurant in Old Town - looks like 3rd time's the charm in this location.   Previous owner(s) had tried a few different things that apparently didn't pan out. Well, the new owner of this spot apparently knows what's up.  The specialty cocktails (which I'm not normally into) are fantastic, and their wine on tap is awesome. The food is out of this world - it's all different. They are really into locally sourced fresh ingredients and being earth conscious (which I really appreciate) and you can taste the difference in the food.   I had a pepperoni pizza and shared some bruschetta that was crazy good, and my girlfriend had a chicken dish I sampled that was also amazing. The cheese on the pizza was creamy - it was really unusual, but I scarfed down every bit of it. The crust was delicious as well.   The best part is that I don't feel boated or whatever. I was full, but didn't have a gut bomb. We even split a dessert that was like their take on an adult s'more. It was ridiculous.   Evo should be a yelper's paradise. This is going to be a really hot spot for an after work happy hour when you don't feel like having a Corona and chips and salsa. It's also a fantastic spot for a date night. It's an awesome place for locals to come and unwind with a drink and some noshes.  There's a really comfy atmosphere and everyone that works there seems passionate and welcoming. I hope they keep it up after the "we're new" wears off. I wish this place all the success and I hope it's around for years to come. I'm definitely going to be back here lots. Had a wonderful time and a happy tummy.

Mdqc6nxXPplOQOqqPhVwCw.text: Ah EVO, the ball was dropped for me this weekend. I came into the restaurant on Friday for a dinner with a bunch of friends, and maybe my expectations were a little too high.   The previous few times I've come in for happy hour in the bar and everything has been great - from the apps to the service. The bar has always been great. However, this particular night, the food was lacking and the service was spotty...at best.  From the time we sat down, there was easily a 15 minute wait before anyone came to the table to greet the party and take a drink order - let alone bring water to the group. It took so long that my buddy and I went to the bar to get drinks for us and our lady friends (plus the 1 cent shot of Fireball upon using your Yelp check-in). When the drinks went dry, lo-and-behold, the server never came by asking to get in a drink order from us, so again we went to the bar. Only this time, the server fervently came up and asked, "hey have I not been to the table enough? Is that why you guys are coming up and ordering from the bar?" Uhhh - yeah, that would be an accurate assessment of the situation, glad you caught it when we were AT THE BAR ordering drinks.  As someone who worked in the service industry for 7 years, on the floor and behind the bar, I don't ever think there would be a situation where asking a guest why they're ordering from the bar instead of the server would be appropriate (maybe from a Management standpoint - but not from the server). And if your inclination is because you haven't been attentive enough to the table, maybe the intuition you have regarding the situation is the correct one.   The food reviews were mixed as the apps and salads were good, but the entrees of pasta that myself and my girlfriend had were lacking in flavor. The spicy shrimp pasta was extremely oily and unappetizing. The service on the floor was poor, especially considering it was a Friday night, and the restaurant was not that busy for the latter part of the evening. The bar service was on point per usual which is why I still have given the restaurant 3 stars.   I realize this review is lengthy, and if you've made it this far down, congrats. However, quality and attentive service in a restaurant is of paramount importance. In many cases, it can even make up for a poorly executed entree experience. Friday night, it just wasn't there on the dining room floor. I'll come back to EVO for happy hour, but for dinner, I'm not quite so sure.

XKtjU9O6rCS9bePdIeqM_Q.text: Food was great! Not too big of selection on menu, but everything we had was great. Restaurant is a bit noisy (went on a Friday night though so that's expected), but overall nice place.

cQl2SO8S013Xgs-Y-3aKow.text: This place is so great. The vibe, the food, the wines, and the workers are all so great. I love their steak bruschetta and chicken  Alfredo.  On some nights they even offer a manicure with your meal and have live music that sounds great. Definitely a great place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak bruschetta and a glass of Riesling at my favorite dinner spot Evo

XVuuh1df0uxCawr1mXhplg.text: Finally, it seems that this location is taking off.  It was amazing how dead it was when we visited the prior restaurant in this location, despite the good food.  However, Evo has amp'd up the atmosphere, maintained the good service, and produced some tasty food.  Thus, the place was hoppin' on a Friday evening and for a change, it was hard to find a parking spot in the lot on this visit.   So it was not the hard-to-find location that was the problem with the previous tenants...  Tony was our server, and he was excellent.  Very personable and helpful.  We started with the scallops, which were flavorful and good sized.  My wife enjoyed her chicken entree, and my lobster risotto, though it appeared small in size at first, was actually very filling and well prepared.  They had a pretty good selection of drinks, and we also liked the bread that accompanied our appetizers.     Nice ambiance, great makeover to the space, friendly service, and good food.  We'll be back!

ivjrzvUZopzJ_J8qdIkyoA.text: Evo is a modern Italian restaurant.  Their cocktails are inventive and very good. The food is spectacular. All of the pasta is hand made in house. Our dinner from the apps to dessert was flawless.

gpk6O7BI9lyfv7UeIFtdvQ.text: EVO is the best restaurant in Scottsdale! Their pasta dishes are to die for, my favorite is the Bolognese! The chile shrimp is absolute delicious too!! It's open late and the atmosphere is super laid back.. They also have a great wine selection and the cocktails are incredible! Woot woot!

BLbRs5YKPAlSVZo3c5_jqQ.text: EVO, bring back the chili shrimp!! This place has a great menu and really cool staff. Order the Chicken thigh, meatballs, Caesar salad. Skip the torte.

t7KetREru3L3rA1NSoAMPQ.text: My girlfriends and I met here for dinner. There were approximately 10 of us and we were seated quickly since we had a reservation. I ordered a flatbread pizza and I was told that they were out of dough and it would be 30+ minutes until they had more. So I ordered the small plate Polpettina to keep our evening plans moving smoothly. It wasn't worth the $11. My overall experience was just okay.

m-z56e0E5jcT-3dsM3E28A.text: Amazing! 1/2 off bottles on Sunday and reverse BRUNCH on Sunday nights. Sit at the bar too! The serves is amazing

dE4ocF8z_LhlIY7cAH66pg.text: The happy hour was pretty money, we ordered the pepperoni pizza, Alfredo pasta and the cheese and meat plate. We definitely were pleased with all three dishes, in fact I demolished the pizza within 5 minutes. We really enjoyed the pasta, which definitely tasted homemade but I cannot confirm nor deny that. Finally the cheese and meat board was very tasty, but I thought was a tad over priced for the small portions. Regardless it was very pleasant and I would definitely eat at EVO again.   The design of the restaurant was very unique as well. One large skylight and glass wall made the atmosphere very inviting.

ztYqwpzJaxtGicZOv3KG8A.text: My friend and I were in town from Philadelphia to attend a conference and needed somewhere we could walk to from the Hotel Valley Ho (which is awesome). We chose EVO because of a few menu items we noticed on their website. We were lucky enough to be served by Tony. He was one of the friendliest servers I've ever had anywhere. He made us feel completely at home and made great recommendations and tips on the best way to order. Our cocktails were awesome and the food was all fantastic. We split 5-6 antipasti and a cheese board. Tony knew what we needed all along. Highly recommended for food, drinks, atmosphere, and service.

SmAOmaiRJ66ML4ZZixtcCg.text: Biggest restaurant disappointment of our trip to Scottsdale. This place has great reviews but was truly awful. Ordered a pizza appetizer but were told the pizza oven was broken AND the kitchen was behind due to a large group. Our server was wonderful and helpful but the food here was simply bad. Our pasta entrees were  simultaneously overcooked and underdone, tasted like they had been sitting out for some time, were barely warm and other than the fennel sausage pasta, borderline inedible. Maybe it was just a bad night for the kitchen but there is absolutely no excuse for the vile condition of the ladies room. It was dirty and smelled strongly of urine, was out of toilet paper and there was only one hand towel left.

6r4P6Ft4s8Op_vkWRX_rXQ.text: Service and food were both excellent!  Great place to go for Italian cuisine. I had the chile shrimp which was a large bowl and a good amount of spice.

iiuDOE32mGTsOJbc79rNnw.text: What a great ambiance this place has!  I really like the setup.  We started with the pork belly which was a delightful dish.  It was paired with watermelon which I would never think would work with pork belly, boy was I wrong!  We then split the Squid Ink Chittara pasta.  That dish really hit the spot.  Days later, I find myself craving it...daydreaming about the next time I will will have.  Damn you EVO!  ;)   We finished off with the penny shot fireball (offered through Yelp upon check-in), what a great ending to a great night!

WExRoToDYx2aP1chghjXgA.text: Always drive by this place, but last night we finally gave it a try. Had a hankering for some late night snacks and everywhere else stopped serving food, but not EVO. Surprisingly, everything was delicious!! The EVO salad was super unique and flavorful, the cauliflower, the arancini, the eggplant balls... Everything. Can't wait to go back. Such a chill vibe in there. Felt like some of the places I visited while traveling in Europe.

u8toakMTHU4tuOdpGjOvzQ.text: Let me start by saying, I love EVO! I come here often and have always had a wonderful time. Tonight a friend and I came in and had the same server we had a few times; Ben. He is so wonderful. Every recommendation he made were on point! His attitude, his style of serving, everything was spot on! Love him! Excited to continue supporting this amazing restaurant.

JdygmyJi5B0ysHPgZfe6tQ.text: I went for last night of Restaurant Week.   the food was great but slow coming out.  Otherwise I would have given it 5 stars.  The cocktails were very good. But the Evo kale salad was fantastic (contrary to other review).  the crunchiness of the kale & the brussel sprouts were so good together.  & the deserts,  YUM.   I will definitely return.

Dq58v8vpDFxvg3mUnmZYTg.text: Ive heard alot of good things about Evo but now that I've tried it I am not impressed. My girlfriend loves charcuterie and wanted to try the board. The display looks inviting. But after we dove in she found a piece of wrapping paper from the cheese packaging, and one of the cured meats was obviously sliced without taking the casing off. I am a prep cook and slice cured meats for charcuterie on the daily. Not to mention a lack of attention from our server. Whom we could see across the bar talking with what seemed to be his friend. Heard the same song literally 3 times within an hour. And why am I yelling at the person across the table from me? I like to talk over dinner and/or  a drink and that was not possible without leaning over the table.  Needless to say I will not be returning.

1fq3pSzc67Cj0NPKMHL-7g.text: I just want to thank Jaris for being so welcoming and helpful. We originally had reservations at Compass Grille for my boyfriend's birthday. They were so rude and unwelcoming that I had room take the cake I bought him back from the restaurant. We ended up Yelping Evo and I'm so glad I did. Jaris saw how flustered and sad I was and quickly asked what he could do to help. He found a romantic place for us to sit down, while he placed our cake in the fridge. All in all, my boyfriend enjoyed his birthday and I'm so glad he did. Thank you Jaris!!

o0kjlaz1pS7o0dbY9NAxmQ.text: First time here last night and we had a great time! Amazing customer service, great wine and you MUST try the infamous Evo salad! You will not be disappointed. Jarnis was our server and he also made our experience great!

JoaVcvUzJ3grXo42buXbWw.text: The food and drinks were actually really good!  The service was sub-par.  The "manager" was clearly intoxicated and flirted with our table of girls.  It took almost 45 minutes to pay for our bill...not sure why!

eMn1IUcezbHF0HhmqDCOMQ.text: Wow -- what can I say -- nice find! I had the Evo salad and shared the daily bruschetta with bf.  I highly recommend the Evo salad -- a nice warm salad with kale as its base.   The bf had the vegetable risotto -- and I quote "it was really good. It was creamy and flavorful."  I like that it is open until 2 am on a Sunday which is rare in Phoenix.  The portion size for the chocolate torte  was minuscule but was it good?  Per the bf, it was above average but left him wanting more due to portion size -- not really shareable.

bZ7ohEgqLcMkfIJTiaqdgQ.text: One of my favorite little places in Old Town.  They have a nice selection of craft beer with happy hour 7 days a week until 7.  Happy Hour menu includes a variety of foods including pizza and a great pasta dish for $10.  On the main menu, the vegetable risotto is perfectly prepped.   This location hasn't been successful in the past but on the strength of a good menu, Evo has broken that trend.

3B_AFvr8NHkuOdstMz-XMg.text: Great little Italian Restaurant tucked away on edge of Scottsdale. Good happy hour, nice atmosphere, great service. Mussels had a couple bad ones but rest of the food was great.

fiaWD5SVpZlR8ubZ2E7EWw.text: Great pasta and great pizza. The pasta taste homemade and the sauce and seafood are light and delicious. Prices are great too! Definitely give it a try.

BCpFJEVVAxehgUyUgjurBw.text: 4.5 stars. Must try this place. Nico our Paisano the owner is a great hard working guy. He chit chatted with us and told us his story since he got the place 3 years ago.   The food is really unforgettable.  We had a huge Charcuterie board full of meats, jams, cheese, bread, pickled vegetables. It was filling.   We also had this (I think it was a Kale salad). It was freeze dried like chip textured and really tasty. For dinner we had lobster risotto (tasty and risotto cooked just right), the black squid ink pasta w/ seafood. Very good  and their fennel sausage pasta. (Spicy side). All their pastas are homemade and cooked al dente just the way I like it.   There were so many restaurants to try and we wanted to have Italian for our last night. We are glad we tried it here.    Please give this awesome strong Yay place a try you will not regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outside has good parking
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Black squid ink pasta
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Evo salad was like a chip

2dhn0-XZLerwcNlzic1htA.text: Ordered the EVO salad and it was burnt I wouldn't recommend this dish. One other occasion we waited over an hour for our lasagna.

iGzcAK7HGbD1zj3_pMospA.text: Started with the Bone Marrow as an appetizer. It was one of the best Bone Marrow recipes I've had and the cherry sauce it was served on was delicious.  For the main course ordered the Shrimp Fettuccine, also very good. All the ingredients were fresh. The bar servers very friendly and offered recommendations.    Definitely a place I would return to

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

S2Gs4v84jhFuKHPrnJOjKA.text: Wow!! This spot is a great spot. The food and drinks were wonderful. I had the lobster tail gonochi .,.so tasty. I should have taken a pictures of our food but the Moscow Mules were too tasty. LOL. I will be back soon. This is a must dine with your wife or a date .  I will see you soon EVO

ap2172VX3Mo0EiWyYk6-0w.text: The focaccia appetizer is marvelous!!! Literally orgasmic to die for! Chloe is the best she has amazing service! If you like sweets try the babycake Oh em gee

ibW53pdbmOL81lPlsTF3PA.text: If you're craving Italian, EVO is the place for you! Quickly becoming my go to dinner spot. The focaccia is the best thing ever, it's definitely a MUST! The wine selection is great and you can really not go wrong with any meal that you choose. The ambiance is awesome, a great date spot as well as a group dinner setting. They are also open late night which is nice for those midnight cravings!

0kckDmYPez_-tBc1AA0QPw.text: We sat in a booth in the bar area so it was a bit noisy for our tastes. The atmosphere is casual, and the food is delicious!! We started off with their homemade Limoncello drink which was so refreshing and very delicious!  The Evo salad was to Amazing!!!  Crispy Brussels sprout leaves and kale with chevre, pear pancetta & pinenuts - all tossed in a balsamic reduction. I would come back here over and over, just for this dish! I had the pork and my husband had the lobster and gnocchi entree - the lobster was a beautiful presentation and was so delicious! The staff is so friendly. Chloe our waitress was wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ybTTDeNRlY3Ud6oB09oF8g.text: Came to Evo for Book Club;   Service was Amazing. They were so gracious with big table, and separate checks.  Food was ordered off HH menu and very good the fries were so delicious.  The pizza was so tasty.

etQ4WeIAtKZTj9rybpGChw.text: This was a perfect choice to celebrate a friend everything was delicious. The birthday butter cake was the piece de resistance !!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Odhx20w48znN5i_RnoE-DQ.text: The food was horrible. I went with a party of 4 and every dish was bad. I had the Lasagna and it was served in a cast iron pan with burnt cheese on top.  You couldn't see the pasta layers because the sauce was oozing out everywhere it looked like a bowl of sloppy joes. The Chicken Fettuccine looked nice but was VERY bland. My friend had to ask for cheese and added a lot to try to give it some flavor,  but it didn't work.  The 3rd dish was Heirloom Tomato pasta. The texture of the homemade pasta  was perfect but the flavor was very bad, bland! I would NEVER recommend or go there again.

fcigXBteIuLFejl_r07tMw.text: Went here for Valentines dinner and was so disappointed. My boyfriend and I had a reservation and got there around 15 minutes early to be safe. When we were seated, the tables were literally less than a foot away from each other. We could hear everything the other couples around us were saying vice versa... so we politely asked if we could be moved to a table that was open (mind you there was about 5 tables around us that were). Anyways the hostess, Tahlia, told my boyfriend no we have reservations that will be sitting there so my next thought was okay well we made a reservation too and are paying the same set amount why couldn't we have been put there since we were first. My other thought was okay it's a 4 top and there's only 2 of us so maybe she'll sit a bigger party there BUT NO she sat 2 people there 20 minutes after we asked. So this started the dinner with just a bad vibe because the table was horrible with no privacy. Next our server introduces himself and he was okay but seemed like he didn't know much about what they served. I most likely won't ever come back because of this experience nor will I/do I recommend this place.

_Q2ngpptFI1CIslV0cELzQ.text: The food here is amazing!! So creative and just delicious. Love the atmosphere as well. Perfect for a date night or ladies night out. Plus great location.

MD-akg72ZUMb5tgFykAIKA.text: I will preface this review by disclaiming I had a pretty rough day and had not eaten more than 1/3 of a small muffin and a handful of nuts all day. And I've waited 3 days to temper my anger to write anything at all... I made reservation on Open Table the day before to celebrate my daughter's 13th birthday. I used open table and answered all the questions and commented that we would be there for a birthday celebration. Our reservation was for 4:15, as we also had plans to catch a 6:15 movie. Figuring 2 hours would suffice in time. Upon arrival the hostess had answered the phone as we approached the desk and proceeded to type up all of their information for a reservation. The manager, whose name I found out from another wait staff is Donny,  was not far away but never greeted, or smiled our way. He saw she was on the phone a perfect opportunity for him to welcome us and perhaps seat us. I waited patiently as the hostess finished her call. She asked if we had a reservation I told her yes. She then proceeded to ask me all the questions which I previously answered on Open Table, which they refer you to use in their recorded message when calling.  They were NOT ready for us at all, she had to put a table together. There was one other larger party and maybe a two top and a few people sitting at the bar. They were NOT busy.  Our waiter who also seemed to be serving the larger party was nice enough, however I think new to the industry. I do have grace for restaurant workers as I once was in their position. I appreciate good service above good food.  We ordered drinks after a few minutes and an appetizer as I jokingly told our waiter whose name I totally forget, I was starving.  My martini came out dirty, super dirty. I asked for extra olives he interpreted that to be dirty.  My mother in law ordered a simple ice tea and that took 20 minutes to get out.  After sitting at the table for 40 min with only drinks on our table I asked if we could please get some bread as I again told him I was starving.  No apps which sounded good never arrived and we didn't get our eventually ordered entrees until more than an hour passed. During this whole time I watched the manager walk from the bar, passed our table to the kitchen no less than 20 times. NEVER did he check our table, much less make eye contact. The only time he came over was to remove dishes after we ate. At this time I used the opportunity to express my disappointment in his management. I understood that our server was busy but as a MANAGER he should have helped him out being so far in the weeds.  Again, we are here for my daughter's birthday. She ordered the gelato for dessert which was brought out and slapped down in front of her by another server. No acknowledgement regarding our occasion.  Not only was my incorrect martini still on the bill AFTER speaking with the manager so was the supposed free gelato that our waiter did tell us would be on them since the appetizers never were even entered into the system. We are foodies. But more so we appreciate good service. This was such horrible service. My mother loved her dish but sad for those chef's we will never be back and I would like to discourage you from going as well.  There are far too many restaurants in this area to endure such indifference.  Heck Applebee's would've been better.  DO NOT GO!!! Save yourself. Head over to Olive & Ivy or Culinary Dropout for better service and decent food.

_4dJ9cC0Fm9GjYlF3n89ww.text: The service provided by Justin was extremely wonderful.  He spent time talking  to us and made suggestions on foods for drinks.  He was friendly and courteous

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bone marrow and lasagna

3nzXCndbSiOFeAYuoAeeqg.text: Good spot to hangout or even for a fancy date. Lobster is so amazingly good the wine is spectacular and I enjoyed my time here. The only downfall is my boyfriend and I had reservations and we got sat right away but waited 15mins at the table for service. The food made up for the wait to be honest.

oYknAfHXiXz6f8lTVwkSHQ.text: Okay EVO, I've been here enough times to speak my mind:   Pros: - I love the fact that you're open til late (after my Chem lab class the only thing I want is pasta!!)  - The Mushroom risotto is divine! I ordered it twice and both times was delicious!! The Bolognese is really good as well. - nice location with a parking lot (thumb up in Oldtown)   Cons:  - sorry to say, but your service is nothing impressive...only because I don't drink, I still deserve the same "friendly" personality that you show with other customers. - two of your dishes are heavily salty: gnocchi and cauliflowers side...when I expressed my disappointment, no action was taken nor it was taken off from my bill. (This happened at least twice). I also tried the Amatriciana and it had the opposite problem: too insipid. Of course when you asked me how the food was I told you the truth, but it seemed to me no matter what I tell no solution is provided. Well then that's no point of asking me how the food is!  - the Caesar salad has too much garlic, it's overpowering!  - you charge for the bread???? NO WAY! I ordered it once assuming it was included, the waiter didn't mention anything about an extra charge, and I still had to wait 10 minutes for a piece of toasted bread to go with my pasta. - check out other restaurants EVO! No one charges you for a piece of ordinary bread!   I was once very impressed with the Bavette. It's a pasta with a special kind of garlic and olive oil sauce (I guess) but then it was taken off the menu. I asked once if they could make it and they did. But then they told me it wasn't available anymore because they didn't have the ingredients. Too bad. For the Bavette, I would had come back more often, giving 5 stars only for that!   So in the end, I'm not only disappointment for some of your dishes, but also for the way you treat an (almost) regular customer.   Maybe I'll start to tip a little less, and you'll understand what I mean.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gnocchi by themselves are good, but the sauce with the cauliflowers are way too salty!!!

kDvCvC2BuW7ZEOPyYfQrWQ.text: Honestly one of the most fun restaurants with the best food in Scottsdale.  Our server Michelle was fantastic. She was very helpful, informative,kind and genuine.  We ordered several happy hour cocktails and apps - the polpette and arancini. The polpette - meatballs were singularly the best appetizer we've ever had. Three nice sized meatballs with a concentrated marinara sauce, a balsamic reduction and toasted bread were the perfect combination. The only thing needed is one more piece of bread to soak up all the sauce - two won't cut it with three meatballs!  The arancini were delicious too however the center did not get hot enough upon the final fry before service so the centers were still cool upon receipt at the table.   The focaccia with ricotta and honey was crispy and soft. All it needed was some black pepper to make it perfect!  The orrechietti with sausage was quite spicy to the point of seeming salty but very, very flavorful and delicious.  We did not stay for the brown butter cake and hope to soon!

BwgOvuM69ZDQwV3zInbhcg.text: Wow! 5 of us came in for a birthday dinner and we were blown away not only by the service but the food. Not only was our server the reason for the great review but the food was top notch. To start, the foccaccia and burratta were delicious. For our entree, the squid ink pasta and fennel and sausage pasta were delicious and the perfect amount of food. Brown butter cake, for dessert, was the perfect finisher to this excellent meal. Our server, Cesar, was very helpful in selection from wines to food. He provided us with excellent customer serve as well which made this experience worth coming back

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fennel and sausage pasta...wow!

ssFKChq3WRxD_FqnXl5IfQ.text: overcooked $18 pasta is disappointing. Arrived late on a Sunday, ordered 2 pastas, one which the server recommended because it has a spicy kick. Not sure who was cooking, but the pastas were bland and borderline mushy. the chef should try salt.

J92OFf59M-xZErqtgLbPUA.text: Wow! I had high expectations for Evo, and they were surpassed this afternoon! The atmosphere is delightful, and both food and service were amazing! The Evo Salad, Chili Shrimp Pasta, Gorgonzola Pizza, desserts and cocktails were spectacular! I can't wait to go back and am recommending this restaurant to all friends and family!

nyaO6kcS6k_yeYXAjcUg-A.text: A party of 6 of us tried Evo last night for Restaurant Week. It was the first time any of had been there. The waiter was friendly but not very patient. Seemed in a rush which diminished the relaxed atmosphere a bit. The first course we all ordered was the EVO Salad- I have to say, it was EXCELLENT and we all loved it. I would have been happy to just order a larger portion of that as the main course of Espresso Crusted Bistro Steak was disappointing. Mine was pretty fatty and I didn't taste any crust. The roasted potatoes and sauce on the steak was flavorful, but I ended up picking at the steak. For our last course, we requested the Flourless Chocolate Torte, which actually we saw online but it wasn't on the printed menu at the restaurant. So we had to ask our waiter and he had to get the chef to approve it. Strange that they forgot to offer that and thankful we remembered what we saw online. It was good, not great, but good. One of our friends also ordered the Budino dessert, which again differed from the online menu, and it was just ok.  Consensus of the group- we all said we wouldn't go back. It was mediocre at best. Too bad. Only positive was the EVO salad, which might tempt me to return. Just maybe.

2Ipr7rx9LivjfNUasXIYEg.text: In fairness my water was fantastic and always full!  We came in with a group of 10.  Each of the first four bottles of wine we requested and listed on the menu were sold out.  Then my wife wanted a pasta dish and the only pasta in stock was spaghetti. Then one of three deserts was sold out.  So long story short....we got pizza and middle of the road wine....go to grimaldis and be happy with your choice! Service was slightly better than poor, but only slightly.

OFMiKdrph3wZlDi1gnMb2A.text: This is a great old town restaurant with a cool vibe and a house playlist in the background. More of a "classic" menu unlike all the cookie cutter Fox concept newspaper menu BS in all necks of the woods.  We had a larger table and a couple of our dishes were subpar, but for the most part it was good enough and a pretty fun spot to kick start the evening.

gf1a7Jr3qKaerjbtNO-07w.text: My wife and I went for happy hour yesterday.  The food and drinks were good. It was fairly quiet, but service was great. We will be back...for sure. BTW...some of the best pizza we've had here in the valley.

xAqy7p9OOcAltLRjIAqErQ.text: This place is awesome!  Six of us sat at the bar and chatted with the owner and bartenders...what a great group of guys.  Couldn't have asked for a better dining experience.  EVO  is the real deal -- amazing food, creative cocktails, hospitable service, all in a chic and trendy atmosphere.  You will not be disappointed!  LOVE, LOVE this place!!

YNjyCNUjN4IbwxhdqMjyCQ.text: Had dinner here last night. No sure but I believe this is the 3rd restaurant the owner had had in this location in the last year or so, obviously this corner is the kiss of death to a restaurant. On to the food, had caprese salads to start and then the salmon (fishy) and the roasted chicken (ok). Nothing stood out here, not the service, not the drinks not the food. Convenient location but I think they have to step up their quality if they are going to make it.

B2il_CjnuDrG1y1GzYymVQ.text: Went for the bestie's birthday. Ambiance is chic and trendy with small dining area.  They did an amazingly cute and small detail recognizing my friends bday. The top had small wording that wrote, "happy birthday Mallory and thank you for celebrating your birthday with Evo". I've never seen any place do this before so my friends all loved it. We scrolled over the menu and I found the Evo salad. A couple of us ordered it. We continued sipping on our wine and chatting and after a while realized that it had been near 30 minutes with no food arriving. We mentioned it to our server who went into the kitchen and I watched him go back towards the bar and put the order in. He came back with shots of fireball as an apology. We were okay with it all since we got free booze out of it. Our server was very kind throughout this and even fanned my friends because they complained of the warm temperature in the dining room.  Our food finally arrived and then we saw our salads.  The Evo salad was cooked/toasted leaves with goat cheese. The salad was no good. We were actually laughing at how the salad resembled eating fall leaves or the stuff that flies up from a campfire. I stopped even trying to eat it. It was funny but all in all- I won't return. The food was the main reason for my disappointment.

WmesSTRKLKTANBr_VlQXcQ.text: We loved the ambience, great to enjoy the weather in February. The rosottio was delicious! On the other hand the service was awful. Our server Nick was aloof and in attentive. We had to ask more than once for water. He got the drink order wrong on the first try and never asked if we wanted another round. Live music was a nice addition unfortunately we didn't want to stick around.

_Kz7BNL33Z8C_iZvPOeiuQ.text: Food was mediocre. The prices did not justify the portion size. They need to make their portions bigger or lower their prices. I would not go back. We ordered the Margherita pizza and the Bolognese pasta. I thought the size of the pizza was a joke. It's enough for an appetizer. The pasta was a small potion as well & it was ok. We then ordered the pepperoni pizza because we were still hungry. The service was excellent. Very nice & friendly staff.

pS_zbC8puLv6pF8qesSUcg.text: Amazing atmosphere,great food and bar had a blast their . And the service was great, even though the food quality was high it didn't take long time to get to our table which was great

LH4y8oos-KGE4UUseFPPHA.text: The place has great food, but the noise level is through the roof.  You can't hear others at your table. At every table people were leaning in to hear each other and often people were shouting to be heard, which only made matters worse.  We complained and were told the owner liked a "late night atmosphere" and the noise was part of that.  Nothing in the restaurant's decor absorbs sound. Our ears were ringing and our voices were hoarse.  Too bad, because the food is outstanding, but the noise is unhealthy and keeps this place from being enjoyable.

pBUvAMsKKNIFS2PPmpC_yg.text: We had a nice dinner here tonight. It was raining fairly hard when we got there and the hostess saw us coming and ran to get the door for us, which was really thoughtful. Our server was also excellent, and the decor is trendy and cool. We did the Yelp check-in for $.01 Fireball shots, and I also had a grapefruit basil cocktail which was really good and unique. We started with the arancini, which was so perfect. The sauce was unbelievable. We then shared a margherita pizza, which was just okay. But we also shared the pappardelle and that was fantastic. My only complaint was that the serving size seemed really small, especially for $18. But other than that, this place was great!

u5_icNcyUkw0HlaFHQSoxg.text: I love EVO!!!! Went here for the first time the other night and I will be back for more! The food is fantastic every bite was better then the last. They have an amazing drink and wine list as well. The menu has plenty of variety and something for everyone but not so many choices you don't know what to do with yourself. EVO takes traditional Italian inspired favorites and ads a different culinary twist! It is a perfect date spot as no matter where you sit it feels cozy. The resturaunt can be full but in your oversize booth you feel like the only people there! It's location makes it great for groups as well for dinner before a night out, or a late night bite. I highly recommend you check out EVO next time you are in old town Scottsdale, you won't be disappointed!

ZKEPskNKGu5y7bkVU93fHA.text: Worst service. After spending 10-15mins waiting for someone to take my order at the BAR, I spent 20 mins waiting for my food order that "had a lost ticket". I cancelled my order and took my business somewhere else. Not worth the wait. Thanks!

a_4Lm1whMLVIbkyfj5ga_g.text: We went to EVO for restaurant week and had some amazing pizza. But it was a bit salty. The manager came over and spoke to us.  He was very nice and explained that he really wanted to make sure the pizza was perfect and that he was going to tell the chef.  When ordering the dessert, I was not sure what to order. So I chose one thing (crepes I think), and the waitress brought us the Italian mini doughnuts anyways after i had finished the crepes. The Italian mini doughnuts were so delicious!! The waitress was very helpful, informative, and adorable.  I would definitely go back!

dx8siE7WL6DccekEL3gwig.text: We live in Scottsdale and eat here quite regularly. The food is NOT of your normal mainstream Italian restaurant staples, like their popular Chili Shrimp , VERY juicy Roasted Chicken breast and a MUST try Evo Salad, the quality is consistently great, so whatever the Chef and kitchen staff are doing keep it up things will only get better! The Scottsdale property is a attractive property in the middle of Old Town, On the corner of 5th ave and Goldwater. The tables are packed in quite a bit, so the place is quite noisy when it's busy. It is therefore better for family and group meals and a quick meal out with the other half but for that you MUST sit at the bar where the bartender Brandon will take great care of you and will even know your name for the next time you come in, as for Nick, I believe his name to be, Owner and Operater will come up and see how you are doing and how was the meal, so for him to take time out of his day to check on his guests really tells a lot of someones place. That's the kinda place I want to spend my money. The hosts' always have a great smile on their face, all servers are all unique in their own little ways, our server was Nick, he was very attentive and paid attention to detail. The service is good on the whole and the staff are helpful when you turn up with small children although being quite crowded, there's not much space for buggies etc, so try and leave them in the car. They do run out of high chairs fairly often, although I think you can reserve them when you make a reservation. I don't think they really have a kids menu but what I have seen, kids portions are quite big. Overall, its the place we eat out at most often as a family.  We will be coming back to Evo to spend our money.

R8M8MOASjyj_noQ4D8GPJg.text: The service was awesome and the food was outstanding. I ordered the Fidallini ala Vongole and everything about the dish was perfect. The pasta was cooked al dente exactly the way I like it, the sauce was light and tasty with plenty of fresh little neck clams to finish out the dish.  We also ordered dessert, flourless chocolate cake and brown butter pecan ice cream. Both were delicious. I highly recommend this place and will come back again. We also loved that owner, Nick stopped at our table to ask about our experience and appreciated our feedback.

-JaM3Z07AjAZUmVNHYhrCQ.text: I went here on a double date this past Saturday night. I had called earlier in the day and made a reservation for 4 people at 6 pm. When we got there they had us down for 3 people at 7 pm. Whatever, no big deal, it was basically empty anyways! We loved the atmosphere, the booths were comfortable, and the decor was modern and interesting. Our server was super cute, knowledgable, and friendly but a bit over bearing. She'd ask if we were ready to order, we asked for more time, and she would literally circle the restaurant, come right back and ask again. Drinks took f-o-r-e-v-e-r and one time the wrong drink was brought BUT, they were all delish! We started with the bruschetta and some risotto balls. Bruschetta was mediocre, but the risotto balls were really tasty. My husband and I split the funghi pizza and the chili shrimp pasta for dinner. Both were OK. The pasta itself in the chili shrimp pasta was really good, really tasted like it was homemade and it was cooked perfectly. It wasn't very spicy though (which surprised me as other reviews said to watch out for the spice!). The funghi pizza was really a disappointment but maybe I'm not being fair as I recently had the funghi pizza at the Parlor and it was amazing! For dessert we tried the chocolate torte - tasted like a chocolate mousse, good but not amazing. The Zeppolini - undercooked! When we bit into it it turned to mush. And we were a table full of Italians who have had some good italian donuts so this was a disappointment. And we tried the gelato as well - just tasted like vanilla ice cream. SO, overall, "meh. I've experienced better". I think this place has potential, most of what we ate was on the cusp of being memorable but, unfortunately, was just not there yet. Would I go back? Sure, if there was an event of something already planned there I wouldn't be upset about going back, but we won't be going back voluntarily.

cqYneu8o92u_Br8hLMWAqA.text: Martini and manicure night is definitely a hit here - the place was packed with ladies from 5:30 - 7:30. All the servers and staff were extremely friendly, service was spot on (thanks Sara!) and timing was great with everything. We had the risotto balls, mushroom pizza and meatballs - all were tasty. Great happy hour deals on food and drinks. The restaurant itself is super cute and aesthetically pleasing - patio and interior are both awesome. My only negative was the music was extremely loud - especially for a Thursday night before 8:00 pm. It was a nice intimate atmosphere before then, but we jumped ship when we had to shout across the table for a dinner conversation. Honestly - the guy playing was really good, just too loud for the time and place. I will be back again for sure!

CVfoDCyx2U3Id93NUVWbqA.text: Don't order the lasagna. The cheese on top was burnt, and the bottom layer was burnt, and the middle layers were under cooked. We also ordered the calamari, which was under cooked as well. I have been here several times and never had any problems, but tonight was a huge disappointment.

WJHO1CKCwd8kq5jSWunwHg.text: Great option for late night dinning in Old Town Scottsdale. Interesting dishes and the coolest & friendliest staff ever.

Ag0dZdmnYX9AP6vspVDkkQ.text: Delicious food. Great service. Awesome service. I highly recommend EVO! I will be coming back the next time we are in Scottsdale for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

V54GDgPv-IRvBA0WKCBDSw.text: Excellent Italian food, moderately priced. All the staff are extremely friendly and the owner was welcoming customers at the door. Reservations required as it is very popular

kvC4Eg-ZvP9tmTR96MZLOw.text: Really loved everything about Evo. Happy Hour was festive and good selection of applies, Food was great, portions were perfect. Atmosphere perfect.

Dscq0NNJophqP7Jp3yjUjQ.text: I made reservations a month or so ago, for a salon holiday party.  I wanted a large table, for a Saturday night, during holiday season, at a prime hour...everything was easy, well prepared and I'd absolutely go there or plan a party again! They even let us move furniture by the bar for staff pictures! Thanks for a great night, EVO!

yAKQ4yX2nF4n47DFZy6nrQ.text: Finally returned to celebrate my friend's birthday.  We got some restaurant menu items which included the EVO salad which seemed popular based on reviews.  It had a few fried kale leaves, pancetta, cheese and some brussel sprouts, etc.  I thought it was promising but not especially great.  I actually don't like the fried leaves as it didn't do anything for the salad and just tasted bitter.  The steak was very bland so I requested salt (there are no shakers on the tables!).  The potatoes were seasoned and fried well, but somehow they missed the steak?  I even tried eating the potatoes and the fried onions with the steak but it was still too bland.  The sauce it was on didn't do much at all to help, it really didn't have a strong flavor of anything..  I also tried the sole which was a step up from fish sticks.  The pasta was actually decent - like a better version of chef boyardee.  The noodles may actually be freshly made as they had a decent texture to it.  If the sauce was better I would have tried coming back for pasta later.  They ran out of Nutella for dessert so we got chocolate torte instead.  It's pretty rare for me to throw away a chocolate torte but that's basically what I did...  it tasted very odd and dry.  Thankfully we had a birthday cake alternative.  I really don't think I'll be back anytime soon.

fTkJe-d6WNrEfD5wJOE1bg.text: Had dinner at EVO and loved everything about our experience. The food was amazing. The EVO salad is to die for. I would also recommend the focaccia rustica appetizer and the homemade bolognese. I would have licked my plate if I wasn't in public! The staff is amazing. Everyone was so friendly and helped with recommendations. Love that the pastas are all fresh. One of our new favs for sure!

N_1rYX_edmnaGFSUsVwDeA.text: Had a wonderful dinner, the restaurant was clean, and the server had such a good sense of humor, a big shout to Andy, he was checking on my table, and fill my glass, for once I did have to ask, or hunt down a server,, the food was very delicious ,

cls-i1_iCNcoHz7Y9G1kNA.text: Omg the hostess Didi made my dining experience at Evo the best dining experience ever. I've been here before and to be honest it wasn't my favorite place but I tried it again and the sole reason I stayed was because Didi made us feel so welcome and comfortable. Not only did we eat dinner but then stayed for a few more drinks and had an amazing time and as we left she smiled at us and made us want to come back! We will be back tomorrow!

6MkLpxG95F9b9wiFAZ4jRg.text: The ambiance was nice.  The staff was friendly.  The Ceasar salad was very good.   But I'm almost at a loss for words about the "Italian" cuisine.  It's hard for me to believe that any chef, or cook, would serve some of this food and think it's edible, much less good.   When my wife put the pappardelle bolognese in her mouth, after fiddling with the thick pasta in an attempt to get it on her fork, she actually stopped chewing and just stared at me. I asked her if it was good.  Silence.  Then, I said "mediocre?"  More silence.  Then she spit it into her napkin and finally said, "taste this, it's tastes like glue." And unfortunately, I did taste it, and I had the same reaction, and I had to spit it out.  The homemade pasta was so thick it couldn't be twirled onto the fork, it had to actually be cut with a knife.  And it tasted like uncooked dough with flour on it.  There was no meat to be found in the dish and the sauce looked and tasted like it just came out of a tomato can, watery with the tinny taste of the can.   That's why I wrote that I'm almost at a loss for words because I've never tasted anything like it.  It's not possible that the person who cooked it tastes their own food or has any experience with preparing or eating Italian food.   I ordered the calamari steak with "arreganata."  Again, pretty shocking.  The calamari steak had no flavor at all and the "arreganata' was some soggy bread crumbs piled on top that were so over salted, one bite was too much.  We returned both the appetizer and entree.   Then, as a last ditch effort to eat something other than salad, we ordered the meatball appetizer which unfortunately was equally as confusing.  The meatballs were flavorless and wet, and the sauce they were sitting in tasted exactly like ketchup and worcestershire steak sauce.   We took the meatballs to go and then threw them away.   I'm not trying to be overly critical or mean, but it's hard to describe what we were served.   I can tell you that after we left, we felt like we had to get something to wash the taste out of our mouths.   Sorry Evo, but I strongly suggest you bring in a chef to taste your food before serving more of it.

3qJH9YPCSWSSnzJrnLQh-w.text: This place was so meh.. we were seated right away on a Thursday night. Pretty empty. It took awhile (10 min) for someone to come up and ask for our drink order . The server was very nice. She recommended a pork belly appetizer that was just not good. The pieces of pork belly were all fat. My husband got the salmon and I got the bolognese. Both meals were just not even mediocre. Also, she kept offering to bring me stuff (bread, meatball) that we were charged for. It was just odd. Waste of 100 bucks.

bGMG5H_37nk6bkY0ZOgUmA.text: I SO wanted to give Evo four stars. Their food was certainly good enough for that however last night, their service was a mess. Our server, Joy, was wonderful and did everything within her power to keep things from going sideways but when another round of wine couldn't find it's way to the table (and never did) because they didn't have enough glasses, I knew we were in trouble. They had a number of larger parties there which according to Joy, contributed to the problem, but seriously - if you're running a relative hot spot in Scottsdale on a Saturday night, you should be able to handle that.   Bottom line - food was great but management has a LOT of work to do. The Evo I saw last night was not ready for prime time.

kjvq1edYHqQSogx3twYLKw.text: Continues to blow my mind.  Try the pork belly/ watermelon dish!!!   Staff is always helpful and chipper!   This is by far my favorite place in Scottsdale for happy hour   Everything I try is great!!!

en-hP4rwa4FCNM9rfbAvtw.text: Bomb cocktail menu and killer appetizers! Splendid service is also a plus, and to top that off the kitchen is always opened late for all us night owls ^_^

e37_QNU3rm2b90MY0w9Zxw.text: We came here with a group. Our server had a scowl the whole time and wasn't friendly at all. So service is 0 stars. The food was hit and miss. Some people enjoyed their meals some didn't. I had half the Evo salad and the vegetable risotto. The salad was supposed to be kale and Brussel sprouts. I got one sprout. That was disappointing. The flavor of the salad was good though. The risotto was meh. I left most of it in my bowl. It was watery and not creamy. My husband's bolgonese was ok. Basil grapefruit cocktail was good. Wouldn't come back though.

ui67exks80WjyyV5uXs5IQ.text: I've been coming here for years and the staff is always so friendly! Love that Sunday's there are 1/2 off bottles of wine and their new late night reverse brunch is good! Food is great and they're always very accommodating. I love sitting at the bar with Dom! Great local establishment would recommend it to anyone. Fun late night spot!

z_yWieLnHH64wlsobzkxow.text: Love this place! We got a bottle of wine and pizza for $20 which is a great deal! The dessert was my favorite part though.. Delicious! Tony was awesome

44ImtOYCSfnlkA-E0BUt0w.text: My friend and I walked in on a Thursday night and absolutely loved it! We decided to sit at the bar and Jake helped us out. He had great suggestions. Fantastic food and service. We will definitely be back!

aeztC4dJJRRaKt3ohCDKPg.text: Best described as modern Italian. I have never seen bone marrow on a "real" Italian menu, so there is no other title available. My experience was brief and was spent only during happy Hour. The bar was crowded on a weekday night, but that is likely because only a certain amount of people want to spend $30 for an entree at dinner. The HH beers are 3 bucks each and they have some food specials. We got a pizza, but it was hardly edible as all I tasted was alot of salt. It looked like maybe some other choices might be good, but HH ended and we had to leave. Not budget friendly unless your at happy hour which again is why it was packed between 4 and 7pm and empty at 7:01pm.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salty

qfi3Dp1fSAyMGFP_rft-hQ.text: The food was really good and the place is nice. The only downside was that whatever we chose to drink they were out of. It took about 4 attempts to finally get a bottle of wine that we wanted.

2K0cpYQ5CIT4o1q8UegyiQ.text: Great food. Showed up at 5 pm for a four top to eat and drink and hostess turned me down because there was some large party coming in at 745 pm and for some reason didn't want us to sit until 9 pm. I told them we would leave before they showed up and they let us sit. Odd restaurant hostess but food is good

qj6ciScRmQ8WyDG2dEDIkA.text: Ok this place was so bomb.  We went solely off yelp reviews.  We shared the charcuterie platter and had a bottle of champagne.  It was filled with killer meats and cheese pulse pickled veggies which was way different and a plus.  We shared the fennel sausage pasta and the lasagna.  Both were amazing but the sausage fennel pasta was almost exactly what I had in NY. So good. Server was a super young kid and brand new but he was friendly and was still very good   And they serve full menu until 1230 am.  Big plus.

pR6oMFPrjm9FoVwkQzWF1g.text: This was amazing, from the service... Erica (sp?) was wonderful, friendly, knowledgeable & fun! I cannot say enough good about the food, started with/appetizers: arancini.....I could have made a meal with this alonemeatballs...then dinner...I had the pork belly @ Evo salad, this salad was so good, light, summery, will order again and again. My Fiance had the lobster carbonara, he got the whole lobster we were amazed, my GF got chicken piccata...yum...desserts: butter cake, thyme and olive oil cakeI could go on and on....will go again soon! Can't wait

9CK7ufolQJncgIoElH60uQ.text: Our server Alex was the freaking MAN. Soooo cool and genuine, quick, etc etc. Couldn't have been happier with the customer service. The food was outstanding. Literal orgasm IN MAH MOUTH! It was my first time there and thanks to Alex and the amazing food, I'll be a regular from here on out.

JS94UwjazniWKUxVcnVlrA.text: Although I've known about this place forever, I finally tried it last week. Then, went again last night!! I loved it both times! Had the focaccia Rustico both nights. It is amazing! The combination of sweet, and salty is perfect. Also did the wine down Wednesday last night. A bottle of wine and a pizza for $20. What?! Yep! And they were both great! Had the BEST server, CJ. He was friendly, super attentive, and gave great menu tips. Definitely one of my new favs in Old Town!!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best appetizer! Focaccia Rustico.

zVMCh979tfM2vnZkATQpGg.text: EVO was great for a nice dinner out with a large group. The food was outstanding. They offered a semi-private area for our large group. There was a very small hiccup and I must say the manager Jared(?) and server Jason went above and beyond. Kudos to them both. Will be back in the future.

W9ok-87r7wfT3qcBEc2DVw.text: Excellent food. Had the eggplant Parmesan and it was the best I've tried. The butter cake is better than Mastro's - it's as tasty but lighter!

MX5595PP8vgREsPC7sc7hw.text: This is the best place in Oldtown! Wonderful food, amazing service, and the owner was an absolute delight. I look forward to coming back soon. Anyone would be crazy not to love this place!

2_o_P1wwbvUI32d6jUrOcA.text: I have passed by EVO many times, always wanting to try it, and finally did last night. It has a great extended Happy Hour - I left very full after a meatball and crostini dish and a delicious draft Grand Canyon amber ale. Terrific professional service by Louis and other waiters that popped by to refill glasses or clear plates. This caused me to take a look at their dinner menu which looks amazing. Will definitely be back for dinner.

URATAOLpQPygQG0z95M67A.text: Went to evo after work tonight, Jake and Dom killed it. Jake gave me the best recommendation for food and it was the best lasagna I've had in a while. Then when I was trying to pick out what wine to have with my meal, Dom was more than happy to give me a taste of a few different wines. He was so knowledgeable about the wines and it was a huge help in deciding which bottle I wanted with dinner. Thank you so much Dom and Jake! I will be back very very soon!

dhHUSwxtPpfEYQWMuvzm7A.text: Went there for my birthday dinner with 8 friends. It was wine Wednesday where you can buy a bottle of wine and get a free pizza so we bought two. It was really good food and the charcuterie board is delightful! I would definitely go back :)

MUa22nNsTYjYGq-TddLiqw.text: I came here to celebrate my 21st and was really impressed with the good but the drinks were amazing. They really made me feel special on that big day. I'll definitely be back soon

cVrFHc62ynnIR-Ee3BMI-w.text: Amazing food and great atmosphere! I had the fennel sausage pasta and it was just the right amount of spicy!   Our waitress was very sweet and attentive! You will not be disappointed!

mEQyn5f5tMtGurTP3H9vhQ.text: Great restaurant, very accommodating for a birthday dinner and a large reservation.  Very nice staff and wonderful food and wine.  Would recommend to anyone who likes Italian food.  Conveniently located in Old Town and has a private parking lot.

y3-nx2azR6oYEzx_5h64RQ.text: After attending a Yelp brunch event at EVO last month, I wanted to come back and try dinner here. We decided to host my husbands boss and his wife here and that also would give us the chance to come back. We decided to arrive early and try the happy hour before the boss arrived. I love the setting and decor of EVO, which is dimly lit, lots of candles, music just the right volume and not blasting your eardrums off, and the exposed wood and brick mixed with red textiles give it a chic, classy feel. The bathrooms are clean; a lot can be said about the cleanliness of a restaurant depending on the cleanliness of the restroom.  EVO's bar has a great happy hour menu. Happy Hour runs from 4-7pm. I like to take notice of happy hours that are worthy! I will have to put this on my Yelp happy hour list! Wait for that! The EVO Happy Hour has really mouthwatering starters that are by NO means small in portion, at least for what we ordered. We started with the Bruschetta of the Day, which is a daily chef inspired bruschetta, (thats fun!) made of ricotta, a little honey, and apricot, topped upon perfectly toasted housemade bread. The boss arrived and he and his wife ordered the Arancini, which was three large balls made of risotto with red sauce over them. Seriously, you could make this a side with a pasta for a meal! There was also an Italian Sweet Corn that was ordered. When it arrived there were four small ears of corn with the perfect spices and oil drizzled over the warm ears. I can not eat corn but it smelled heavenly! On the Happy Hour menu, $3 drafts and bottled beers; $4 well drinks; $5 tap wine, (which I have always turned my nose to, but since my husband ordered a Pinot off the tap, I tried it and stopped my snootiness there!) and $7 specialty cocktails. That is ANY specialty cocktail off the menu. The other thing that not all places do during happy hour is allow you to order off the happy hour menu at the table, but when we moved with the boss and his wife to our reserved table from the bar, the waiter greeted us and told us that the happy hour was still going and we could have that at the table. Nice!  Dinner time! I had a glass of cava to start and to finish our appetizers off with. I like the wine menu being so expansive and with at least a few bubbly's that you can order by the glass, since I am selfishly, a bubbly girl but can not do a whole bottle by myself. (Okay. I can. But I should not).The waiter was on point and made suggestions to us based on our tastes and his own personal favorites and the 'why' he liked them, as well. It was hard to decide. I would not say that this menu, being Italian, is what I would call, 'Old School Italian', such as lasagna or alfredo sauced fettuccines, which are not on this menu, but I liked it! The menu does not overwhelm you with choices. There is a fish of the day and a beef. Both sound amazing! Maybe next time! I came for pasta! I had the Squid Ink Chittara. The squid ink may throw some off but let me say this, its mainly for aesthetic purpose. In other words, you do not taste squid. This dish was something so different for me but considering myself a 'foodie', I had to try it! Long, thin dark purple squid ink noodles are tossed with a uni butter and chile for a little spicy kick, then topped with lumps of white crab, a little scallion and a little breadcrumb and a few sauteed cherry plum tomatoes. It was a perfect portion for me. My one small complaint, I would have liked to have seen more lump crab. It was a small, small portion and I would be willing to pay more to see even 1/4 cup of it.
