I know its a rough season for crab in California, so maybe that is it. No matter. I loved this dish! Its different and today i wanted more, but I had no leftovers! My husbands dish was the Pappardelle that had a red ragu sauce with lots of beef, veal and pork, just like a good ragu sauce should have. I loved his too! One nice touch would be for the waiter to bring fresh parmesan and have large spoons served with the bowls of pasta for twisting the pasta.  You can get bread to go with all this pasta too, on the menu as Noble Bread Service. NOT that we needed any more yummy-ness!  Dessert! My husband can not seem to try a new restaurant with out sharing a dessert. EVO has an amazing 'hard to choose just one', dessert menu! He ordered the Warm Butter Cake. I am not sure if that is the correct name, but the long and short of it is that it is a ample serving of a warm, dense butter cake served atop a creme anglaise and topped with whipped cream. It's warm, rich, sinful and heavenly all at once. Today we are officially juicing after this amazing meal at EVO.  I am glad we had a reason to come back for dinner. I love the area of town that EVO is in, as it is a good starting point for a weekend night in Old Town and even a good ending point with its great bar and drinks. I am officially a fan!

GBmyEx-GsgVDLK2Rf9TCJw.text: Food was good. However, if you order a drink on ice, you will get charged TWO DOLLARS per drink for ice. When asking the waitress about it, she just walked away. Is there an ice shortage in Old Town?

I-UGx8VT2n2bsZjhBWrt9Q.text: We tried the asparo salad to start the chili shrimp and the Aragosta and finished with Chocolate torte .. our waitress Chelsea was awesome in directing us as to what to try... and wow she was spot on!!!  It was all delicous! We left nothing on the plates... the lobster pasta was amazing and the chili shrimp was well seasoned but not so hot to make it overwhelming.  The chocolate torte was fabulous and well laid out.  See the pic... we recommend this to anyone who likes great affordable tasty food

wHe5bjKY2rfSjylIgi_1sQ.text: Elise was the best server. Nick the bartender was so nice I wanted to hug him. Chef Steven Fowler's meatballs were so good I cried a little bit. Tried the pork porterhouse and the seasonal cocktail menu. Comfy. Cozy. Italian done right.

kAZzStySQkz1yMEcq8wi3Q.text: The drinks are decent but the food is terrible. I guess you can compare the quality of the food to olive garden. The chicken was very rubbery texture and tasted like cardboard. The service was terrible especially for it being a slow night. Only interacted with our original server maybe 2-3 times other than that kind of just waiting around to get our next meal and check. Definitely have put a bad taste in my mouth and won't be coming back. Worst $80 spend.

cjODFCP3WChZFZ3xzQmOVQ.text: Excellent Italian style food. Bruchetta boards are to die for. Great cocktails and craft beers as well. Overall, great place for a date night.

S50sT8hhST920vOBCKaYHQ.text: Good meal here Xmas eve. Best Italian since coming out from Boston earlier in the year. Meatballs were top notch and all three of our meals were tasty. Wine list was good. Had a reasonably priced Italian red blend that was awesome. Service was also exceptional with servers covering for each other during busy night. kcRDjWr6p8sJepGxdQUv-g.text: Love the atmosphere of this place! We were there on a Sunday evening around 930pm, and there was a singer there, that we could still hear while we were on the patio. Great selection of beer and wine. My husband enjoyed his Bolognese, and I had a caesar salad with grilled chicken. Very enjoyable!!

7lrAgC9SySg1PZZQIs3WLA.text: First Time There ... It Was So Noisy In Dining Room We Asked For Patio ....However The Patio Was Not Appealing & Cars Going By Distracting. Asked If Table In Bar Was Available ....Really Couldn't See The Area Well &  Who knew It wasA REALLY Bad Decision The Table Was REALLY Really Small And Better 4 Drinking & Well We Had Already Moved Twice. Barely Had Room For Food.. At Least It Was A Few Degrees Quiter Than Main Dining  Room .. HOWEVER Right In Middle of My Eating Dinner A Group Of 5 or Maybe 50 Sat At Bar RIGHT Next To Us (Even Though There Was Alot Of Other Spots Available ) One Was STANDING Behind The Seated Person Literally A Inch Away from Our Table. That Only Topped By The Next Person Who Joined Them #8 Who Pulled A Chair Out Behind His Friend At Bar & Seriously Might As Well Have Been At Our Table  I'm Not Normally Hard To Get Along With  But Honestly This Was A EPIC Fail in Dining Experience. The Food Was Okay. The Bread Was Called Foccia looked Like White Toast. I kid You Not. Salad Dressing Was Runny And We Had Too Ask For Extra As The Salad Was almost Bone Dry. I Could Not In Good Faith Being in Hospitality Biz For 20+ yrs...Recommend This Restaurant Because of The Noise Level & Lack Of  Alternative Seating. Mostly Is A Big Bar with Food. The staff was friendly, the place had a steady flow of guests and the ambiance was on point. We had the bruschetta board, the chicken picanta, and the baby butter cake. Katelyn, our server, was super nice and present when we needed her to be but not overbearing. Awesome experience around!

KhZcjtnEsZfPPclGkXaAag.text: Amazing meal.  Meatballs were homemade and three meats.  The trio bruschetta was fantastic.  The butter cake was decadent and soft and smooth like a warm hug for the mouth. :-). I would definitely eat here again.

uVd7xGMN1sJ7REN3dzg9pg.text: Audrey was awesome! She was super knowledgable on the drinks to choose from, she accommodated my vegan needs and I enjoyed the atmosphere! Will be back soon

-_XK7Mgmb1Vej5-u0i4PNw.text: My husband & I got in late on Sunday night & chose this place because it was open and had good reviews. The atmosphere is stunning - dim lighting, and red velvet, very well thought out. Our service was outstanding. Friendly, helpful, & sincere.  It was 10:30 PM & we ordered the rustic focaccia which had brie and truffle. It may have been one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten. And we also split the lasagna which was just OOOOOZING with cheese. I was a very happy girl.  Also, there was some nice live music to boot. I would definitely come back.

sh3iVzoOfI_qvxS1g9nOyA.text: First of all I'm Italian from New York and has spent months in Italy and the meatballs are off the hook! So are the rice balls and the service I love everything here including the butter cake don't leave without it!! My god this is the best place in south Scottsdale and a great price!!

63X3xZEuu2v1nOHzySxeWQ.text: This place was one of the highlights of my Scottsdale trip! Incredible food. The bruschetta is a MUST. I would order this as an entree next time because it is that amazing.

xgCRGHAE2uUYTN6wIg2NlA.text: Had the chicken parm. Lights out!!! Great staff. Highly professional and knowledgeable. My new fav spot in old town Scottsdale!!!

LKc0N0YQbj9bhP1tyoRAZA.text: Hubby and I had an a 5pm reservation. Glad we went early because we could have a conversation without a loud crowd. Our server Katlin was just fine. We ordered the bruschetta trio and the meatballs. I didn't eat much of it but my husband liked the eggplant and the fig. I wouldn't order it again. We both didn't like the traditional. He mentioned the meatballs were good but he wasn't as enthusiastic as I thought he would be. For our entrees I ordered the Heirloom Tomato Pasta. The pasta was very good. Cooked perfectly. The sauce was good. I did push a lot of garlic to the side. My hubby had more meat. He really enjoyed the Fennel Sausage Pasta. It's a 40 minute drive for us I doubt we would return. At the end of our meal a large gnat was in my wine. Not a big deal it happens but I was hoping the server would come back so I could ask for a clean glass and a smidge of wine but I had already paid the bill. Speaking of the bill, we thought the price for 3 glasses of wine 2 happy hour apps and 2 entrees was very reasonable.  I received an email from Open Table saying we were a no show. WTH!!!

BalK0_87YXlOBvk7sRIN3A.text: I normally am not a huge desserts fan. However, I decided to give their butter cake a try after hearing it was the best thing since sliced bread (Aka Mastros). Well, it wasn't! Mastros butter cake is better. I suppose that's what I get for being spoiled!! It was underdone in the middle and I asked for ice cream instead of whip cream. The outer crusts with vanilla ice cream wasn't bad.  Unbelievable. Prosciutto pizza and they bring out cheese with arugula on it. The manager even double checked the order.

G-1NvEhjRDm9CwMcrOt0Lw.text: Evo is a fine Italian restaurant. The ambiance is really nice, you can dress causal or dressy.  I started off with the meatballs. They were amazing and our waiter told us that the chef spent months perfecting the flavours. I'm not sure what types of meats were in the meatballs but they were super tender and practically melts in your mouth.   For my entree I had the chilli shrimp .. very tasty, had pasta, sauteed shrimp, chilli, a mint flavour and had a nice spice flavour at the end of each bite. Very flavourful.  For dessert I had the brown butter baby cake which you have to order 20 minutes ahead of time. It's very tasty and sounds exactly what it is, a small cake and I assume they use butter and mix it in with the cake with whip cream on the side and powdered sugar with raspberries on top. I love the crunch on top of the cake and how soft it is inside.   Overall all it's really good... average price is 25 a person

pWU0Mc2n-ARqiibDSoNiFA.text: My biggest dislike about this restaurant is the noise level! I was literally having to yell in order for people sitting across from me to hear me. It didn't help that we were seated right next to the open kitchen so we constantly heard the clanging of dishes. They really should install some sound insulation here. It would improve the dining experience so much!  Food was also just okay to me. I got the calamari appetizer and the EVO salad. The calamari was not fried, which was a surprise but I still enjoyed it. The EVO salad was not great. The charred kale and Brussels sprouts were interesting, but the kale was literally like eating dry kale chips and I just was not into it for an entire bowl of it. I was searching for the Brussels sprout pieces bc those weren't as dry, but they were few and far between. The balsamic dressing on it was a touch too sour for my liking and I was cringing at the sourness in some of my bites. I liked the pine nuts and other bits that were mixed into the salad.   Based on the food I *might* come again but based on the ambience it's a no for me bc I prefer restaurants where I can easily talk to my dining companions.

ItHM2seC97oZ05nxUKtzNg.text: A friend and I attended a wine tasting in the neighborhood. Afterwards, being hungry we stopped into EVO for dinner.  First let me say the atmosphere is warm, swanky and inviting. We were greeted with a smile and seated at a booth per our request. Chloe was our server and she was really great and very smiley which I appreciate. We started with the mussel cioppino app she suggested which was fantastic, great flavor that keeps you dipping your bread in the sauce. We decided to share two dishes and chose the Lobster carbonara with gnocchi and the Lasagna which is served in it's own skillet, great presentation and bonus, it keeps the dish nice and hot. Both were really great. Being a seafood lover, the Lobster was my favorite and a don't miss in my book.  Even after all that Chloe enticed us to splurge on dessert. We shared the Brown Butter Babycake! OMG! This was so good, served with a creme anglaise and fresh raspberries. You need to allow 25 minutes for this but Chloe checked on us at the perfect time to order it so there was no need to worry. During our dinner the manager stopped by to make sure we were enjoying everything as well. This was a really nice night and we had a great time and left stuffed. We'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lobster Carbonara with gnocchi ! So Yummy!

iT8H7kVFVekBIEJh02Ojyw.text: So with 2 out of town guests in tow, we returned to EVO to celebrate our anniversary and it was just great. This was a MUCH better experience than our previous one. The staff was about as pleasant and helpful as humanly possible. Along with our server, everyone made us feel special and showed us how happy they were that we chose them to celebrate our anniversary. All 4 of us thoroughly enjoyed our dinners (pasta bolognese, stuffed pork chop, chili shrimp pasta and one other that I forgot). The whole evening was just right and we will most certainly be returning more often. Thank you EVO!

The service was excellent including the manager coming by and checking on our meal twice. Parking is easy and free in the lot outside of the restaurant. We'll be back!

Food is creative and excellent. The staff is  warm ,welcoming  and very attentive. Keep up the good work Mark M

ICI1RYUhko4tLVvcFHOQxA.text: We went to Evo for dinner on a Sunday evening.  I ordered the Chicken Milanese but the waiter informed me that they were out of that dish.  It seemed strange that they were out of the Chicken Milanese given the relatively simple ingredients, but I found something else to order.  After ordering, another couple was seated at the table next to us.  We were almost done with our meals when the table next to us was served.  One of the people next to us was served the Chicken Milanese.  At this point I was frustrated since that is what I had wanted and tried to order.  The food we did end up having was pretty good and would otherwise deserve a 4 star review, but this left a bad taste in my mouth that the waiter told me the restaurant was out of the dish when they clearly weren't.  When we got the bill, they provide the recommended tip amounts which is pretty standard.  However, they base these amounts on the after tax amount.  I get that this is a minor point (typically only a couple dollars difference), but the tip amount should be shown pre-tax.  Once we got home, I had an email from open table (we booked the reservation on open table) stating that we missed the reservation.  While not a big deal, just an annoyance to have to fix that with open table.

0fQGzKn3caN3pK4FMGS_gw.text: Got recommended to try this place out..heard they had a amazing salad. We got seated by the friendly hostess and was told it was thier pizza and wine special night which was good to know off the bat. The famous evo salad was too oily.l for my preference. The salad leafs/kale were just too wet for my liking. It would have been amazing if it wasn't over-dressed..Not pictured were the mussels. The fries are amazing and came out pipping warm and were delicious. 3 stars.

lNwjxkqPC4oqsEOKC2Rbyg.text: We went here Christmas Eve to have dinner. The customer service was great considering it was busy that night. We had ordered the eco burger and truffle fries and the lasagna both were extremely good. Will definitely come back for more.

iCyQKjKS62-w3CQkzy9vLg.text: Went to Evo tonight for dinner! We had an amazing meal and a great server named Isaiah! The food took a little long so Isaiah brought us a free dessert. The butter cake was so amazing! All the food was amazing! Great experience and we will for sure be back!

cJKIDp4XGuiQrKvj1qsvEA.text: When you have a rare night out with the husband and you drop $140 on a crappy dinner. :(  This was our first date night since we had a baby and we heard great things about EVO so we decided to take advantage of Restaurant Week. Appetizers were good. I had panzanella salad and hubby had grilled octopus. We both liked our dishes.  Hubby had the chili shrimp pasta for his entree and I had the cace de pepe (sp?). I was worried about the egg yolk because I'm usually not a fan but that ended up being the least of my worries. I have never had this pasta before but saw it on a cooking show so I knew it was supposed to have lots of black pepper. But this was ridiculous. And we were super excited to have fresh pasta. But both our pastas were dry and tough. Husband's shrimp was overcooked. I asked for extra parmesan and the server acknowledged that the pasta was dry and she would tell the chef. ???? She brought extra parmesan but our dishes were still only half eaten. She didn't ask if anything was wrong.   Desserts were okay. Brown butter cake was actually very good but the bottom was burnt. Our other dessert was some sort of custard which I didn't really care for.  Cocktails were tasty but weak.  As you can see on my other reviews I rarely leave bad reviews. But for a restaurant of this caliber and price point, this is unacceptable. We weren't looking for free food or anything but an acknowledgment and apology would have been great at the very least especially when she knows the food wasn't good. An offer to replace our dishes with something else would have been better.   We won't be back.

xK0QC7FCkJU5nzyLr_Ca-g.text: The food was amazing, drinks were great but best part was the people. We had our dinner here for a bachelorette party and had so much fun. Thank you again to the manager for a great night

_cME4k4trcgKBcMoRi_F1Q.text: Awesome food AND service!  The vibe is intimate and somewhat romantic, but still low key. The pastas were super fresh and homemade.  I got the squid ink seafood pasta and it was to die for! So flavorful, with a generous serving of large fresh shrimp and calamari. The dish had a tinge of spice, but not too much (i'm not big on spiciness)! I was really impressed. I also was one of those annoying customers who decided to try to change my order after it was already put in... and the entire staff was unbelievably nice and accommodating about it!! They made sure I got what I wanted. Even the bread here was amazing - it was served with a pesto-style sauce and goat cheese. Yum. The table next to us ordered an amazing looking lobster carbonara dish and looked pretty pleased with their meals. Overall, a great place. I still regret not tipping way more than 20%, because they were so accommodating.  Will definitely be back.

ZOy5P4xsP_O6tBEOVEPsdQ.text: Ribeye's are BOMB! Very Attentive staff and quiet, chill and relaxed atmosphere. Will definitely be back again.

3v9upqlKWhtR4PQhIveLlQ.text: I went to this restaurant for the first time in 2013 since a friend of a friend worked here at the time. They have a good atmosphere with an easy going crowd and very laid back casual luxury feel. They have great happy hour and specials. All the staff there as well as management seems to be very on point as well as timely/fair with their customers. In my opinion this is a successful business but if it were closer to Scottsdale Road they would have a lot more customers. Also, if you like late night food they are literally one of the only non fast food restaurants within literally miles besides The W room service that can offer that to my knowledge. Give this place a shot if you want to try a new happy hour or dinner

jLSBf_xl2LRD2qrsvKhN9g.text: Have gone here a few times with my wife they have really good food and a fun happy hour

_-zIRSTb_hUsgy8fFsdusg.text: I heard about Evo from a local PBS food show and was immediately incensed by the thought of a grilled lobster tail served with gnocchi in a carbonara sauce.  It was an interesting experience but maybe didn't quite live up to expectations.   Evo is located in a sweetly cute little building in Old Town Scottsdale. We made reservations same-day for late evening and were seated as soon as we arrived (and 15 minutes early) so we were off to a great start, but then we sat for 15 minutes before anyone approached our table. Throughout the night the service was just iffy - minimal attention although we weren't ignored. I might as well get the other two big issues out too:  the acoustics were AWFUL - it was incredibly loud and you could only hold a conversation if you talked/yelled. It was about 2/3 full when we were there and it's hard to imagine it being louder. The other issue was that we were seated nearer the kitchen and the ventilation system needs some work. At times smoke billowed like clouds into the dining room so heavily that waitstaff waved their hands in front of their faces.   So let's talk about the food. Good - overall not great. We started with two appetizers - either on their own strong but not so good together. I wish the waitress had provided a little guidance.  We ordered the Focaccia Rustica - a thin bread layered with marcapone and Brie and drizzled with honey. It was a big serving, very tasty but pretty fatty and rich.  All of that was good but the second appetizer was the Raviolo - a big ricotta stuffed ravioli served in a bowl swimming in brown butter and topped with pancetta. Also very good, very fatty, and very rich. The two together were just too much but either on its own would be good - and between the two the focaccia was excellent!  Hubby had a Caesar Salad - very bland and boring with no skill put into it - tasted like a bagged salad.   For entrees the three of us each tried something different. Hubby had lasagna and he thought it was just ok.  BF had the Fettuccine Alfredo with shrimp - he said it was pretty tasty. I had the lobster tail with gnocchi. I really liked the lobster but the gnocchi were pan-fried maybe a bit too long and they were tough not pillowy or tender. All three dishes were served warm not hot. Overall just ok.   We skipped dessert and headed to Creamistry instead.   It's hard to rate a meal like this - there were high and low points but mostly just middle of the road points. They were actually more of a 3.5. Maybe a quieter night of the week would be better?

z6h5xexrlitvT86H8NDBfw.text: We popped in here on a Friday night, pretty late, like around 9:00 PM but had a wonderful meal and great service. If you are in the mood for good food, but later in the evening, EVO is open until 2 AM! It was pretty quiet at this time but we assumed it was because a) It was past the normal dinner time and b) everyone ditches Scottsdale when our temps are 110+ degrees.   I ordered their Coppola Pinot Grigio on tap to start and it was refreshing and just what I had been craving. To start, we split their Focaccia Rustica which was filled with brie, mascarpone, sea salt, and local honey. Holy heaven, this was AMAZING. I usually don't love 'sweet' dishes for dinner but seriously, this was the perfect combo of sweet and savory. Next, we split the EVO salad and i've been craving it ever since! It was filled with crispy brussels sprouts, kale, chevre, pear, pancetta, pine nuts, and balsamic. Seriously, you MUST get this if you choose to dine at EVO.   For my entree, I went simple and had their bolognese. That too, was incredible!   To cleanse our palates, we finished our meal with homemade limoncello (their Check-In offer on Yelp)! It was the perfect ending to a great dining experience. We'll absolutely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Homemade Limoncello if you check-in on Yelp!
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious bolognese
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Honey and Brie flatbread...seriously the perfect combo of salty and sweet!

Sp1cW2iq8RQjQMMJfyKO5Q.text: My husband and I came here to celebrate my birthday and we saw this place on "Check Please!" And it did not disappoint. For appetizers we shared the meatballs and the bone marrow. They were so delicious! The meatballs were juicy and flavorful and the bone marrow was so silky and buttery. For entrees my husband ordered the fennel sausage pasta and I ordered the Chile shrimp pasta. The pasta was so fresh and the sauces were delicious we were pleased. And please please please order the butter cake for dessert it is a must! Try to save room for it. That cake was one of the best I have ever eaten! The service was amazing and the atmosphere was lively yet romantic.

PEHDfdnJo_AkOyyaUvAuRQ.text: Decided to try Evo out yesterday for Happy Hour and I can tell you it won't be my last time. The food was great. The ambience was fun, classy, cozy and romantic. Our waiter Tony was awesome! He recommended pretty much everything my husband and I ordered. This place is a hidden gem! My husband and I split the truffle fries, mushroom flatbread and the spaghetti. I had the Peaches and Dreams martini and my husband had the Tito's Island Mule. The limoncello they have is also fantastic! For dessert Tony recommended the brown butter baby cake. All of the above was so yummy!   Just go try it!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Save room for brown butter babycake! Next time I won&#39;t be sharing
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy Hour spaghetti and mushroom pizza. Tastes yummy!
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Back side of menu. Don&#39;t forget to save room for dessert!

MOiYQ33CWmGJOT7JAfgTHA.text: Good food, nice wine. Service is excellent, Isiah was just great. Gnocchi was good, a little over cooked. Overall experience and atmosphere was wonderful. Definitely recommend.

MHFYSShhXB3TEjyiYMyzXQ.text: Happy Hour from 4-7 pm. We came here because my son wanted bolognes even. I looked up pasta on Yelp and EVO Had some nice reviews. We got their half hour before Happy Hour was done.  Nice restaurant decor and ambiance. With my checkin, they treated me to a shot of limoncello cordial. Then we ordered.  EVO burger was a big and juicy burger with roasted tomatoes and perfectly seasoned. It came with truffle fries, which are to die for ($10).  Truffle fries were crisp and accented with shaved Parmesan and topped with a splash of truffle salt and truffle salt ($5?).  Pasta bolognese a 3 star experience in my opinion. The sauce was bland compare to the big flavor of the burger and the truffle fries.  The wood-fired pizza oven yielded a nice mushroom pizza.   I learned a valuable lesson today. When I go to a restaurant, I should probably announce to my wait staff that I am allergic to walnuts, cashews and almonds. When I asked our serve what was on the bruschetta, she didn't realize that I had allergy concerns. She listed, "goat cheese, fig jam and onions, and did not mention almonds, so I thought it was a go!" When it arrived it looked pretty, but when I bit into it, I could feel the almonds, and thus, had to take Benadryl. When she checked on us next, I explained that I didn't realize the bruschetta had almonds, she returned it and asked if we wanted something else. We got an extra order of truffle fries, which we proceeded to polish off.  We enjoyed our meal thorough albeit the almonds, With the great happy hour prices, the four of us left filled and satisfied for the grand price of $11 per person including tip.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta was goat cheese, onion and fig jam
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wood fired mushroom pizza
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. RVO burger and truffle fries

CL1rwdXVvEiqWn0yy8ryHQ.text: Cute hidden restaurant in Old Town Scottsdale.  Big open bar with one TV. The food and service were good. Their online menu needs to be updates because the prices on some items have increased.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lobster Carbonara, pancetta was really salty, a heavy dish but it was still good.
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Squid Ink Chitarra, only had shrimp and calamari, sauce was a bit acidic but is nice and light

akxlxoJ0X5Ay2epOC29hTQ.text: We ordered a few appetizers, and to my surprise the cauliflower dish was the best. I normally hate cauliflower! I think it was baked with cheese and tasted really good. The eggplant and fried cheese ball thing came with very good tomato-based sauce; would recommend.  Olives were warm and weird. You should skip out on that.  For my main dish, I got the kale salad and the leaves were baked like kale chips! The chicken, raisins, cheese and everything tastes very good together. Would def come again.  Atmosphere is a bit dark, good music, good service. I think our server was Feras spelled weird haha, but funny with high energy. Loved it. Pizza + wine combo = $20

nISAkDC-fnBUxkmXQrwwcw.text: Date night for the wife and I on a Friday evening.  We like to patron the non-chain restaurants.   We arrived at 7:00 on a Friday night,  moderately busy.  Small little restaurant so the noise level is a little high but simmered down after happy hour at approx 7:30. The hostess that sat us was very friendly and engaging. we like that.  Remember restaurants, the hostess is the first person representing your establishment.   Upon or seating we greeted by our waitress. she kind of seemed disconnected.  We started with the Steak Bruschetta as an appetizer.  The shaved meat was excellent nice and tender, good flavors.  As for dinner...  My wife ordered a Lobster Carbonara which was excellent. The mixtures of the gnocchi and pancetta were excellent mixed with the seafood flavors.  I ordered the Squid Ink Chitarra.  The presentation was good. Took a twist of the squid ink pasta and the flavors of the slightly spicy sauce and cheeses were incredible. However...... When I shelled my first Mussel I noticed a funky smell.  It had the smell of a dirty aquarium.  this was not isolated to one mussel all the mussels had the same smell.  Took a few minutes to garner the attention of the waitress and was returned,  she advised that I would get a new bowl without the mussels and extra shrimp.  I received a new bowl of my dish approximately 10 minutes later. while I was eating my dish one of the other waitresses bumped into my table while serving another table close by. she bumped it pretty hard disrupting our meal, no acknowledgment or apology. Kind of hard to enjoy your food after the fact.  We did order the brown butter baby cake which does take about 25 minutes to prepare.  this was quite good.    In the end, the food was good,  no acknowledgment from management or comped in any way for the bad dish, which kind of put a damper on things. I just wanted to enjoy the evening with my wife, so I didn't raise a stink.  I will not be back nor recommend

4fU1sz05IjCxT_O8d20Tpg.text: I love it's open late. It's nice to not have to go to Denny's. The food was okay for the price.

gauaJf2EmkmA07m6A6Vgog.text: Service was really friendly and we didn't have to wait long for food or drink. The water was filtered not tap but not bottled. Prices were reasonable for the quality of the food. The menu options were unique which was refreshing. They do not have a Chianti on the entire wine list which shocked me for an Italian restaurant. The menu typeface is significantly too small and the lighting is very dim. Noise is moderate but fine overall. Happy I went but probably wouldn't go back.

hXANF4pq-AtX2EBdH6s11Q.text: This place knocks my socks off every time I come. it is a cute Italian restaurant in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale. Perfect spot for date night at dusk on the patio with your boo,  or you can bring a group of your girls and chill at the bar. And if you're in the mood for late-night bites at around midnight, definitely check the spot out but nonetheless,  the  food is delicious, and the drinks are amazing! Last time I dined there,  I got the Risotto.. so decadent,  so delicious.  But too pricey for the small portion, but with high-quality ingredients you get what you pay for. Or I may be just greedy.  But I will definitely be back.  They have happy hour from 4 to 6, so take advantage of that.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Me and Mr on the patio at Evo enjoying date night

a6F8Mg1OQ32bW-ygimherw.text: Doing my best to get this lake to 5 stars! I tell all my friends about it! Haha, they have the best pizza, desert, and pasta! I usually get the Margherita pizza with pepperoni, butter baby cakes, and sometimes the lasagne as a second entree when I feel like being a pig! Haha

mqXU2ERi_jt8kmbBuQEnhQ.text: Well my opinion has changed.... Still love the fact evo is open til 130 for dinning. However, our food was not good when we dined at 1130. Ordered the calamari steak and belly appetizers.   Calamari was over cooked, rubbery and hard to chew.  The pork belly was very dry and tough, served a pear I could barely cut!  Had to ask for more sauce to try to loosen it up but pretty much lost interest in it after dropping my knife trying to fight it in my mouth.    I'll stick to ordered only from the wine list from now on

BXzJxU4x_5VgcSCQ8eEeZg.text: Wonderful, home-made pastas and sauces.  A party of eight sampled across the menu and everyone was delighted.  Focaccia appetizer is a one of kind!  Calamari is broiled, spicy and delicious.  Decent beer and wine selection.   Our server was informed, helpful, social and fun (wish o could remember her name!)  The only downside, and I hope I'm not being petty was a 15" wait on a reservation.   Had booked a party of 7 for an 1830 seating around 1400 that afternoon.  Called 45" before our reservation, asking to add one more; was advised "no problem".  When we arrived, was told that "adding an extra person completely changed our seating plans" and we would therefore need to wait 15".  Were indeed seated at 1845, but what the hey!   The table at which we were seated was empty when we arrived.  Telling the truth ("hey, last party lingered longer than expected"), or offering us something would have been expected, not the two-step run around...

zZQQi4bNfNdyjCaOxfLQSQ.text: Such a great time at Evo!  Food is amazing and service could not be better. Thank you!

azum0pFm_Xz3XC4g34H_IQ.text: Solid every time. Great late night menu. Staff is awesome.

7S_ASHRx4jCGpVUc_ICQJg.text: Extremely family unfriendly.  Open tables outside and in.  The hostess made it quite clear that "there just wasn't' anything available."  The demeanor was very exclusive and unfriendly.  Our family has dinner out every Friday and enjoy the social aspects of dinner in the town.  Unfortunately we could not get past the door.  We ended up eating at Tarbell's which was fantastic!  Food is 1/2 the experience she failed miserably at the other 1/2.  I strongly do not recommend EVO

ag5cUtKb641YjS6gm-3zCw.text: Pomodoro sauce was amazing! Fantastic menu at amazing prices. Definitely satisfying for a late night meal. Dominic whipped up drinks to perfection.

db0fO7JGJ0ePflLf85nWOg.text: Must say I was disappointed by this restaurant. We went there as part of a tour. As I sit at my table I can see into the kitchen where no one is wearing a hairnet (one guy had a napkin tied around his head and one woman had sunglasses sitting on her head, but not sure those count) and the staff standing in the wait station section look completely miserable.   The house charred salad was burnt...nothing like the taste of burned brussel sprouts to ruin your dining experience (still burping those up-yummy). I understand that they pre-made it for the big group, but don't burn it. The appetizer sized pasta we had was completely overcooked so when you tried to cut it the pasta smooshed and the filling squirted out the sides.  In Scottsdale where there are several hundred eating establishments to choose from, that quality is not going to get you very far. If you don't want to do the your pricing, then don't, but if you agree to it make sure your food is up to standard.

mx_T16O0cBKoXxR22Lt4Sw.text: Best happy hour ever.  Try the delicious tender homemade meatballs! Outdoor seating and long happy hour.4-7. I don't think the servers are that attentive or helpful from the hostess to the bartender- but since it is only happy hour I guess I am still happy with it? But how great would it be if they really cared I was there!!. The bartender did not know what the cocktail of the day was going to be and that was after it had been open for 45 minutes.   The Evo hamburger is one of the best I have had .  It comes with fries and we split it so we can try something else but it would be a full meal for one.The bruschetta bread board looked amazing. I would not try the arancini balls of risotto again. Nothing special. Check in on yelp and get a free shot of limoncello! Yum!!!

xv3zinrJRxNhxv6rAzOTiA.text: This review is overdue. I booked dinner here for my birthday after enjoying the bar on my first visit.   The service was great, and they took the time to personalize the menus at the table with my name and the occasion, which was an incredible, thoughtful, beautiful touch. (I posted a picture.)  I had the lobster risotto, which was great. Huge chucks of lobster and creamy, perfect risotto.   I love the cocktails here. My idea of a perfect bar is once where you can tell the bartender I like drinks that are [insert whatever description you like], so make something and surprise me. The staff behind the bar at EVO can do just that and hit the nail on the head.   You can't go wrong here, great spot for drinks or dinner or both. And a lovely place to celebrate an event.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. They personalized the menus on the table for my birthday dinner! I was AMAZED. Such a kind, classy touch.

PQRBQckLxaUM_ZLBClsh1A.text: I went back over the weekend with a few girl friends and I just have to say I am (once again) thoroughly impressed! It was pretty busy on Saturday (they let us know they were running 30 minutes behind), but the staff are so friendly and accommodating it's amazing! They have fun with the patrons and also each other while maintaining professionalism and urgency when the hustle and bustle was on and poppin!! Haha. We had a great time with the staff, Dominick (sp?) in particular was a riot! Everyone enjoyed their meals, myself included. Love the penny check-in shots they offer via Yelp! Definitely a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great night at Evo for my friend&#39;s birthday :)

El8IyitdrtA1MJIinwuXwg.text: Happy hour time (4-7pm)! How could you not refuse good food and service?! Here's the quick low down. Bruschetta: beef butter, asparagus, and some dried sweet fruits/raisins of some sort (special of the day). Pizza: Funghi (mushrooms). Chicken sandwich (with chips). Cocktails! ;) Party in my mouth!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta with beef fat
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken sandwich
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Funghi

kE5h4-bl6ieq8RDhe-Hfww.text: The food here is delicious, and the service is courteous and prompt. But at 7 pm on a Friday, it was unbearably noisy (90-95 dB). It's not possible to have a quiet conversation, and I feel bad for the workers. Prolonged exposure to that noise level is injurious to hearing!

ddVE1ibkz766cl_2hSVyCg.text: This place is awesome. Dom the bartender is great and its always good to see him. Would highly recommend, especially for late night.

DfxEop0h5h9ijns6rMOLEA.text: A great happy hour spot in Scottsdale. Really good specials that go until 7:00 pm. They have $3 beers, $4 well drinks, $5 wines and $6 cocktails.   My go-to menu items have become the fried risotto balls (so good!) and the pizza. I've tried the Funghi Pizza - it's pretty good even though I hate mushrooms. They also have a regular pepperoni pizza on their happy hour menu. Their bruschetta changes daily and is hit or miss - the first time I ordered it, it was great. The second time... not so much. The handmade pasta is good too.   Overall a great value - I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Funghi Pizza
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Arancini - Fried Risotto balls
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy Hour Menu

62hTrA1g7zACZYuKsL314A.text: I never give a 1 star review but tonight EVO forced me to. They have only 4 main dishes, which is already not that much, they ran out of three of them, so I ordered a pasta and the poor guy comes out of the kitchen after 20 m telling me there was no pasta, so I order meatballs and they ran out of it, of course. My friend gets her pasta first and at the end her salad.  We ordered some bread with pesto and when we realized it wasn't pesto we asked the guy what happened and he said that they ran out of pesto and so the tried to make a similar sauce ?!  At the end we tried our best to get out of the restaurant to go have an actual dinner somewhere else. The only thing that made this a 1 star and not a 0 star review was the super kind waiter named Tony who tried with unremitting hope to save the night paying for our dessert! It was appreciated by still left the restaurant with the stomach empty.  They need some organization in the kitchen and with food delivery

EMEoLZOuEMN5ciCVFnO3_A.text: Had a good experience, waiter was on point. He was also very charming. Loved the atmosphere, def will recommend to a friend.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Birthday dinner done right!

qfHz0UJKBDnljLupI9qrdA.text: Definitely one of my favorite happy hour places! Love everyone here and the service! Love taps!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Limoncello on tap! Really!?
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Homemade Limoncello!!!! On tap really!!!

EhRcOkaTH-1-xWxFPxWptQ.text: My fiancee and I recently moved to Scottsdale, and we have been busy trying every restaurant we hear about. 10best.com had a list of the best late-night eats in Scottsdale, and EVO was numero uno, so we were excited to give it a try. It was pretty dead when we came in around 9:30pm (understandable). We got beer and wine and ordered the bread with pesto and ricotta to start. It was good, but I am starting to find it troubling how many restaurants are now charging for bread (or chips and salsa at Mexican places). My fiancee ordered the ravioli and I had the squid-ink pasta. The first (and only other time) I ever had squid-ink pasta was in the Old Italy district in San Diego, and remains one of the best meals I have ever eaten. I should have realized that EVO would not compare, but I had high hopes. I was sorely disappointed. The pasta was just a slimy mess with a weird sour taste. The crab was just as bad, tasting very funky. Everything just tasted like it was cooked in dirty tap water. My fiancee said her ravioli was good, but the dish is only one ravioli. My heart sank when the dinners were brought. I felt so bad that my fiancee's dinner consisted of one ravioli. She was finished before the server had a chance to come back to ask how everything was tasting. Then she had to just sit there while I forced down the rest of my dinner. Oh, and a note to the managers: charging for bread is one thing. But there is no reason you should be selling PBR for $6. On a plus side, the service was decent...

ct22oKp1sdxIAFLfFgOG4g.text: Great food and excellent staff!    Serves food till 1:30am.   Highly recommended checking this place out.

tI8AjbIVCzmsvjby2M6qtg.text: This is a great place for a birthday dinner and/or date night. The food is phenomenal and the drinks are great. I imagine the bar area could get quite busy around happy hour.   I was able to make my reservations online which I loved. However, when trying to call the restaurant I noticed they didn't have call waiting. That was a little inconvenient.  Honestly, other than that - we had a great time. Our server was Jarness (not sure if that's the spelling) and he made the night. He made our visit fun and personalized.  I had the daily pizza - which is a must try so I've heard and it is. I can't wait to go back!

RDasSFlbJzGUxYdPjkPzTw.text: We went back to EVO for our 10th anniversary dinner. Review from earlier in the week below. So glad we returned. Beef bruschetta was savory. The meatball appetizer was incredibly delicious. For dessert we had the Brown Butter Babycake and it was phenomenal. Also tried the Flouless Chocolate Torte. It was dense & rich. Many thanks to Nick, the owner, and Shelby, the manager, who both checked on us often. The service from Tony & CJ was impeccable.   I will be back in town next month and plan to return.   From our first visit with Arizona Food Tours:  Exceptionally delicious. The EVO salad was incredible with crispy brussels sprouts, kale, pinenuts, and goat cheese.  The risotto ball with marinara was probably the best marinara sauce we have ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flourless chocolate torte
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brown butter Babycake. Yummy dessert
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. EVO salad

gdWlv2TdQX8JQc1e5SkyDw.text: Excellent service... the food was phenomenal!! Worth checking out! Ordered multiple app items including the meatballs, arrancini and flatbread that was incredible. Definitely coming back in the near future.

xl_DYXZyhG61f5lT2bsbog.text: Omg! I had the best ravioli I think I have ever had here. The serving is one big ravioli which hits you as odd but one is all you need! It was a ravioli from heaven with egg yoke and pancetta perfect combination of salt and rich! Worth your time!

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ravioli

N_nNlWrA01GjHnUjSNvsNA.text: Lots of great modern Italian dishes, great service and a cool atmosphere.  Nice date place for a fun night a little off the beaten path but still close enough to Scottsdale nightlife to walk.  I had drinks and dinner.  Bartender suggested wines for us and let us try some to decide what we wanted.  Band that played after dinner and was really good.  Was there on a Sunday night.  I think they have entertainment Fri, Sat and Sun after dinnertime.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fun night at EVO.

s5GvvkUtaiK4bxdyxHw5oQ.text: Not being "twenty somethings" when my wife and I opened the door and were blasted by the noise from the restaurant we should have turned around and left. It's an engaging interior, but the noise level was, for us,  painful. The best comment I can make is that the $5 happy hour wines were great value. We shared a salad with goat cheese (delicious but almost entirely absent), pecans (actually a few slivers) and a "honey dressing" which, when we asked for extra, turned out to be.. well, honey. I then had orecchiette with fennel sausage. The sausage was OK, but the pasta was cooked to a rubbery texture and was drowned in a thin chili sauce. My wife's pappardelle with Bolognese sauce lacked any meaty flavor and was so bland that it  might have come from chef Boyardee. It too sat on pasta so over -cooked that she could not twirl it on her fork. It simply fell to pieces. Given that the prices are on a par with some  of the finer Italian restaurants in Scottsdale, it was terribly disappointing.

v6w6qgX00pEM4xltCtkmxQ.text: Dom is the man. They have amazing drinks and an awesome bar tender. My friend and I went for a couple drinks after a long day at work, and those golden curls were like halos floating in to save the day! Pretty sure my grapefruit basil was singing the "hallelujah chorus!" I'll be back!

sUBpH7grPoPh_h4vZ5DMPg.text: Ok, as I said in my last review, I've had very different experiences at EVO. One of the interesting things about them is how frequently their menu changes... which can be good or bad, depending on your tastes. (The things you like are never there for long, but then, there are always new things to try.) This is definitely something they pride themselves on, and it gives them an opportunity to try new things.   On my last trip, I had trouble finding much that didn't feel overly trendy with far-reaching ingredients that just didn't sound appetizing. I tried again yesterday and found the new menu delightful, with a much better mix of standby favorites and adventurous meals. The new menu includes a great steak and a salmon that sounded delicious! Because they were doing a $2 pasta special (what a deal!!! Though understandably one night only) for their 2-yr anniversary, we decided to go with the EVO mainstay (which was fantastic!) and a few glasses of tap wine. (The tap pinot noir was actually really great! I don't know much about tap wines, but I was a fan.) The bruschetta we ordered to start was a pesto caprese that was wonderful - well dressed with great flavor and really set the meal off right. While we didn't try any of the new entrees, we will certainly try to get back before the menu rotates again, because they sounded fantastic!

RjoNkxN8lvTF71ZOnzUhTA.text: I'm giving them three stars because the wine selection was good, and the truffle fries were awesome.  Temper that with the following: I arrived at 4:05 and was the only person in the restaurant.  Service was excellent at that point.  Within about 30 minutes there were six other people at the bar and I was invisible.  There were now THREE bartenders...not one made eye contact or checked to see if I wanted another glass of wine despite the fact that my glass was empty.  I left 20% but won't be back or recommend EVO.  It's just a J-O-B and that doesn't work in the restaurant business in this town.

M9rOjiynx0_TyZdBtSDZtA.text: We went here for a Kentucky Derby party and had a wonderful experience! The bartenders were attentive and made awesome drinks (mint julips and Jack/Coke).  We ordered a Margherita Pizza which came out quickly and was delicious. The owner gladly brought me an extra side of marinara (which the pizza didn't need, I just wanted more!!) that was larger than any side I could have ever expected; very much appreciated!! :)  The ambiance was very cool, each vase on each table had a unique live flower in it, and the chandeliers were very artsy and enjoyable to view.  We will def. be back for a more romantic dinner experience than just a casual lunch/horse-racing viewing.  It was great!

V5JrxdGhihoA1-uB2dDhWQ.text: Not Good! Not Right!  My wife, daughter, son-in-law and I ate here for his birthday. First, on a Sunday in downtown Scottsdale at 5:30pm, and the restaurant wasn't even a third full (during snowbird season). That should tell you something. My wife and daughter ordered Chicken Picatta with vegetables instead of the pasta. Son-in-law ordered Bolognese and I ordered the Heirloom Tomato pasta with meatballs. When dinner came, my wife's and daughter looked nothing like Chicken Picatta but more like pasta primavera. Both said it wasn't hot. They questioning the dish and we found that it was eggplant instead. Both were taken away. My son-in-law ate his and said it was fine. He was probably just hungry.  Mine, the pasta was stuck together and the meatballs were cold. Not room temperature but refrigerator cold. Yes the three dishes were all remade but we ate at different times. Don't waste your money!  Better restaurants out there.

xMLY_MLDgfi0fpouwJh1_Q.text: New brunch menu...? Yes and yes. Do this. Order the Eggs Benny. Jam to the music. Drink a bloody marry. Do all these things.

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jesus Christ. This is a religious experience. Crabby eggs Benny is as close to the ethereal plane as I will ever be. Eat this.

I0NmwslUAguERltWbXjxKw.text: My experience was similar to Jessica J.  We were a party of 6 and went on a Thursday for 6 p.m. dinner.  The food was fine.  Everyone enjoyed the Evo kale salad.  The Bolognese was great.  If I were to rate the food for the price I would say 4 stars.  But for me the atmosphere is just as important as the food, in fact, I would  prefer just "ok" food but great table and service.  We arrived at 6 and they only had a few tables occupied.  Since we were a party of 6 we asked for a round table and the hostess told us they were reserved.  One of the 2 rounds was set with silverware but the second had nothing on it.  I know there are situations were the table is reserved for later and would not have given us time to dine before the other party arrived and I'm fine with that.  We were seated at two tables pushed together making it difficult to have a group conversation.  Both tables sat unseated for the entire time we were there.  It was noisy and there was music in the bar which was fine but if we had been seated at the round table we would have been farther from the bar and it would have been easier to talk.  Our server had no idea what the daily specials were although he was attentive.  Worst part: Thursday night is Manicures and Martinis. The smell from the nail stations that were set up was very noticeable.  Totally not acceptable in a dining environment. I'm not sure what the health dept. would say to serving food while and filing nails.  We had dined the week of Superbowl with another group.  We were seated at the bigger table, the server was very helpful and knew the menu.  No manicure smell.  The noise level was not a problem but they weren't very busy.  Overall a good experience.

4OOy8ZPBuaCJkI5ghCSe8g.text: I've been to many bars throughout the city of Phoenix and Scottsdale and EVO is definitely one that tops the cake with their attentive, humorous and experienced bartenders. It's always a very positive and enjoyable experience from the food to the cocktails! JAKE IS AN AMAZING CRAFT COCKTAIL BARTENDER! With many specialty off the menu recipes up his sleeve to surprise you with! DOMINIC IS MY FAVORITE! Every time we order the charcuterie board he goes completely out of his way to make it quite the fusion of eclectic items....From Budweiser beer, limoncello shots, gelato, bone marrow, champagne flutes of left hand nitro stout, homemade gelato, to sour pezz candy in the middle! If and when you make it into EVO ask for one of these two they are spectacular!!!! @kittencallie

photos.caption: Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of EVO - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1nWpIHL1oY6_EDON5dULeQ.text: The hostesses were friendly and we were seated promptly. Our waitress was a delight she took the time to answer all of our questions and explain the menu highlighting all of their specialties. The food arrived quickly and it was absolutely amazing. This was some of the best seafood, risotto, and freshly prepared pasta that we have ever had.

qQSH5FLRUm2EB64M-en3WA.text: Great new restaurant with fun drinks, good food and reasonable prices.

L1W3l5u_6Xj0canriHz5uQ.text: I adore this place! The food is always fresh, the cocktail & wine selection is amazing, the decor is romantic yet playful and the service is always on par. The happy hour is one of my favorite in Old Town. A must try!!!

pTeu9tZjYBIO7GURuyhq-Q.text: Came here with a restaurant.com certificate and it was great. I ordered a salad, wine, meatball appetizer, and pasta with a friend. It was good food. The service was great. The place is definitely a happening one and is busy. It was very nice and I will be back again.

44NrRa9cvxHBPtN2OrcfwQ.text: Went to Evo for the first time tonight! Great place and great food. Tony was by far one of the best waiters I have had. Thank you for the Great recommendations

lEHe-nKnBGVXq6pTHOq-aw.text: This place is amazing.  Great drinks,  great staff and amazing food served till 130 am!  This is my go to for a hand crafted cocktail and some delicious Alfredo!  Great job guys keep up the good work!

AZ-WS5vka_uERweU5yfheg.text: This place was delicious. Perfect date night location and service was great. Definitely coming back! EVO salad with shrimp, fried risotto balls, and mini donuts for desert...yum.

ZyIEd2EV1-XNIfr0Qmqvvg.text: If it wasnt for the dog in the bar I would have given it a 5  I have been here before but this sunday for lunch a guy came in carrying his dog, thankfully the bar tender said the dog couldnt run around.  However i dont feel comfortable about a doggy being IN the restaurant/bar.  Sorry gross. On a positive note..EVO salad is amazing.  Grapefruit basil drink is so good.

TB-vMGp6pVHNEr1yfjC2dQ.text: I went here on a Monday. I ordered the pork belly appetizer and the lobster risotto. The pork belly tasted good, but before I could finish the main course showed up. I hate that. The restaurant was far from full so they could have paced the meal better. The risotto was also good but I ran out of wine. It took them so long to come back to my table that I was already done. Bottom line: Above average food that is slightly overpriced with sub-par service.

bHZJfNC0xnbghqZKQOAPlw.text: I will say that this is my first restaurant in Scottsdale, so my rating can not be comparative. I can tell you that the staff are excellent. They were friendly , accommodating and whenever I see a restaurant with teamwork I know it is run well. I loved the menu and they had a fair amount of gluten free options. I personally just thought the food was fair. And because it is a restaurant, it has to bring the rating down a bit. They were excessive on sauces and the steak was not great. All in all, I enjoyed it but would choose something different next time.

U1cLtu6GkW8l4Qh2-TR-qw.text: The food at EVO leaves a lot to be desired. Nice menu that doesn't deliver.   Prices are high and the portions are small. Apps like chicken thigh is very tasty.however it is 1 small piece with a little mash and gravy. Bread which is basically free in most Italian places is $5. Pasta portions are small too. Did I mention the noise?

BBVADB7YmliMckjzGY2LiA.text: Fantastic atmosphere, drinks, and the wait staff was right on point!  Amazing time, thank you Evo!

jfHGlqDVqvsNexNJD74vUA.text: The atmosphere was quaint but cozy and comfortable.  Food was AMAZING!  The kale salad was off the hook..would definitely go back.

1f39-r1Q7zWn0pPqHz0y0w.text: Food was amazing! Their pizzas are a knock out and so were their mixed drinks. They have some great selections on the drinks and craft beers as well. Atmosphere is very nice. Has that modern feel with some warmth and class. We will be back for sure!

-RLHTs-SiVr52HYmoQmlGA.text: I have only been here once and that was enough for me, I'll never be back. Let me start off by saying I am a huge foodie and eat out way too much, and I have also worked in a restaurant in the past.  Evo was the worst service I have EVER had. I had my father and stepmother in town, and my sister and I had heard great things about Evo so we decided to take them there. It was a Saturday night. We had reservations. We were seated in a booth in the bar section. I have never been to a louder restaurant in my life! And I'm in my 20s, it takes a lot for me to consider something uncomfortably loud. After having been seated at our table for TWENTY minutes, with no one having stopped by to even bring us water, we had to get up and say something to the hostess. She was snappy and rude, saying that someone would be by. Another 5 minutes pass...no one has brought us water. We get up again. She says the same thing. Isn't even apologetic!! Another 5 minutes pass, NO ONE COMES BY. I'm not even exaggerating. We say something A THIRD TIME, and finally a waiter arrives who says he was just informed that we had sat down. And once again, not even apologetic. The service was atrocious. It was unreal. We really should have left at that point. On a lighter but at this point pointless note: The food was very good, Classic Italian dishes with a twist. If the service had been standard, never mind good, I would have gone back. However, the service was awful and I won't be back. I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone. And that's sad.

SbJDgi8dfa1_CrSA_jspVw.text: Due to reviews from yelp we discovered the location after 10pm and ordered their Arancini (fried risotto ball with meat sauce), and Italian wedding soup (homemade meatballs-fregola-arugula), and the EVO Salad (Brussels sprout, kale, Bosc pear, chevre, pancetta, balsamic,pine nuts). The food was spectacular in flavor and taste. Their service was okay. The location was pleasing and cool.  We would return...

lL_wPPIDYjodG-gM5SCINw.text: Had dinner last Sunday after a game. Very disappointing Yelpers. First sign empty tables, empty restaurants. Shared an EVO salad and I honestly had to say it was like eating dry leaves. Very little favors and odd texture. I am for adventure but it was more strange than good. Order the Oreccchiette. The sausage was over cooked and hard, but that was not the worst there were slices of Serrano chile with SEEDS. Who cooks with serano chile with there seeds??? My mouth was burning thinking this is very spicy Italian sausage until I started digging in the bowl and removing the chile with the seeds. Awful place and do Not recommend. Disappointing Scottsdale Yelpers.

az5LvCFmQOMhsvEyctWI4w.text: Great location and parking. Attentive staff. Very cute great place for date or small gatherings. Food high-quality, deliciously prepared, balanced and well executed.

JjBoiABgTgopawk8YV816g.text: Great menu. The scallops were amazing. Meatballs were great too. Fresh high quality ingredients.  Service was great.

1xoPHGII3SJdQWaNwhjQlQ.text: I went to EVO for the first time on New Year's Eve with 6 friends. They had a prefix menu for $45 that also came with a class of bubbly. All the dishes we had were amazing both health and for the meat lover. Our waitress could have been a little nicer she seemed like we were putting her out of her way and wasn't enjoying the evening. The vibes were cool and comfortable and very relaxed!

7KqbWQdedXIV3rlHJU6ICg.text: This may be a great spot for late night dining.  And the reviews are mostly favorable.  But for a fairly early dinner on a Wednesday, I will say I am just not that impressed.  The ambiance was cold, stark and strange.  The waiter was lacking any interest or passion for the job.  The food was so-so in a city that can boast so many outstanding Italian restaurants.  To sum it up, not to happy to have wasted time and money here and won't be back.
